texts.ru: Зухра женщина 31 года , замужем , имеет пятерых детей.Муж работает мастер по ремонту мобильных трубок.Сама Зухра директор рынка скота на Чайрухском базаре.Зухра вместе со своей семьёй занимается откормом и продажей скота.У неё сейчас 30 баранов.Во время мониторинга Зухра была на работе, поэтому на снимке её старший сын , который кормит баранов.Для увеличения оборотного капитала скота Зухра решила повторно получить кредит.
texts.en:
Zuhra G. is 31 year old and is married with five children. Her husband makes a living by fixing mobile phones. Zuhra is Director of Chakhrui cattle market. Together with her family, Zuhra raises and sells cattle. Now she has 30 sheep. During the monitoring Zuhra was at work, and we could only take a picture of her elder son giving fodder to the sheep. Zuhra is applying for a second loan in order to increase cash flow.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: raise and sell cattle

loans.name: Cristina Santos

texts.es:
La señora Cristina Santos B. D. R. tiene 73 años D. edad, vive en el distrito D. Salaverry, provincia D. Trujillo, departamento D. la Libertad.
No tiene estudios realizados (analfabeta), tiene 6 hijos cuya situación económica es independiente.
Cristina recién ha ingresado como socia.
Con el crédito D. 300 soles que recibió D. su Banco Comunal  “Las Triunfadoras D. Salaverry II”, que será cancelada en 4 meses, que será invertido para la compra D. materiales D. escritorio, por campaña escolar en la pequeña tienda en el cual venD. útiles escolares. Su negocio lo desarrolla en su casa.
Manifiesta que su negocio va generando poco a poco mayores ingresos; así mismo se apoya con los ingresos que percibe su esposo en su condición D. jubilado.
Cristina tiene como sueño ser propietaria D. una tienda D. abarrotes.
texts.en:
Cristina Santos B. D. R. is 73 years old, and lives in the Salaverry district, province of Trujillo, in the La Libertad department. She never attended school and is illiterate; she has 6 children who are all economically independent. Cristina has recently become a bank member. With the loan of 300 PEN that she received from her Communal Bank “Las Triunfadoras D. Salaverry II” [“The Triumphant from Salaverry II”], that will be paid in full in 4 months, she will invest in the purchase of school supplies; due to the of the upcoming school year she will be selling these supplies in her small school supply shop. Her business is run out of her home. Cristina discloses that her business is generating higher profits little by little; in this manner she supports herself with the income that she obtains given that her husband is retired. Cristina’s dream is to be the owner of a grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase school supplies.

loans.name: Arturo

texts.es: Arturo tiene 48 años de edad, vive con su hija, yerno y nietos. La casa donde viven es de su hija. Desde hace 7 años se dedica a brindar servicios de transporte en su propio motocarro, trabaja durante todo el día, a razón de ser padre soltero y velar por sus propias necesidades, ya que todos sus hijos son ya mayores de edad y con familias propias. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que conoce muchos lugares y trata con algunas personas que le enseñan técnicas y estrategias para aumentar sus ganancias en el tipo de labor que realiza. En la ciudad de Pucallpa, el principal medio de transporte es el motocarro, por ello, le es rentable, ya que el mismo maneja y administra sus ganancias diarias. Arturo considera que lo más difícil de su trabajo es cuando no tiene en buenas condiciones su vehículo y no contar con un garaje para guardarlo. Con MFP, ya tiene 8 préstamos, y le gusta mucho trabajar con su banco comunal porque los integrantes son unidos y puntuales en los pagos. Arturo desde invertir el dinero que solicita ahora en la reparación de su motocarro, cambiar algunos piezas y sin preocupaciones, por lo que gastará un promedio de 1000 soles. Lo restante lo usará en sus cultivos, para obtener una buena cosecha, pues cuenta con unas 18 hectáreas de palmito (palma aceitera).
texts.en:
Arturo is 48 years old and lives with his daughter, son-in-law and grandchildren in his daughter’s house. For 7 years now he has provided transportation services with his own motor-car. He works all day because he is a single father and wants to take care of his own needs; his children are now grown and have their own families. What he enjoys about his work is that he gets to know a lot of places and he tries to learn from some people the technical aspects of his work and strategies for increasing the income he earns from his type of business. The principal mode of transportation within the city of Pucallpa is by moto-car. For this reason, his enterprise is profitable given that he himself drives his vehicle and administers his daily earnings. Arturo considers the most difficult aspect of his business to be when his moto-car is in disrepair, and not having a garage to use for storage. He already has had 8 loans with MFP, and he enjoys working with the cooperative bank greatly because the members are united and timely with their loan payments. Arturo wants to invest the funds he is requesting into repairs for his moto-car, specifically for some replacement parts, for which he will spend 1,000 soles. He will invest the remaining funds into his crops in order to have a good harvest. He has 18 hectares of palmetto trees.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To maintain his moto-car, and invest into his crops.

loans.name: Mamadou

texts.fr: Monsieur  Mamadou D. est  un  jeune marié boulanger  qui habite au quartier Keur Serigne Ablaye. Il travaille  comme livreur de pain à la boulangerie  ABAK mais depuis 1991 il fait  l’embouche ovine parallèlement à son travail. Il a soldé son premier prêt sans difficulté. Avec ce prêt il veut renforcer son activité c'est-à-dire il achète des moutons qu’il élève quelques temps pour les revendre. Par exemple s’il achète 8 moutons et leur nourriture à 470 000 FCFA ($100) il peut les revendre à 720000 FCFA ($150). Il a un bon bénéfice qui pourra rembourser normalement son prêt et le reste il l’investit dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mr. Mamadou D. is a young married baker who lives in the district of Keur Serigne Ablaye. He works as a delivery man at the ABAK bakery, but since 1991, he has been fattening sheep concurrently. He has settled his first loan without difficulty. With the current loan loan, he wants to bolster his business, that is, buying sheep to raise for a time and then selling them. For example, if he buys eight sheep plus feed for 470,000 francs CFA, he can resell them at 720,000 francs. He makes a good profit for repaying his loan regularly, and he's investing the rest in his business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sheep and food for them

loans.name: Quvatali

texts.ru: Алтыбаев Куватали  житель Вахшского района. Возраст 52 года, женат и имеет четверых детей. По специальности водитель. Занимается сельским хозяйством. Имеет участок земли , засеевает Пшеницей и подсолнечником. Сейчас необходимо закупить удобрения и поэтому для этого он решил получить кредит . Занимается данным видом бизнеса уже 26 лет.
texts.en:
Quvatali A. lives in the Vakhsh region. He is 52 years old, is married and has four children. He is a driver by profession. He works in agriculture. He has a plot of land on which he plants wheat and sunflowers. Right now he needs to purchase fertilizer and this is why he decided to get credit. He has been in this business for 26 years.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Djidja 2 .1 Group

texts.fr:
Djidja 2. 1 est un regroupement de femmes mariées du village  Siguémona de la ville de Koutiala (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). Elles  vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies avec  en moyenne 50 ans et au moins 6 enfants.
 Elles cultivent  principalement  du riz et  de l’arachide comme activité Secondaire.
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe  Djidja 2 .1 ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant quatre ans. Après avoir correctement remboursés  les trois  prêts précédents, elles sont à leur quatrième prêt de campagne.
Le prêt actuel sera utilisé pour acheter,  des semences de riz  d’arachide, des petits matériels et des intrants pour la culture,  au marché de Zansoni, M’pessoba et de Fonfona. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au  marché de M’pessoba et  de Koutiala, en détail ou en gros au comptant à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
Les membres du groupe Djidja 2 .1 comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice de 85 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  pour le remboursement du prêt  et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
Djidja 2. 1 is a group of married women from the village of Siguémona, town of Koutiala (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They live in big traditional extended families and have an average age of 50 and at least 6 children. They cultivate principally rice, with peanuts as a secondary crop.

With the intention of making their agricultural businesses profitable, the members of the Djidja 2 .1 group decided to join the loan program of Soro Yiriwaso four years ago. After having correctly reimbursed the three preceding loans, they are on their fourth rural loan.

This loan will be used to buy rice seedlings, peanut seeds, minor material and intrants for their crops at the markets of Zansoni, M’pessoba, and Fonfona. After the rainy season, the harvests are stockpiled for a certain time so that they gain in value before being sold at the market of M’pessoba and of Koutiala, retail and wholesale, for cash, to a clientele generally coming from the big cities.

Each of the members of the Djidja 2 .1 group expects to make, after their crops have been sold, a profit of 85,000 F CFA which will be used to reimburse the loan and for current family expenses.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of intrants, seed, and minor agricultural materials

loans.name: Lien's Group

texts.en:
Liên Thị Trần (no: 010103060011) was born in 1983. She lives with her husband in Ly Nhan village, Dong Anh community, Ha Noi. Her husband is a driver. She sells rice to people in other villages and has a monthly income of about 3,000,000 VND. She is reliable and responsible and has been elected as group leader. She wants to borrow 2,900,000 VND to buy paddy rice to resell.

There are 5 other participants in her group:

Thủy Thị Phạm (no: 010103060014) was born in 1980. She is a seamstress. She needs 2,900,000 VND to buy cloth.

Hằng Thị Ngô (no: 010103060015) was born in 1984. She has a monthly income of about 3,500,000 VND. She wants to borrow 2,900,000 VND to breed pigs and poultry.

Dương Thị Thùy Đỗ (no: 010103060018) was born in 1982. She wants to borrow 348,000 VND to buy food in bulk. 
Thời Thị Trần (no: 010103060012) was born in 1963. She has a monthly income of about 2,500,000 VND. She wants to borrow 2,900,000 VND to buy feed for her pig.

Ngân Thị Phạm (no: 010103060016) was born in 1984. She sells noodle soup every morning. She wants to borrow 2,900,000 VND to invest in her shop.

loans.use: To buy paddy rice and resell

loans.name: Diamantes Group

texts.es: Los miembros del grupo “Diamante” están representadas por L. señora Delia y Conformado por  12 miembros los cuales empiezan su tercer ciclo en los cuales han demostrado ganas D. trabajar honestidad y responsabilidad en sus pagos. Todas las socias poseen sus propios negocios como L. venta D. abarrotes, productos lacteos, cosméticos por catálogos, comida en snacks ubicados en el parque urbano y electrodomésticos en el mercado local. L. competencia en el ámbito comercial es alta pero los miembros del grupo saben como salir adelante gracias a su experiencia y sus ganas D. trabajar. El destino del financiamiento es para L. adquisición D. materiales, insumos y herramientas que ayuden a generar un mayor ingreso ya que D. ello depenD. el sustento D. sus familias y mejoramiento D. su calidad D. vida. Por cursar su tercer ciclo juntas las socias cuentan con experiencia en grupos solidarios por lo que L. fundación Agrocapital les otorgando un apoyo económico mientras el grupo demuestre unidad y solidaridad entre ellos.
texts.en:
The Diamante Group, represented by Delia, is comprised of 12 members who are starting their third loan cycle, having demonstrated their desire to work, their honesty and responsibility in making their payments. The members all have their own businesses—general stores, dairy product sales, cosmetics by catalog, a snack bar located in the park, or home appliance sales at the local market. Competition is high, but the group members know how to get ahead thanks to their experience and their desire to work. The loan will be used to purchase the materials, supplies, and tools that will help them increase profits because their families depend on them. They want to improve their quality of life. Because this is their third loan cycle, the members all have experience with solidarity groups because Fundación Agrocapital has given them financial support, as long as the group demonstrates unity.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en: Jacinta P. is from the village of Langcayan, Mahinog, Camiguin. She is 49 years old and is married. Jacinta owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling personal and home products such as cologne, shampoos, powder and bath soaps in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In July 2009, Jacinta joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: 16 De Julio Group

texts.es:
Las integrantes del grupo “16 de Julio”, son personas que en su mayoría viven en la zona del mismo nombre y asisten a sus reuniones al Centro Focal “Los Andes”, cada dos semanas, ellas se agruparon por la necesidad de contar con un capital de trabajo que les permita mejorar sus negocios. 

Diversos son los negocios de las integrantes de “16 de Julio”, algunas se dedican a la  artesanía, produciendo prendas como carteras, sombreros y mantillas, los mismos están hechos a  mano utilizando cordeles o cola de rata, otras se dedican a la comercialización de productos vendiendo ropa, dulces y alimento.  

Todas necesitan el préstamo para la compra de materia prima como el cordel, o adquirir mayor mercadería para venderlo en el mercado.
texts.en:
The members of the group “16 de Julio” (July 16th) are mostly residents who live in the area of the same name. They meet at the “Los Andes” Community Center every 2 weeks. They have joined together because of their need for working capital to improve their businesses.

The members are engaged in different businesses. Some are involved in making handicrafts, producing items such as purses, hats, and blankets. These products are made by hand using rope or rat’s tail (a plant native to South America). Other members sell products such as clothing, candy and food.

They all need a loan to purchase raw materials, such as rope, or acquire more merchandise to sell in the market.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials & merchandise

loans.name: Carlos Luis

texts.es: El señor Carlos Luís López  P. , tiene la edad de 41 años , habita en el Municipio de Ticuantepe , junto a su esposa la cual  trabaja como conserje para apoyarle con los gastos del hogar , ellos tiene tres hijos a su cargo , todos estudiantes de secundaria , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida y apoyar a sus hijos para que sean unos profesionales , desde hace 25 años don Carlos se dedica a los trabajos de campo , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es la falta de financiamiento ,  don Carlos inicio esta actividad con su propio esfuerzo y el de su familia; los planes hacia su cultivo es diversificarlo . Con el préstamo va a comprar fertilizantes e insumos.

loans.use: Comprar insumos y fertilizante para aplicar al cultivo

loans.name: Adelina

texts.en:
Adelina is a member of the Dodoma borrower group in Khesa, Iringa. She is 44 year old women she is widowed and a mother of 6 children. Her  children are 15,13,25 years old. She also cares for other 2 dependents.

Adelina has owned a business for 20 years, she works 8 hours a day and she earns a monthly profit approximately 135,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Adelina`s First loan from BRAC_Tanzania, she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more maize and other commodities for making local beer.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Adelina hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more commodities for local beer

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en: Paulina is forty – six years old. She is divorced and has give birth to four children, all in school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a town called Dormaa in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana. Dormaa is a commercial and farming town. Paulina is a trader. She trades in meat. She buys from Kumasi and supplies to food vendors in her community. Paulina also treks to nearby communities to sell. She has been in business for three years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk.

loans.use: To buy meat

loans.name: Mercaya

texts.en:
Mercaya L. is from the city of Gango Ozamiz. She is 25 years old. Mercaya is married and has one young child. To make a living, Mercaya sells scrap metal and other used products in the local community. Mercaya has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2007, Mercaya joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mercaya has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from GDMPC. Mercaya is requesting a new loan of 6,500 PHP that she will use to expand her business. This will be Mercaya's fifth loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena B. is from the village of Batangan, Valencia Bukidnon. She is 28 years old. Nena is married and has one infant child. To make a living, Nena operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling personal products such as glasses and watches in the local community. Nena has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Nena joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nena is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Nena from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Sylvie

texts.fr: P. Sylvie est née en 1948 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Sylvie vit depuis sa naissance à Gbégamey, un quartier de Cotonou. Sylvie est mariée à AKANDE, un agent du Trésor Public. Le couple a trois enfants en charge, dont un seulent est leur enfant et est scolarisé. Sylvie vient en aide à son mari dans les charges de la famille. c'est depuis 10 ans que Sylvie mène comme activité, la vente de produits de jardin, afin de satisfaire les besoins de sa famille. Sylvie vend ses produits à Gbégamey à Cotonou. C'est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé qui rembourse bien ses crédits. Afin d'augmenter son fonds de roulement et cultiver davantage, Sylvie sollicite auprès de ALIdé, un autre crédit.
texts.en:
Sylive P. was born in 1948 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Since birth, she's been living in Gbégamey, a neighborhood in Cotonou. Sylvie is married to AKANDE, an employee of the Ministry of Finance. The couple has three children to support, out of whom only one is theirs and goes to school. Sylvie helps her husband with the family expenses. For 10 years, she's been selling products of her garden, in order to support her family. Sylvie sells her goods in Gbégamey in Cotonou. She's a long time client of Kiva's partner, Alidé, who repays her loan without problems. In order to bolster her working capital and grow more, she's seeking another loan from Alidé.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To bolster her working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase the amount of arable land she has and to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Touch

texts.en:
Touch U., 61, is a widowed mother of three children who are already married and employed at different jobs. One of her daughters, who is in the picture above, assists her in weaving silks.

To makes a living, Touch U. owns a few looms on which she weaves silk skirts to sell (the silk skirts that Cambodia’s people wear to join in wedding parties or traditional ceremonies). She also weaves many sets of silk before selling and almost all of her clients need to wait a few days or a week in advance.

Recently, Touch U. got orders from her regular customer and so is asking for a loan to buy more necessary raw materials for weaving.

loans.use: To buy more necessary raw materials

loans.name: Ching

texts.en:
P., age 30, is a married woman and is blessed with a young school-aged child. She resides with her husband and child in a medium-sized stone house. She is a good housewife who cooks delicious meals and takes care of her child. P. depends on the income provided by her husband, who is a generator repairer in the cement production industry.

P. has a sister who is determined to obtain a university degree, and she has to pay tuition but doesn't have enough money. For this reason, P. has applied for a $500 loan, which will enable her to help her sister pay for her education.

loans.use: To help her sister pay college tuition fees

loans.name: Sokthea

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokthea P. (pictured here), 27, and her husband, Mr. Sophal Yorng, 29, have been married since 2005 and have one young daughter. The family is living in a small village about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Sokthea sells groceries at her home.  She is a tailor as well. Her husband is a garment factory worker. She hopes to expand her business, so that it will be easier for her to respond to her customers' needs. She is asking for her first loan of $1,000 to purchase fabric for her tailoring business and to buy more grocery items to sell.

loans.use: To purchase fabric for her tailoring business and buy more grocery items to sell.

loans.name: 220300399 Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal San Jose D. Viñaca, inicia su sexto ciclo con 26 socias. Las socias son D. la comunidad D. Viñaca.

Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta D. animales menores, tara, cochinilla, abarrotes en general, fabricación D. ladrillos y la mayor parte D. las socias se dedican a la agricultura D. verduras.

Como es el caso D. la señora Rosa que es casada, tiene 43 años y 3 hijos, Rosa se dedica a la agricultura D. verduras, Rosa necesita un préstamo D. 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. semillas y abono.

Mientras que Natalia es casada, tiene 45 años y 6 hijos, Natalia tiene una tienda en su casa en donD. venD. abarrotes en general, Natalia necesita un préstamo D. 450 soles dinero que sera invertido en la compra D. arroz, azúcar.

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 300 soles, 450 soles, 600soles, 750 soles, haciendo un total D. 13,650 soles D. prestamos en el Banco Comunal. 

Sus prestamos serán invertidos en la compra D. arroz, azúcar, semillas, abono, animales menores y para el pago D. peones.

Los sueños D. las socias son tener una buena producción, que sus hijos sean profesionales y comprar un carro para transportar sus productos.
texts.en:
The San Jose D. Viñaca Communal Bank starts its sixth cycle with 26 members. The members are from the Viñaca community. The members have different businesses like selling small animals; tara, a local tree used to make industrial products; cochinilla, an insect used to make red dye; and general groceries. Some make bricks, and most of the members devote themselves to growing vegetables. Rosa is 43, married, and has three children. Rosa grows vegetables. Rosa needs a loan for 600 PEN to buy seeds and fertilizer. Natalia is 45, married, and has six children. Natalie has a store in her house where she sells general groceries. Natalia needs a loan for 450 PEN to buy rice and sugar. The members need different amounts of loans. The amounts they need are 300, 450, 600, and 750 PEN. The total amount of the loan for the communal bank is 13,650 PEN. Their loans will be used to buy rice, sugar, seeds, fertilizer, small animals, and to pay workers. The members’ dreams are to have good production, that their children become professionals, and to buy a car to transport their products.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rice, sugar, seeds, fertilizer, small animals, and to pay workers

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy is a 23-year-old married woman. She is a happy woman and she is always filled with joy when her customers purchase her goods. She has a child and her child is 3 years old.

Joy sells groceries and drinks at retail prices to her customers and has been in this business for five years. She hopes to own a supermarket in the future. Her greatest challenge in her business is funds and she hopes to overcome this challenge. She hopes for a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more groceries to sell.

Joy has a good relationship with LAPO. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy ingredients for her meals preparation.

loans.name: Gemma's Group

texts.en:
Gemma B. is from the village of Tabon. She is 42 years old. Gemma is the group leader of a three-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. 

Gemma is married. To make a living, Gemma owns & operates a "Food Vending" business. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from the income of her husband in farming. Gemma has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2008, Gemma joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gemma has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Gemma is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Gemma from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC: 

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase products for cooking

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida V., from the village of Maras, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte, is 59 years old, married and has six adult and school-aged children. To make a living, she has owned a piggery for the past six years, earning approximately 8,000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Aida joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having fully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC to buy feed and other materials for her business, Aida is now requesting a new loan, her sixth, of 8,000 PHP, again for her piggery. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her enterprise.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy feed and other needs for pigs.

loans.name: Sara

texts.es: Sara tiene 45 años, es una mujer muy emprendedora, comparte su vida con su esposo Hernán D. 44, quien es taxista y sus dos hijas, Zoila y Cecilia D. 16 y 4 años respectivamente. Todos  juntos viven en su casa propia. DesD. hace algunos años tiene su propia botica, servicio que instaló con ayuda D. unas monjas, quienes le dieron la oportunidad D. tener un negocio y un trabajo en su barrio, por ser el único que venD. este rubro, resultándole muy rentable. A ella le gusta mucho su trabajo porque le da tiempo D. cuidar sus hijos. En ocasiones su esposo Hernán la apoya con las labores del hogar, por lo que han demostrado ser una familia muy unida. Ella tiene anhelos D. salir adelante ampliando su negocio, pero para eso debe construir su casa D. material noble y brindarle un mayor espacio a su botica, ella sabe que aún le falta camino por recorrer pero no se amilana  al contrario seguirá trabajando hasta alcanzar su meta. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP y se compromete a ser muy puntual en todos los pagos D. las cuotas. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá para traer mayor cantidad D. productos y aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Sara is 45 years of age and is a very enterprising woman. She shares her life with her husband, Hernan (44 years of age), who is a taxi driver and her two daughters, Cecilia (16) and Zoila (4). Together they live in their own home. For some years now, Sara has run her own pharmacy - a service installed in her home, with the help of some nuns - who gave her the opportunity to have this business in their neighborhood. Being the only person who sells pharmaceutical products, has been very profitable. She loves her work because it gives her time to care for their children. Sometimes her husband Hernán helps with the the housework, and this has helped make them a very close family. Sara has hopes of expanding her business, which will help her succeed, however, in order to do that, she will need to build onto her existing house with good quality materials. Making these changes will proviD. more space for the pharmacy. She knows she has a long way to go, but isn't daunted by the tasks ahead and still works hard to meet her goals. This is her third loan with MFP and promises to be very punctual in the re-payment of the installments. She plans to use the requested loan to purchase more products and increase sales.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Comprar productos medicinales.  (to purchase pharmaceutical products and inventory)

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is married to an electrical engineer and they have one child. Her child goes to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. Agnes owns a stall in Nakulabye selling second hand clothes.  She wants to use this loan of 300,000/= to buy more second hand clothes. She has been in this business for 10 years. Besides this clothing business, she also sells soft drinks, like soda, passion juice, and water, cakes and bans of bread.   Agnes sells at retail only and sells to all categories of people. She works seven days a week. Agnes’ business challenges include transportation and seasonality. She hopes to build her own house, expand her clothing business and start importing the clothing. She joined MCDT because they were giving out timely loans. She resides in and rents a two-room house. The family has access to electricity but no piped water. Her monthly expenses include food, rent, and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more second hand clothes

loans.name: Angeliza

texts.en:
Angeliza S. is from Barangay Santa Cruz, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 48 years old. Angeliza is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Angeliza owns & operates a business providing party services (videoke machine) to local community members. Angeliza has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Angeliza joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Angeliza is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to expand services provided. This will be the first loan taken out by Angeliza from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to expand services provided.

loans.name: Edoh

texts.fr: Mme T. Edoh vit à Gapé-Avegan où elle est née en 1966. Marié et mère de quatre (04) enfants, elle est cultivatrice. C’est une grande productrice de souchet et de maïs. Son ambition est d’accroître considérablement sa production agricole au cours de cette campagne agricole. Le crédit qu’elle sollicite sera donc destiné au labour, au sarclage et à l’achat d’engrais.
texts.en:
Mrs. Edoh T. lives in Gapé-Avegan, where she was born in 1966. Married and the mother of four children, she is a farmer. She excels at growing yellow nut sedge [a tuber plant] and corn. Her goal is to greatly increase her production this season. Thus the loan she is seeking will be used towards the costs of labor and hoeing and the purchase of fertilizers.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Costs of labor, hoeing and fertilizers

loans.name: Jeffrey

texts.en: Jeffrey S. is from the village of Port Area, Poblacion, Iligan City. He is 35 years old and is single. Jeffrey owns and operates a furniture-making business, primarily making and selling general household furniture to local businesses and community members. He has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month. In 2010, Jeffrey joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw materials to make additional furniture. This loan will be his first from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to make additional furniture

location.town: Poblacion, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Santa Angela

texts.es: La Señora Santa Menchú, persona de 56 años de edad, es Casada de oficios , Comerciante “Venta de cortes típicos para mujeres” cuenta con un Pequeño negocio; habita junto a sus esposo,  y se dedican al mismo oficio cuentan con dos empleados  para la misma actividad, lleva 15 años de Vender  su residencia que se encuentra en Caserío Tzamatzam, actualmente tienen demanda de su negocio por lo que necesita aumentar su capital, entonces acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar más Mercadería y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, y que tener mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Mrs. Santa Menchú is 56-years-old. She's married and works as a merchant selling traditional clothing for women. She has a small business that she runs with her husband. There are two employees for the same activity. She's been selling from her house in the hamlet of Tzamatzam for 15 years. Currently her business is in demand so she needs to increase her capital. She went to ASDIR to ask for a loan with the intention of buying more merchandise to increase her sales and improve her living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Richardson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Ermilo

texts.en: Ermilo C.'s main source of income comes from operating motor transport (habal-habal) services. He is 36 years old, married and has two small children. They are from the village of Lapasan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. Ermilo has been in his business for over three years and earns approximately 20,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2009, Ermilo joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living conditions and enable him to engage in business activities. Ermilo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from GDMPC. He is requesting a new loan of 35,000 PHP which will be used to repair his vehicle for better service. This will be his seventh loan from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of his family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair his vehicle for better service

loans.name: Chanlea's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Chanlea C., 42, is the leader of this group loan, selected by its four members, who all live in Chrolong village in Kandal province. Each member of this group will use their portion of the loan to support their different businesses.
Mrs. Chanlea C. and her husband, Mr. Phoem Pich, are farmers who own 1-hectare of land to cultivate rice for a living. Besides farming, Mrs. Chanlea C. is also a Khmer noodle seller in the local market. With both occupations, they are able to earn a small income to support their family.  
Mrs. Chanlea C. is now requesting for a loan to buy soil to fill her front yard. This couple has seven children; one is a seamstress in a garment factory and one is a construction worker while the other five are students in the local school and also help their parents on the farm.

loans.use: To buy soil to fill her front yard

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es:
Felicitas es socia del Banco Comunal Ccori Ayllu que significa Familia de Oro en quechua hace 2 años y lo que mas le agrada son los prestamos fáciles y el incentivo al ahorro.
Felicitas es casada tiene 5 hijos que estudian, Felicitas se dedica a la crianza de animales en su casa como gallina, cuy y lo vende en su misma casa porque ya tiene clientes. Además viaja a las ferias los días sábados en donde compra quesos y cereales. Felicitas también trabaja por las mañanas cuidando una huerta de flores.
Felicitas necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles para la compra de cerdo y gallinas.
Felicitas sueña con que sus hijos sean profesionales y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Felicitas has been a member of the Ccori Ayllu, which means Golden Family in Quechua, communal bank for two years. What she enjoys most about it are the fuss-free loans and the savings incentives. Felicitas is married and has five children who are in school. She raises small farm animals, like chickens and guinea pigs, at home. She sells them directly from home because she already has customers. She also travels to markets on Saturdays where she buys cheeses and cereals. During the mornings, Felicitas works caring for a flower orchard. She needs a 1500 sol loan to buy a pig and chickens. She dreams with her children becoming professionals and with improving her business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a pig and chickens.

loans.name: Nhaom

texts.en: Mrs. Nhaom S. is a villager in Srae Kaes village in Takeo province and she was born in 1950. She owns a general store in the local village where she is able to earn a large profit to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Chen Sok, is a farmer who owns a 1.5-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice to sell to support his family. Her problem is that her husband’s field is ready to grow rice, but she does not have money to support it. So, to improve this situation, Mrs. Nhaom S. is applying for a loan to buy rice seed. With the rest of the loan, she will buy pesticide and hire a machine to plow the rice field. She is the mother of a child who is a seamstress in a garment factory. Her husband is shown in the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy rice seed

loans.name: Gladies Musimbi

texts.en:
Gladys Musimbi S. is 50-year-old lady, married to Jamin S.. Gladys runs a grocery in Kabarnet to support her family of six. Most of her customers are residents of Kabarnet.

Gladys is borrowing a second loan of Kshs 20,000 from KADET Limited to purchase vegetables tomatoes, cabbages, carrots, bananas, garlic and ginger. The remainder will be used for transportation and other overhead costs.

Gladys intends to plough back the profits into the business for expansion. Her dream is to grow her business and purchase a pick-up truck for transportation. She would like to be able to give her children the best education possible.

loans.use: To purchase more vegetables for her store and for transportation

loans.name: Aminata B

texts.en:
This is 38-year-old Aminata B K.. She is married and has three children aged 6, 9 and 12 years. In 2000, Aminata established her locally dyed gara and cotton cloth business in order to generate income and educate her children. Working seven days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about  900000 SLL every month from this business. 

Aminata would like a loan in the amount of 3000000 SLL to add 15 new pieces of gara and two dozen new pieces of cotton, which she buys in neighboring Guinea. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 600000 SLL. 

In the future, Aminata plans to buy a motorbike to gain more contacts and increase her income. She hopes that this increased income will allow her to construct a house for her family, educate her children and establish a savings account. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more cotton and gara cloth for resale

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Ana María pertenece al banco comunal “Mosoc Killa” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco y vive en la misma ciudad. Cusco es una ciudad encantadora que se remonta a los tiempos Incas. Construida en la base de la antigua ciudad Inca. 

Ana María tiene 36 años, es casada y fruto de esta unión tiene dos hijos, ella alterna sus actividades del hogar con las del pequeño negocio de venta de cosméticos. Hace varios años que empezó este negocio y con un poco de capital pero ahora, ella tiene una cantidad considerable de clientes que adquieren sus productos de belleza y lo que más sus piden clientes son por ejemplo perfumes, aretes y pulseras. Ana María desprende una imagen de una madre trabajadora y responsable. Con su próximo préstamo, Ana María que espera recibir S/. 1500 nuevos soles. Por el momento,  desea incrementar el negocio y va comprar más productos de belleza. 

Ana María se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Ana María belongs to Asociación Arariwa’s “Mosoc Killa” Communal Bank in Cusco, where she also lives. Cusco is a charming city that dates back to Incan times.
Ana María is 36 years old and married with two children. She divides her time between the home and her little cosmetics business. She started this business several years ago with a little capital but now she has a considerable number of clients who buy her beauty products. Her clients mostly ask for perfume, earrings and bracelets. Ana María reflects the image of a hard-working and responsible mother. Ana María hopes to receive 1500 PEN for her next loan. For now, she would like to expand her business and will buy more cosmetics.
Ana María is grateful for this opportunity and is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: Purchase cosmetics

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro A. A. tiene 65 años. Vive en Unión Libre  vive con la compañera y con los hijos, vive  en el cantón de San Miguel en la Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 4 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. Unidos Somos Mas  se dedican a la agricultura esta ventanilla se encuentra a 45 minutos de San Miguel en el Ríos a la Costa, todos los miembros viven en el mismo recinto, la mayoría de los socios trabajan en la siembra de maíz, trigo, papas en esta ventanilla son aproximadamente 10 miembros.

Pedro se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, fréjol, trigo y papas, realiza las compras en La Parroquia San Pablo y vente en el mercado San Pablo.  

Solicita el crédito para la comprar se suministros y fertilizantes para sus cultivos. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades. Su sueño es comprar terrenos y arreglar la fachada de mi casa.
Le gusta salir de paseo con la familia.
texts.en:
Pedro A. A. is 65 years old. He lives in a common law relationship with his partner and their children in San Miguel canton in Bolívar province. He has 4 children.

The members of V.R.C. Unidos Somos Mas (United We Are More Cooperative Rural Bank) are engaged in agriculture. This cooperative is located 45 minutes from San Miguel in Ríos a la Costa. Most of the members work growing corn, wheat, and potatoes. There are approximately 10 members of this rural cooperative.

Pedro works in agriculture raising corn, beans, wheat, and potatoes. He carries out his purchases in San Pablo Parish and sells in the San Pablo market.

He is applying for this loan in order to purchase supplies and fertilizer for his crops. With the loan he will be helped economically to meet his needs. He confronts challenges such as pests and diseases. His dream is to purchase land and repair the façade of his house. He likes to take walks with his family.

loans.use: To purchase supplies and fertilizers for his crops.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is a resident of Nyamira in Western Kenya where she does mixed farming, producing maize and beans which she sells locally. She is married with two children aged eight and five.

Teresa has requested this loan of 45,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She believes the dairy cow will earn her more income and improve her family's living standards. She is focused on expanding her business to five cows in five years. Teresa says that heavy rains usually damage her beans which leads to great loss in expected income.

loans.use: purchase and insurance of a dairy cow

loans.name: Rasul

texts.en:
A. Rasul is 34 years old, married and has four school-aged children. Rasul is a manufacturer who produces wooden doors, windows, benches and cradles. His shop is located right in his house. Working in this business for 14 years, Rasul has become an experienced master and now he has students. Producing goods of a good quality and acceptable price means that Rasul has many customers. He sells his products from his house and also from a trading place located in the local market. In general, Rasul's business is very successful and generates a stable income for his family. Now Rasul is planning to purchase an additional woodworker that he needs to expand his business. For this purpose, he is requesting a loan of $2,000 USD.

More about Tajikistan
Tajikistan, a key post on the Silk Road, is perhaps best known for its rich history. It was the location for the end of Alexander the Great's rule, and is known for its great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country, with its epic mountain passes, is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mix of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the USSR, damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 per cent of the country is mountainous and only 7 per cent of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands of people to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

More about IMON International
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase a woodworker

loans.name: Noemi

texts.en:
The member belongs to the “Pro Desarrollo” cooperative bank, which is located in the Pisac district of the province of Calca.

Her name is Noemi C. B., and she is 55 years old.  Noemi is married and has two children.  She requested a loan to invest in the purchase of more inventory for her handicraft business in Pisac around Christmas.  Specifically, she invested in blankets, sweaters, and jackets made from alpaca wool, and materials to create Nativity scenes for Christmas.  In Peru,the Nativity scene is more common than Christmas trees.

Noemi commits to making her payments within the established time frame.

loans.use: To invest in a handicrafts business

loans.name: Ludivina

texts.en:
Ludivina T. is from the town of Trinidad. She is 51 years old. Ludivina is married and has two children aged 28 and 18. She manages a small piggery in her backyard. She grows the pigs for breeding and then sells the pigs to the market. Ludivina wishes for her business to be stable.

Ludivina joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ludivina has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Ludivina is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional piglets and feed. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional piglets and feed

loans.name: Aoko

texts.en:
Aoko M., 34, is married with three children who all attend school. She has been practicing mixed farming for five years and produces milk and maize, which she sells locally. She also earns income from her posho-mill business in the same location.

She has requested a loan of 51,200 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from the sale of milk will help her improve her family's livelihood. She plans to have three quality dairy cows and a chuff-cutter in the next five years.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is a single woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She has operated a fish selling business for the past four years, selling at the market to her neighbors. Mwanasha's major challenge is seasonality. During rainy season, the demand for fish is lower and the supply is higher. She hopes to open a retail shop in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000, she wants to purchase a fridge for storing fish and add sacks of fish. She decided to join Yehu because of its simple formation.

loans.use: To purchase a fridge and more sacks of fish.

loans.name: Bonifacio Valeriano

texts.es: El Sr A. labora como ayudante fontanero  es  casado, tiene cinco persona  a su cargo,   es el primer  del crédito que CEPRODEL le otorga, da gracia el apoyo que le brindan con  este  desembolso, para  comprar materiales bloque ,cemento ,estribo, clavo, hierro y mano de obra, para construir  anexo de un cuarto de  su vivienda, para mejor condicion de ampliar por el numero de hijos que se crecido.
texts.en: Mr A. works as a plumbing assistant.  He is married and has five people in his care.  This is his first loan from Ceprodel and he is grateful for the support that they are giving him with this loan.  He will use the money to buy blocks, cement, braces, nails and iron, and to pay the workers who will build an extension on a room in his home.  This extension will improve his living conditions as he has a lot of children.

loans.use: To improve his home

loans.name: María Soledad

texts.es:
María tiene 45 años de edad, es soltera y reside junto a su familia en casa de sus padres ubicada en el distrito de José Leonardo Ortiz. Uno de los distritos más poblados de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir en general y accesorios para dormitorios como: sabanas frazadas, etc. Ella ofrece estos productos tanto al crédito como al contado y los ofrece principalmente entre sus vecinos y conocidos según los pedidos que le realicen. Esta actividad la realiza desde hace 5 años y es de mucha ayuda para la economía de su familia y se vale de ella para ayudar al mantenimiento de su economía diaria. Adicionalmente ella es trabajadora dependiente de una empresa dedicada a la venta de abarrotes desde hace tres años 

María desea adquirir más mercadería para ampliar su negocio ya que se acerca la temporada de otoño e invierno por tanto la demanda por su negocio aumenta. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a realizar su objetivo.

María es una joven bastante trabajadora y empeñosa, las personas que le conocen admiran sus ganas de salir adelante y progresar.
texts.en:
María is 45 years old, single, and lives with her family in the home of her parents in the District of José Leonardo Ortiz. This district is one of the most populated in Lambayeque region.

María sells clothing and bedroom accessories such as blankets, sheets, and other items. She offers these products on credit and for cash. Maria sells primarily to her neighbors and acquaintances based on the orders they submit. This business has been in existence for five years and has proven to be a great help to her family’s finances. This enables her to support them on a daily basis. In addition to this business, she has worked as an employee for a grocery store for the past three years.

Maria wants to acquire more merchandise to expand her business since the autumn and winter seasons are approaching. The demand for her business increases during this time. For this reason, she is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 2000 PEN to help accomplish her goal.

María is a hardworking and determined woman. The people she knows admire her for her desire to succeed and make progress.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise to expand her business.

loans.name: Veronica Elizabeth

texts.es: La señora Verónica es una clienta antigua en emprender, ella trabajo con crédito en banca comunal durante 2 secuencias,  actualmente no esta en una banca comunal por lo que solicito un préstamo individual, debido al negocio que ella  realiza el cual es todo el año, ella se dedica a la artesanía en confección de de pelucas para danzas folklóricas, tal es como diablada, morenos, tobas ch'utas y otros este negocio le enseño su esposo, quien lo aprendio de su familia la señora realiza su comercialización con los artesanos de Oruro, Cochabamba y La Paz entregando las pelucas para las diferentes danzas en las diversas festividades que hay en nuestro país,  la señora es muy joven tiene un niño de 6 años quien esta en la escuela el sueño que como familia tienen es lograr un techo propio, ya que este negocio les ayudo a comprar dos  mini bus que esta afiliado a un sindicato y uno de ellos necesita arreglo de su motor para ello es que solicito el crédito , desean seguir trabajando para comprarse una casita o terreno, es una persona muy trabajadora que esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Verónica is a long-standing client of Emprender.  She was a member of a community bank for 2 loan cycles.  However, she is not currently a member of a community bank.  She is requesting an individual loan since her business is year-round.

Verónica is in the handicrafts business.  She makes wigs for folk dances such as diablada,  morenos, tobas ch'utas and others.  Her husband taught her this business and he, in turn, learned it from his family.  Verónica sells her products to craftspeople in Oruro, Cochabamba and La Paz.  She delivers the wigs for the different dances that form part of the various festivals which are held in our country.  Verónica is very young and has a 6 year-old child who is in school.  Their family dream is to achieve a home of their own. 

This business helped Verónica and her husband to buy two minibuses which are affiliated to a drivers' union and one of them needs its engine repairing.  It is for this purpose that Verónica is requesting her loan.  She would like to continue working so that she can buy a small house or a plot of land.  She is a very hard-working person and she is grateful to the institution for the support they have offered her.

loans.use: to repair her vehicle's engine

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is a single woman who lives at her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and clothing. For the past three months, Rehema has been selling fruit as retail to her neighbours and passersby. In addition, she also operates a Khanga business (traditional African women's attire), selling them as wholesale which contributes to her other source of income.

Rehema dreams of expanding her business in the future. With the Kshs 30,000 she is requesting she wants to purchase five sacks of fruit for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase five sacks of fruit for resale.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert K. is 40 years old and lives in the town of Mukono in the Mukono region of Uganda.  He is married and has three children.  Two of his children are currently in school.  Robert has had a retail shop for five years. He also has a second business selling clothes.        

To help expand his business, Robert has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more essential commodities like soap for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Robert hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children.  In the future, Robert hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase more essential commodities like soap for resale.

loans.name: Tusitukirewamu Women's Group

texts.en: 54-year-old Rehemah has been engaged in a fish sales business for the past 10 years in Kayunga District. The happy-go-lucky happily married mother of eight says that she decided to enter this business upon determining the high demand for fish in her home area. Rehemah also ekes out side profits from a modest goat-selling business. Rehemah says she makes 25,000 shillings per day in her business. With this loan, she will purchase better fishing nets and more fish to resell.

loans.use: to purchase better fishing nets and more fish to resell.

loans.name: Margarita Maria

texts.es: Margarita tiene su propio negocio, en el barrio Bonanza del municipio de Soledad, a través del cual vende a crédito y de contado, productos de bisutería y mercancía variada como cosméticos, perfumes, accesorios,  que estén en promoción mediante guías especializadas, o que hayan sido encargado por sus clientes. Esta Actividad la desarrolla desde hace 8 años cuando una amiga la incorporó primero  a una revista especializada de venta de ropas y posteriormente accedió ella  misma a otro catalogo para  comercializar con cosméticos; con estas 2 opciones comerciales trabaja simultáneamente y como  le ha ido muy bien. Logró comprar  una vitrina, la surtió  y organizó un  punto comercial en su propia casa, donde exhibe la bisutería que compra a crédito en el centro de la ciudad de Barranquilla y algunos otros productos de su revista que desea mostrar a sus clientes.  Margarita genera ingresos importantes con este negocio y con él apoya la gestión de su hogar conformada por su cónyuge y sus 3 hijos en las edades de 4 a 23 años, con los que sueña verlos organizados en el futuro y muy exitosos. Su meta más adelante es ampliar su negocio mejorar su infraestructura con exhibidores y diversificar su oferta de mercancía incluyéndole bolsos a la moda y de buena calidad. Su credikiva es el primer financiamiento que recibe de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  con el comprará mercancía que viene  en la promoción de sus revistas, porque ella conoce muy bien los gustos y necesidades de sus clientes y a ellos venderá estos productos  ofreciéndoles muy buenos precios, dando así respuestas a sus  requerimientos. Su mayor desafío es la selección de la clientela que le compra a crédito , porque debe ser muy cuidadosa principalmente con los nuevos clientes,  para no perder su poco capital de trabajo, el que planea aumentar gradualmente  iniciando con este financiamiento y con mucha disciplina de trabajo.
texts.en:
Margarita has her own business in the Bonanza neighborhood in the municipality of Soledad. She sells jewelry and a variety of merchandise like cosmetics, perfumes and accessories that are on sale through specialty publications, or that have been ordered by her clients on credit or with cash. She started this 8 years ago, when a friend first introduced her to a specialized magazine that sells clothing and then later to another catalog that sells cosmetics. She works with these two sales options simultaneously and it's going very well. She was able to buy a display case, stock it and organize a commercial area in her own home where she exhibits the jewelry that she buys on credit in downtown Barranquilla, along with other products from the catalogs that she wants to show her customers. 

Margarita earns important income from this business that helps her to manage her household, which consists of her partner and their 3 children ages 4 to 23. She dreams of seeing them organized and successful in the future. Her long-term goal is to increase her business, improve the infrastructure with display cases and to diversify the merchandise she offers including fashionable and affordable handbags. 

The Kiva loan is her first from Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo. With it she will buy merchandise that is on sale in her catalogs because she knows the tastes and needs of her customers and she will sell these products to them at good prices, meeting their requests. Her biggest challenge is selecting customers that buy on credit, because she has to be very careful with new customers so that she doesn't lose her capital. She hopes to gradually increase her business capital with this loan and with a lot of discipline in her work.

loans.use: to buy merchandise that is on sale in her catalogs.

loans.name: Roxan

texts.en:
Roxan is married. She has 2 children. She is 34 years old and lives in Dapitan City, Zamboanga del Norte.

Roxan sells shampoo, toothpaste, soap and anything that is needed for the household to earn a living. She has had this business for 2 years. Each month she earns PHP 4,000 by doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 14,900 to purchased more products for her business.

Roxan has been a member of PMPC for five years.

loans.use: to purchased more inventory for her business.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is married with 10 children. Gloria is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Gloria is a farmer and grows coconut plants to earn a living. She has been doing this for 10 years. She has requested a loan to purchase coconut seed for her plantation.

Gloria has been a member of PMPC for 4 years.

loans.use: to purchase coconut seed for plantation

loans.name: Matilde

texts.es:
La señora Matilde esta casada con el señor Luciano desde hace 28 años con quien tiene tres hijos.
En el año 1996 Doña Matilde decidió abrir su propio taller de confecciones con la ayuda de su marido, que es funcionario policial.
Ella en la actualidad ella fabrica uniformes a los militares y policias gracias a los lasos de amistad que tiene su marido Luciano y gracias a esto ella ya tiene una gran cantidad de clientes que siempre recurren a ella.
Doña Matilde posee dos  maquinas de coser de tipo industrial, pero le gustaría poder seguir con la ampliación de su microempresa, agregando mas maquinas de coser ya que posee una gran demanda.
Ella solicita el credito para la compra de maquinas de coser, como así también de los insumos que va a necesitar para la confección de las prendas.
texts.en:
Señora Matilde has been married to Señor Luciano for 28 years; they have three children.

In 1996 with help from her husband, who is a civil servant with the police department, Sra. Matilde decided to open her own sewing workshop. She currently makes uniforms for the military and the police because of the friendly connections that her husband has with them.  As a result, Matilde has a lot of customers who always come back to her.

She already owns industrial sewing machines but would like to continue expanding her business by adding more sewing machines since there is a lot of demand for her work. 

Matilde is seeking a loan to buy sewing machines and also the other supplies she is going to need to make clothing.

loans.use: to buy sewing machines and other supplies for her clothing business

loans.name: Paul

texts.en: Paul is 38 years old. An enterprising businessman, he is a single man. He has been selling baked cakes using a motorcycle for the past two years. His monthly income is 8,000 Kenyan shillings, which he uses to support his basic needs. He was introduced to KADET Ltd by an existing KADET customer, and he is applying for his first loan. He will use the loan to add more cakes and service his motorbike. He will use the anticipated profit from the business as working capital. His hope is to buy his own taxi car.

loans.use: to add more cakes and service his motorbike.

loans.name: Maria Concepcion

texts.en: Maria lives in Choluteca, Honduras with her husband. Together they run a small brick-making business, waking at 5 a.m. each morning to begin the workday. Maria is requesting a loan of HNL 10,000 to purchase firewood (which is used in firing the bricks) and to pay employees. In her spare time Maria raises chickens at home.

loans.use: to purchase firewood and pay employees.

loans.name: Butunduzi Bakyara Kweyombeka Group

texts.en:
Evas hails from the Kyenjojo district in Uganda. She is 40 years old and has been farming Irish potatoes for 5 years. Evas has 2 children and dreams of building a good house and having more than 5 acres of land covered with Irish potatoes. 	
She is a member of the Butunduzi Bakyara Kweyombeka group where the members guarantee each other's loans. Evas intends to use the loan to buy Irish potatoes for planting.

loans.use: to buy Irish potatoes for planting.

loans.name: Marco Antonio

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “FRATERNIDAD DE URUBAMBA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Marco Antonio; el tiene 36 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el trabajo como seguridad en un hotel y también tiene una tienda de abarrotes donde su esposa atiende, el socio trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 7.00 p.m, por medio de este trabajo y de su pequeño negocio que es la tienda de abarrotes el socio saca adelante a sus hijos, el socio quiere ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes y mejorar en su trabajo como seguridad. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar productos de tienda de abarrotes como arroz, azúcar, aceite y leche al por mayor. 
                                       
El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the“FRATERNIDAD DE URUBAMBA” communal bank. The bank is located in Urubamba district, part of Urubamba province in Cusco department

Sr. Marco Antonio is 36, lives with his partner and has 1 son.  He has a job as a security guard in a hotel and he also has a grocery store which his wife runs. He works from 6 a.m. to 7 p.m.

By means of his job and his small business, he is helping his son get ahead. He wants to expand his grocery store business and improve in his work as a security guard. He is requesting the loan to buy products for his grocery store, such as rice, sugar, oil and milk, wholesale.

He is happy about the loan and is committed to making his payments on time.

loans.use: to buy products for his grocery store, such as rice, sugar, oil and milk, wholesale.

loans.name: Hala

texts.en: Hala is a 30-year-old woman who is married with two sons and two daughters. She lives in the Jabalia refugee camp in Gaza, located in Palestine. Hala wants to purchase new home furniture instead of the old ones to improve her family life and live in better conditions. Since she hasn't enough money, she needs to take out a loan of $1,215.05 from FATEN. When Hala gets a FATEN loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, she will be able to purchase new home furniture, which will change her family life positively and let the family live in better conditions. Hala is a conservative woman, so her husband is photographed instead. About this loan product: FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's article on Lending in the Muslim World.

loans.use: To purchase home furniture to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
Jovelyn is 45 years old and has been engaged in a piggery business for two years. Her family is not privileged, they barely eat three times a day. This has motivated her to ask for a loan of 6,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) from Alalay Sa Kaunlaran (ASKI) Inc. 

She plans to use it to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs to improve her piggery business and soon achieve a better income. It would also provide payment for other obligations. 

She is working hard to save and provide for the educational needs of her children. In fact, she also works in the field for an additional source of income: she plants and harvests crops in other people's fields. 

She hopes to overcome these difficulties and obtain a comfortable life in the future.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Blanca Bertha

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Caminantes de Cristo  se reúne cada quince días en las afueras de Portoviejo en el sector conocido como Las Piedras, este lugar se lo conoce porque está muy cerca de unas canteras de roca y de allí su nombre.

Aquí vive  la señora Blanca tiene 37 años de edad, es casada y de  esta relación tiene tres hijos y también crio desde muy pequeña a una hija de su esposo  que para ella es como si fuera su hija, sus dos hijas mayores están estudiando en Universidad y los dos menores en colegio. Su esposo es Biólogo Marino y trabaja en un laboratorio de larvas en Manta.

Doña Blanca tiene una tienda de comestibles en su casa en la que vende productos de primera necesidad, artículos de bazar y una que otra  medicina. Trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00  hasta las 19h00, ella allí además de ganarse algo por su cuenta se entretiene y se entera de lo que sucede  en su localidad, sus hijos le ayudan en su negocio cuando están desocupados, lleva tres años con su negocio y está muy contenta con su tienda.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar productos de primera necesidad para surtir su tienda. Es fundadora del Banco Comunal, es la tesorera del Banco y le gusta porque con los créditos cada vez aumenta más su negocio.
 
Sus sueños son aumentar su negocio y que sus hijos sean  profesionales.
texts.en:
Caminantes de Cristo [Christ's Travelers] Community Bank meets every two weeks in the outskirts of Portoviejo, in the area known as Las Piedras [the Stones]. Its name comes from its close proximity to some rock quarries. 

This is where Blanca lives. She is 37 years old, married, and has three children with her spouse. She also raised her husband's daughter from a young age, and for Blanca, it's as if she were her own daughter. Blanca's two older daughters study at the university, and the two younger children go to school. Her husband is a marine biologist and works in a shrimp hatchery in Manta. 

Blanca has a grocery story in her house where she sells basic necessity items, stationary products, and medicine. She works every day from 6AM to 7PM. In addition to earning a living, she keeps herself busy and is informed on what's happening in her neighborhood. Her children help her in the shop when they're not busy. Blanca has had her business for three years and is very satisfied with her shop. 

This loan will be used to buy basic necessity goods to supply her store. Blanca is a founder of the community bank, as well as the treasurer, and she likes that every time the loans grow her business. 

Her dreams are to grow her business and that her children will have professional careers.

loans.use: to buy basic necessity goods.

loans.name: Celina

texts.en: Celina is 27 years old and a married woman with four children and two are in school.  She is a tailor in Yei, South Sudan.  She has been in this business for six years.  Celina requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to be able to purchase more rolls of fabric.  She will use her profits to pay for her children to go to school.

loans.use: to purchase more rolls of fabric for sale.

loans.name: San Juan Group

texts.es:
