El comité San Juan tiene 11 integrantes, todas ellas amigas y vecinas D. la ciudad D. curuguaty. Ellas se unieron con el propósito D. generar un bien para todas ellas, ya que desean progresar en sus emprendimientos y piensan que la fundación les ayudará mucho.
La señora Matías es una D. las integrantes, ella tiene una despensa, la cual está bien surtida, por este motivo es que siempre tiene buena cantidad D. clientes. Ella comenta que este es su principal medio D. subsistencia por lo que le gustaría poder seguir invirtiendo en el.
Ella solicita el préstamo para la compra D. enlatados, azúcar, yerba, fideos y demás con lo que podrá abastecer su local. Agradece a la fundación y a kiva por la ayuda.
texts.en:
The “San Juan” committee has 11 members who are all friends and neighbors from the city of Curuguaty.  They joined together in order to generate wellbeing for all of them because they hope to make progress in their enterprises and they think the Fundación will help them much.

Matías is one of the group members; she has a grocery store that’s well stocked and because of this she always has a good number of customers.  She comments that this is her main means of support so she’d like to be able to continue investing in it.

She asks for the loan to buy canned goods, sugar, herbs, pasta and others to stock her store.  She thanks the Fundación and Kiva for the help.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, sugar, herbs, noodles and others.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en: Rosalina is 34 years old and lives in Molave, Zamboanga del Sur. Rosalina is married and has 2 children. Rosalina sells different types of products to earn a living. She has had this business for 20 years. She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to purchase dried fish for her retail business. Rosalina has been a member of PMPC for 2 months. In the future, Rosalina hopes to have a big business someday.

loans.use: to purchase dried fish for her retail business

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es: la señora  Paulina es una cliente antigua que  ha trabajado en grupo solidario, actualmente la señora es casada tiene cuatro hijos que están todavía estudiando y vive  la ciudad D. La Paz  la cliente  venD.   ropa en las feria D. las mañaneras llamada así porque empiezan a vender a las 5 D. la mañana en la populosa calle Tumusla que es ahí donD. se lleva a cabo esta feria D. todos los días, el crédito lo invertirá  para   la compra D. mercadería ropa al por mayor para su venta  D. fin D. año, ya que esta época tiene gran demandada y  desea proveerse D. mercadería, la cliente se siente feliz por ser beneficiada con el crédito, la señora es responsable y puntual con sus anteriores pagos razón por la  cual se elige   con el producto  D. crédito kiva.
texts.en:
Paulina is a longstanding client who has participated in a communal bank.  Currently, she’s married and has four children still in school; she lives in the city of La Paz and sells clothes at the “Las Mañaneras” market that is called that because they start selling at 5am on crowded Tumusla Street which is where this street market takes place every day.

She will use the loan to buy clothes at wholesale for the end of year season since this is when demand is high and she wants to stock up on merchandise.  She feels happy to receive the benefit of the loan; she was responsible and punctual with her previous loans which is why she’s chosen for a Kiva loan.

loans.use: to buy seasonal clothing.

loans.name: Ushindi B Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Ushindi B Group in Western Kenya! Julia is the facilitator of the group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. 

Julia takes care of seven children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, she had a very maize yield harvesting nine bags on 1/2 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Julia was only able to harvest three bags of maize on 1/2 acre of land. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Julia and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance. 

With income from her maize sales, Julia will educate her children, ensure food security and invest in livestock rearing. In 2012, the members of Ushindi B group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: La señora Margarita, se dedica a la venta de frutas al por menor. El crédito lo requiere para aumento de  capital y poder comprar más frutas de la estación, como plátano, mango, piña, papaya. Margarita  es casada y tiene cinco  hijos. Vive en casa propia la misma queda ubicada en la zona de Huayna Potosí  de la Ciudad de El Alto. Margarita ya ha cancelado dos préstamos anteriores en forma excelente y califica para un nuevo crédito. Esta es la segunda vez que su solicitud se envía a  Kiva.
texts.en: Margarita is a fruit retailer.  She needs the loan to increase capital and be able to buy more seasonal fruit like bananas, mangoes, pineapples and papayas.  Margarita is married and has five children.  She lives in her own house located in the city of El Alto’s Huayana Potosí zone.  Margarita has repaid previous loans excellently and qualifies for a new loan.  This is the second time her request has been sent to Kiva.

loans.use: to buy seasonal fruit.

loans.name: Armelinda

texts.en: Armelinda is married and works hard to support her family. She has operated a fruit vending business in the Philippines for 3 years. Armelinda has requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to buy assorted fruits such as apples, oranges, papayas, etc.to sell. In the future, Armelinda would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy assorted fruits to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy food to stock for her cafe.

loans.name: Nuris Esther

texts.es: Nuris con su credikiva compró pescado de mar al por mayor y ganó dinero porque manejó buenos precios, Sus ventas han mejorado y esto ayuda al aumento de su nivel de vida. En la actualidad está revisando la propuesta de administrar un restaurante y está evaluando su rentabilidad. Con su credikiva nuevo comprará pescado nuevamente al pormayor, para aumentar una vez mas su capital de trabajo y servir las delicias que ella prepara con este producto en su negocio. Su meta es seguir adelante y siempre sumar. Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente:" Muchas bendiciones y que sigan apoyando a los microempresas de Colombia"
texts.en:
Nuris used her Kiva loan to buy ocean fish at wholesale and earned money because she managed good prices.  Her sales have improved and this has increased her living standard.  She’s currently looking over a proposal to open a restaurant and evaluating its profitability.

She will use her new Kiva loan to buy fish at wholesale again to increase her working capital once more and serve the delicious dishes she prepares with the fish in her business.  Her goal is to continue forward and to add always.  Her message to Kiva lenders is the following: “Many blessings and may you continue helping micro businesses in Colombia.”

loans.use: to buy fish at wholesale once more.

loans.name: Samia

texts.en: Samia is a 31 year old married woman who has 8 family members from Bani Kenanah Irbid Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 500 JOD to pay for housewares to sell in the same of the area. She wants to expand her project, she would like to increase her income

loans.use: to pay for housewares to sell

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is a single mother with five children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She is hardworking and, therefore, takes sole responsibility of looking after her children, two of whom are in school. She deals in buying and selling cocoa mainly to cocoa companies for 10 years now with an aim of family up keep. She hopes to expand her business and construct rentals for generating income.  Jane intends to use the loan facility to buy more cocoa to sell.

loans.use: to buy more cocoa to sell.

loans.name: Etibar

texts.en: Etibar has a small store where he sells spare parts. He is a very kind, friendly and hard working person. .He is 26 years old, single, lives in Salyan region Yenikand village. He applies for a loan amount of $600 to buy the spare parts: 100 cans of the paints, 10 tyres , cistern and etc. He is very optimistic about the future of his business.

loans.use: To buy the spare parts

loans.name: Ayna

texts.en:
This 51-year-old woman has run this business for 2 years.
Ayna is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli region. She is settled in  Kayidish village and is married and has 2 children.
In the beginning of her business Anya borrowed loan $400 and bought 2 calves.She likes animals and enjoys looking after the calves.
Now she needs a loan of $1000 to buy 5 bull-calves to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy 5 bull-calves

loans.name: Thoa

texts.en: Mrs. Thoa is 49 years old, and her husband has left her for another woman. She is supporting two children by herself. Mrs. Thoa's second child, Cuong, is going to the university. Mrs. Thoa doesn’t have any land, so selling folded rice pancakes is important for her family as additional income. She earns a profit from this of about $1.5/person/month, which makes their average income $12/person/month. Now Mrs. Thoa is asking to borrow a loan of $75 for her rice pancake business.

loans.use: Increase her rice pancake business

loans.name: Morn

texts.en:
Mrs. Morn S. R. is 34 years old and a mother of 5 children. She operates a grocery store and earns around $2.5/day in revenue. Her husband is motor-taxi driver and makes around $2.5 each day.

Mrs. Morn S. R. is requesting a loan amount of $600 to purchase a motorcycle for one of her children to operate a motor-taxi like her husband does. The loan will enable her and her family to have another source of income.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for one of her children to operate a business.

loans.name: Sutik Legiwati

texts.id:
Sutik Legiwati, 54 year old, is a mother who has a business as a seller of cooking ingredientss. The location of her business is at Gilimanuk market. She does her business from 5 am to 12 noon. With the start up capital of Rp 500,000 (US$ 53), Sutik started her business by selling several cooking ingredients. Her business is quickly to expand as she only sells a good quality ingredients at a competitive price.

Her average daily profit is Rp 45,000 (US$ 4.7). As she has a lot of customers now, she is having difficulties to keep up with her customers' demand as her merchandise is limited.

With the loan from DINARI, Sutik is able to add more variety to her cooking ingredients so she is able to cater her customers' demand. Of course this also improves her family's wellfare.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer.

Sutik Legiwati seorang ibu yang sudah berusia 54 tahun, mempunyai usaha sebagai Dagang Meracang ( Menjual aneka jenis bumbu dapur ). Dengan mengambil lokasi di Pasar Pagi Gilimanuk, Sutik memulai usahanya dari pukul 05.00 pagi sampai dengan pukul 12.00 siang. Dengan modal awal sebesar Rp. 500.000.- , Sutik memulai usahanya dengan menjual beberapa jenis bumbu dapur. Usaha Sutik berkembang dengan pesat karena semua barang dagangannya berkwalitas baik dan dengan harga yang bersaing. Dalam sehari Sutik mampu meraup keuntungan sebesar Rp. 45.000.- Karena usahanya sudah memiliki banyak pelanggan, Sutik merasa kewalahan untuk melayani permintaan pelanggannya karena usahanya kekurangan Modal. Dengan pinjaman dari Dinari, sekarang Sutik sudah melengkapi variasi dagangannya dengan berbagai jenis bumbu dapur sehingga semua kebutuhan pelanggannya tersedia. Sekarang ini, Sutik mendapat keuntungan yang lebih banyak dari sebelumnya dan Sutik merasa sangat bersyukur, karena hal itu dapat meningkatkan kesejahteraan keluarganya.

loans.use: To add the working capital to enable her to put more stock/ ingredients to be sold.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in more merchandise

loans.name: Saifullo

texts.en: Saifullo M. lives in Mastchokh; he is married and has 6 children. Saifullo M. has been a client of MicroInvest since 2006. Stable business and income helped to back old loans and to increase the new loan sum. He engages in business of livestock, livestock-raising and selling.  He would like to purchase a pedigree bull to increase his livestock. Also he plans to produce milk and sour products such as pasteurized milk, sour milk, sour cream and curd.  Mr. Saifullo M. requests a loan of US$1025 to buy the pedigree bull and to start sour milk production.

loans.use: to buy a pedigree bull and start sour milk production.

loans.name: Erica Consuelo

texts.es:
Erica Consuelo, member of the community bank Mujeres Emprendadoras (Enterprising Women), works selling groceries, bread and vegetables. She also sells salchipapas ( a popular fast food in Peru) and grilled meats in a bodega located in her own house in the Prolongación Manual del Águila 123 in the district and province of Moyabamba and the region of San Martín. When she separated from her husband she decided to apply her experience selling clothes to the launch of her own business, as a way to raise her 3 children and give them an education.

With this loan of 1,500 soles (Peruvian currency), which she will repay in 6 months, she will buy a variety of groceries including 50 pound sacks of rice, sugar and various legumes, packages of toilet paper, boxes of canned fish and fruits, liters of oil, boxes of soap of different brands and bins of eggs. All of this will stock her store with a varied inventory to offer to her clients.

Erica always shows herself to be good-humored and willing to work hard to get ahead. She is 30 years old and has 2 children, both still small. She longs to convert her tiny bodega into a Minimarket.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Erica Consuelo, socia del Banco Comunal Mujeres Emprendedoras, se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, panes, y verduras, también a la venta de salchipapas y parrillas en una bodega ubicada en su propia casa en la Prolongación Manuel del Águila Nº 123 , distrito y provincia de Moyabamba, departamento de San Martín. Con experiencia en la venta de ropas al separarse de su esposo decidió poner un negocio propio y así poder criar y dar educación a sus 3 hijos.

Con el préstamo de S/. 1,500.00, el cual pagará en 6 meses, comprará diversos abarrotes como sacos de 50 kilos de arroz, azúcar y menestras de diversos variedades, papel higiénico en paquetes, conservas de pescado y de frutas en cajas, aceite por litros, cajas de jabón de diferentes marcas, huevos en jabas y de esa manera tener surtido sus productos y ofrecerlo a su clientela.

La señora Erica se muestra siempre como una persona jovial y luchadora, tiene 30 años, 2 hijos aún pequeños y anhela convertir su bodega en un MiniMarket.

loans.use: Purchase of groceries (rice, sugar, legumes, canned goods)

loans.name: Tweyambe B Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Sarah M.. She is currently in the business of running a retail shop and is requesting a loan to increase capital. Sarah is 25 years old and is married. She has 4 children ranging from age 6 to 15 and her children go to school. Each week, Sarah makes approximately UGX 20000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to meet basic needs. Sarah has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 300000 in order to increase on stock and the loan was paid back on time.

Sarah is joined in her small group by Fida N., Efrance T., Justine N., and Faridah M.. Fida N. has a business in used clothing sales and wants to expand business. Efrance T. is currently operating a business running a bar and wants a loan to purchase a fridge. Justine N. operates a business of running a bar and wants to purchase a fridge. Faridah M. is currently in the business of charcoal selling and is requesting a loan to purchase more bags of charcoal.

loans.use: To increase stock in shop

loans.name: Rafael

texts.es:
Rafael is 56 years old, lives with a young lady he raised who has her own three kids. This young lady does his laundry and irons in his humble home located in "Laureles Norte". Ever since he became a widower he's been raising this young lady who had children which he treats as his own grandkids. He and his wife were never able to have children of their own and for this reason are so eager to help her. He needed a job and found one as a security guard, looking after homes in the adjacent neighborhoods. He's been doing this for approximately 8 years during the day and weekends. He's in charge of watching three blocks in the neighborhood. He has also been able to improve his humble home, which he's been able to fix according to his salary. His top priority at this time is to fix a wall that is in poor condition. He is afraid this wall will end up hurting one of these small children.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Rafael tiene 56 años, vive con una hija de crianza que tiene tres hijos menores de edad, esta muchacha lava y plancha en su humilde vivienda ubicada en el asentamiento “Laureles Norte”. Desde que enviudó hace varios años se quedó al cuido de esta joven que él y su esposa que no pudieron tener hijos la criaron como su hija y él le ayuda en la crianza y gastos de sus hijos a quienes quiere como nietos ya que el padre de ellos no le ayuda a la joven. Debido a la falta de empleos el señor decidió buscar una alternativa de sobrevivencia que le permitiera vivir de manera digna, es por eso que hace aproximadamente 8 años se dedica al negocio de vigilancia, cuidando casas de los barrios aledaños a donde habita, esta actividad la realiza en las noches, todos los días de la semana sin descanso. A su cargo, el señor cuida de dos a tres cuadras de casas, es esta actividad la que le ha permitido ayudar a su hija y nietos. También a logrado mejorar su humilde vivienda, la cual ha ido acondicionando de acuerdo a sus posibilidades económicas. La prioridad en estos momentos es la de construir una pared la cual la tiene en mal estado y necesita mejorarla, por que tiene el temor le pueda lastimar a uno de sus pequeños nietos.

loans.use: Purchase of zinc, concrete blocks, cement, sand and iron

loans.name: Paulina's Imani Group

texts.en:
Paulina is 35 years old and is divorced with 3 children, ages 17, 10, and 5. She and her husband also take care of 3 other children, ages 14, 12, and 7. Paulina is a fruits (banana) seller; she started her business in 2007. Every day she works from 7:00 AM to 5:00 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $80 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more fruits for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, Laurencia and Fatuma, who have businesses dealing in charcoal and food vending.

loans.use: To buy more fruits for her business

loans.name: Ángel

texts.es:
Angel works constantly to create a source of income through sales of collectable books and a variety of kitchen utensils. With lots of perseverance he is able to find unique items in Lima and, as a street vendor, sell them in Juliaca city. For many years his success has enabled him to cover his basic expenses and pay for his children’s education. This enterprising father has a lot of plans for his business, but to finalize them he needs an investment. With this goal in mind he is turning to you and hopes to receive your support.

Translated by Todd M. Anderson, Kiva volunteer

Don Ángel, trabaja constantemente creando su propia fuente de ingreso mediante la venta de libros de colección y variedad de utensilios de cocina, gracias a su perseverancia y a los novedosos artículos que adquiere en la ciudad de Lima y los oferta en forma ambulatoria en la ciudad de Juliaca. Durante muchos años su desempeño le ha permitido cubrir sus necesidades más urgentes y la educación de sus hijos.Este emprendedor padre tiene muchos planes en su negocio, pero para concretarlo necesita inversión, con ese fin recurre a vosotros con la esperanza de recibir tu apoyo.

loans.use: Additional capital for expanding his business

loans.name: Chea

texts.en: Mrs. Chea S. is a Khmer cake seller in Trapang Mates Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Her husband, Mr. Dun Mork, is a construction worker. They have two children, one of whom is working in a garment factory while the other is studying in state school. Although Mrs. Chea S.’s family members work hard, they are still in a poor condition. Mrs. Chea S. wishes to start a plantation business, so she is requesting a loan so she obtain land for this purpose

loans.use: To buy a part of a rice field

loans.name: Kanzoro Marie Thérès

texts.fr:
Married with one child, Mrs. Kanzoro Marie Thérèse D. was born in Lomé on February 6, 1979. She gave herself one challenge in life: to run a successful business. After thoroughly studying the lay of the land, she got involved in the sale of plastic goods--utensils, chairs, etc. She is the sole retailer in the area, which has given her a monopoly. Thus, her business is experiencing amazing growth. At this stage of growth, an increase in her working capital would be welcomed. This is why she is asking for her first loan, which will allow her to increase her total number of chairs to 100.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

Mariée mère d’un enfant, madame D. Kanzoro Marie Thérèse est née à Lomé le 06 février 1979. Elle s’est lancé un défit dans la vie : réussir son propre affaire. Après une étude minutieuse du terrain, elle s’est lancée en 2006 dans la vente d’articles en plastiques, ustensiles, chaises… Elle est la seule détaillante dans le milieu, ce qui fait qu’elle a le monopole. L’activité connaît alors une croissance fulgurante. A ce stade de sa croissance, une augmentation de son fonds de commerce serait bien venue. C’est pourquoi elle sollicite ce premier prêt qui lui permettra d’augmenter le stock de ses chaises de 100.

loans.use: Purchase of plastic chairs

loans.name: Bunavsha

texts.ru:
Bunavsha K. lives in Shahrinav. She is 37 years of age, married, and has four children. She works as a nurse in a district clinic. In addition, she works in agriculture. She sows various types of vegetables and sells the crop in the market to wholesalers. She wants to take out a loan to buy seeds and fertilizer. She is scheduled to pay off the loan in 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Melissa, Kiva volunteer.

Кахорова Бунавша проживает в районе Шахринау. Возраст 37 лет , замужем и имеет четверых детей. Работает медсестрой в районной поликлинике. Дополнительно занимается земледелием. Сеет различного вида овощи,получаемый урожай продает на рынке , сдавая оптовикам. Хочет получить кредит для того , чтобы закупить семена и удобрения. Погасить кредит планирует в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Buying seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Livestock And Small Business, Clothing Store Group

texts.vi:
Chị Nguyễn Thị Miến (Ms 17090025), sinh năm 1968. Công việc hang ngày của chị là kinh doanh bán hàng quần áo vải vóc nhưng chị vẫn không bỏ nghề nông. Chị vẫn cấy lúa và trồng rau. Chồng chị làm thợ mộc, hai con chị còn đi học. Thu nhập bình quân của gia đình chị khoảng 200.000 vnđ/ ngày. Chị tham gia vay vốn ở mức: 5.724.000 vnđ để mở rộng cửa hàng quần áo. Trong nhóm chị còn có:
Phạm Thị Đông (Ms 17090019), sinh năm 1969, công việc hàng ngày của chị là chăn nuôi lợn và làm ruộng. Chồng chị làm công nhân, thu nhập binh quân của vợ chồng chị khoảng 100.000 vnđ/ ngày. Chị tham gia ở mức:5.724.000 vnđ để chăn nuôi.
Nguyễn Thị Mừng (Ms 17090021), sinh năm 1976, tham gia vay vốn ở mức:5.724.000 vnđ để đầu tư chăn nuôi.
Nguyễn Thị Là Ms 17090024), sinh năm 1975, chị tham gia mức vốn: 5.724.000 vnđ để mở rộng kinh doanh. Gia đình chị có cửa hàng kinh doanh ga, nước sạch đem lại thu nhập khoảng 150.000 vnđ / ngày.
Nguyễn Thị Xuyến (Ms 17090026), sinh năm 1972, tham gia mức vay: 6.148.000 vnđ để thêm vốn đi chợ. Hàng ngày chị vẫn ra chợ bán thịt lợn và tăng gia sản xuất tạo thu nhập khoảng 200.000 vnđ / ngày.
Nguyễn Thị Tuyên (Ms 17090090), sinh năm 1987, tham gia mức vay: 4.028.000 vnđ để đầu tư chăn nuôi lợn.
texts.en:
Mrs. Mien Thi N. was born in 1968. Her day job is selling clothes and fabric, but she still does not abandon her agricultural work. She still tills the wheat fields and plants vegetables. Her husband is a wood carver, and her two children attend school. The family's average income is about 200,000 VND per day. She joined the fund with a loan of 5,724,000 VND to expand her clothing store. Her group also includes: Mrs. Dong Thi P., born in 1969. She raises pigs and does farm work. Her husband is a factory worker. The couple's average income is 100,000 VND per day. She joined with a loan of 5,724,000 VND to raise livestock. Mrs. Mung Thi N., born in 1976, joined with a loan of 5,724,000 VND to invest in livestock. Mrs. La Thi N., born in 1975, joined with a loan of 5,724,000 VND to expand her business. Her family owns a store selling gas and clean water, bringing in an income of 150,000 VND per day. Mrs. Xuyen Thi N., born in 1972, joined with a loan of 6,148,000 VND to have more capital for her trading business. Each day she goes to the market to sell pork and raise livestock, with an income of 200,000 VND per day. Mrs. Tuyen Thi N., born in 1987, joined with a loan of 4,028,000 VND to invest in livestock.

Translated from Vietnamese by Chi N., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in livestock and small business

loans.name: Zinatou

texts.fr:
Agée de 21 ans, dame A. R. Zinatou est mariée et mère d’un enfant. Elle a pour activité la vente de foulard et de vêtement pour enfant. Elle a commencé cette activité depuis 2005 au moment où elle réside à Sotouboua dans la région centrale du Togo.
Actuellement, elle vit avec son mari qui est un chauffeur de taxis à Lomé.
L’activité de A. R. Zinatou consiste à vendre ses marchandises de quartier en quartier. Elle parcourt en moyenne 14km à pieds par jour.
Elle désire augmenter son stock avec 2 douzaines de foulards et 5 douzaines de vêtement pour enfant afin de pouvoir bien vendre raison pour laquelle elle sollicite ce premier crédit.
texts.en:
Ms. Zinatou A. R., age 21, is married and the mother of one child. Her work involves selling scarves and clothing for children. She started this business in 2005 when she lived in Sotouboua in the middle of Togo. Currently, she lives with her husband who is a taxi driver in Lomé. She sells merchandise from district to district covering on foot a 14-km course on average each day. She would like to increase her inventory with two dozen scarves and five dozen pieces of children's clothing in order to do well in her sales. This is why she is requesting this initial loan.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy some children's scarfs and clothing

loans.name: Lucas

texts.es: El Sr. Lucas F.  tiene varios años de antigüedad en el rubro del Transporte urbano, vive en una pequeña casa en alquiler, junto a su familia. Nesecitaba un credito para la reparacion de su vehículo y acudio a Emprender, donde ya habia sacado un credito anteriormente, y lo había pagado con puntualidad, por ello es favorecido para ser financiado por los amigos de Kiva, el Sr. Lucas F. tiene un hijo pequeño y con los ingresos que percibe con su trabajo ayuda a mantener su hogar. Este credito es el segundo se le aprobó, esta vez para la reparacion de su vehiculo.
texts.en:
Mr Lucas F. has worked in public transportation for several years. He lives, along with his family, in a small, rented home. He asks for a loan to repair his vehicle. He seeks this loan through Emprender, from whom he sought a previous loan and paid back punctually. Mr Lucas F. has a small child, and with his income he supports his household. This second loan will help him repair his vehicle.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair his vehicle

loans.name: Farrukh

texts.en:
Farrukh A. is a 32 year old man who raises cows and sells dairy products to local people and factories. He is married and has two sons. As he grew up in a farming family from the beginning of his life, Farrukh has learned how to raise, breed, and sell dairy cows and other livestock.

Farrukh would like to expand his business and purchase additional cows for $1,200 USD. The purpose of the loan is to expand his business and improve the life of his family. He is working for this aim very hard and hopes that this loan will help him and make his financial income more stable.

loans.use: To purchase cattle and small cattle to expand the business.

loans.name: Ama

texts.fr:
Cette dame de cinquante et un (51)  réside dans le quartier de djidjolé dans la ville de Lomé au Togo. Elle est très travailleuse et a pour activité la vente de céréales et de tubercules qui sont des aliments très consommés dans la cuisine Togolaise et servent  à préparer de la pâte du fufu et bien d’autres choses. Elle demande son premier prêt à) WAGES pour acheter 100 tubercules, un sac de maïs et un sac de riz.
Elle est mariée et a 05 personnes à charges.
texts.en:
This 51-year-old lady lives in the Djidjolé neighborhood of the city of Lomé in Togo. She works hard at her business of selling cereals and yams, foods that are much in demand for Togolese cuisine as they are used in preparing "fufu" (white yams pounded into something like mashed potatoes) and many other dishes. She is requesting her first loan from WAGES to buy 100 coco yams, a sack of maize, and a sack of rice.

She is married and is responsible for 5 persons.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of cereals for re-sale

loans.name: Touch

texts.en:
Mrs. Touch C. is a villager in Tadork Pong village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. 

On this plantation, she faces a problem, because she usually pays someone to plow the field. Thus, Mrs. Touch C. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding and plowing the field for cultivation. 

She is a 46-year-old widow with two children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory, while the other is a construction.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding and plowing the rice field for cultivation.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma has been in barangay (township) Paragu, Tumauini, Isabela since she was born. She is happily married to Mario, a corn and rice farmer. She and Mario have four children: Maritel – 26 years old, Education graduate; Carol – 28 years old, Computer Science graduate; Joy – 30 years old, Engineering graduate; and Rochelle – 33 years old, a two-year course graduate. They have an average level of living.

Thelma is thankful that through her business, she was able to send all her children to school and to finish their studies. Although her children already graduated from college, she wanted to maintain her store for them to have a stable source of income providing for their needs. She is now asking for a loan of PHP 6,000 that she will use in her store and for their farming needs. Some of the things that she intends to buy are 3 sacks of rice, cooking oil, and a sack of brown sugar. She further said that her grandchildren will also benefit from her business.

loans.use: Store improvement and farming needs

loans.name: Beauty

texts.en: Beauty is 31 years old and single. She sells sarongs. She hopes for the loan amount of N 100,000 to purchase more sarongs to sell. She hopes to expand her business. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Norma Rosa

texts.es:
L. señora Norma R. D. L. R. V. tiene 44 años D. edad, vive en el distrito D. Moche, provincia D. Trujillo, departamento D. L. Libertad, Perú.
L. empresaria presenta estudio superior incompleto, tiene 1 hijo que depenD. económicamente D. elL..
Norma tiene una pequeña tienda D. abarrotes entre los cuales también venD. gaseosas, golosinas, etc y complementa su negocio con L. elaboración D. tejidos en hilo, manifiesta que sus ganancia poco a poco van aumentando y que se esfuerza por tener surtida su tienda para que D. esa manera pueda generarse mayores ingresos; su negocio esta ubicado en su domicilio.
L. señora Norma recién forma parte del Banco Comunal  “Santa Lucia II”, que lo invirtió para comprar productos para formar su pequeña tienda.
L. empresaria pertenece también al taller D. creaciones “MOCHE”, en el cual aprenD. a confeccionar variedades y tejidos, los cuales también hacen que le genere un ingreso mas para su hogar.
Con este primer préstamo D. 300 Nuevos Soles que cancelará en 04 meses ,lo invertirá en L. compra D. golosinas,gaseosas y otros productos para implementar el negocio.
texts.en:
Norma R. D. L. R. V. is 44 years old and lives in the Moche district of the Trujillo province, L. Libertad, Perú. This businesswoman did not complete her studies, and has one son who depends on her financially. Norma has a small grocery store where she sells items such as soft drinks, snacks, etc., and she complements this business with handmaD. embroideries. She states that her earnings are increasing little by little, and she makes a great effort to keep her store well-stocked so she can generate more income; her business is located in her house. Norma recently became part of the “Santa Lucia II” cooperative bank, and she invested in the purchase of products to establish her small store. She also belongs to the “MOCHE” workshop, where she makes handmaD. and knitted items that help her add to the income she generates for the household. With this first loan of 300.00 Peruvian soles that she will cancel in 4 months, she will invest in the purchase of snacks, soft drinks, and other products for the business.  

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase snacks, soft drinks, and other products for her business.

loans.name: Rodulfo

texts.en: "Responsible man" describes Mr. Rodulfo B., 62 years old, married and resides at Tabo-o, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He has 4 children. He has children who have families of their own. Rodulfo and his wife manages their snack-inn. Last November 2006, he joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative to request additional working capital for his snack-inn. Fortunately, they have managed the business so well. They were able to send their children to school and able to sustain the needs of their family. Now, he applies for PHP 12,000 to buy breads & soft drinks. He hopes that his business will continue throughout the years despite the business challenges.

loans.use: to buy additional goods for resale

loans.name: Christina

texts.en: Christina E. is a petty trader selling foodstuffs at Ankwanda near Elmina which she has done since 2004. She is married with 5 dependents and has received an education through Primary School.  While she works as a petty trader, her husband is employed as a farmer.  She is responsible for paying her children’s school fees. Her loan will be used to purchase additional goods such as "gari" (cassava grits), maize, pineapples, cassava and plantains for re-sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to purchase land and build a house for her family.

loans.use: purchase additional goods such as gari, maize, pineapples, cassava and plantains for re-sale

loans.name: Maria Prima

texts.en: Maria Prima A. offers her services to everybody who wishes to take advantage of them. She serves as "manicurista", a person who offers manicures and pedicures to customers. With her 3 children, Maria needs to have 6 or 7 clients every day to be able to keep up with the children's daily expenses. She knows that  if she had the complete materials and various nail polish colors, her business would be more attractive to her local market. A loan amounting to PHP 5,000 payable in 5 months' term would be of great  help to her.

loans.use: to purchase nail polish, etc.

location.town: Purok 1-B, Del Carmen, Iligan City, Lanao del Nort

loans.name: Olga

texts.es: Olga tiene 40 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora y luchadora, vive en su propia casa junto a su esposo Ernesto de 42 años y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida. Lleva 10 años cocinando para la gente que asiste a su restaurante, el cual está ubicado en una de las calles más céntricas de la ciudad de Juliaca, su negocio es uno de los más visitados, ya que tiene una gran variedad de platos que ofrecer, como ella misma dice, “hay para todos los gustos”.  A ella le gustaría tener un restaurante más grande, donde pueda atender mejor a sus clientes, puesto que disfruta mucho de cocinar y conversar con sus comensales, eso sí, lo que le resulta difícil es atender a toda la gente que ingresa a su restaurante, ya que es demasiado cansado para ella sola. Es el primer préstamo al que accede Olga con MFP, desea pagarlo a tiempo y sin dificultades, en su banco comunal es muy respetada, ya que es la socia más activa y comprometida. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más sillas para su restaurante y así poder atender a más gente.
texts.en:
Olga is 40 years old, and a very hardworking and driven woman. She lives in her own house with her spouse, 42-year-old Ernesto, and what she desires most is to improve her quality of life. She has spent 10 years cooking for patrons of her restaurant, which is located in one of the most central streets of the city of Juliaca. Her business is one of the most frequented spots because it offers a great variety of dishes--as she says, "something for all tastes". She would like to have a larger restaurant where she could tend to more customers. She really enjoys cooking for and conversing with her diners, but the difficult part is taking care of everyone who visits her restaurant because it is too tiring for her alone. This is Olga's first loan with MFP. She hopes to pay it back on time and without problems. She is well respected in her communal bank, as she is the most active and committed member. With this loan of 1,000 soles, she will buy more chairs for her restaurant so she can cater to more people.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase chairs

loans.name: Abdusodyk

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 

Марасулов Абдусодык – мужчина 1958-го года рождения, женат, имеет 5-х детей. Вместе со своей женой Собировой Мавлюдой  он занимается выпечкой и продажей лепёшек.Раньше  Абдусодык работал на хлебозаводе пекарем. Как и многие его земляки после развала Союза он остался без работы. Чтобы прокормить свою большую семью он должен много работать.Его навыки пекаря очень пригодились ему, когда они с женой решили печь дома лепёшки и продавать их у входа в продуктовый рынок.В начале им пришлось очень трудно, так как у них не было постоянного места.Крупные торговцы вытесняли их с рынка.Сейчас благодаря кредиту КИВА они расширили свой бизнес и приобрели торговую точку.
texts.en:
Born 1958, Abdusodyk M. is married and has 5 children. Together with his wife, Mavluda Sobirova, he is involved in baking and selling flatbread. Previously, Abdusodyk worked as a baker at a bread factory. Much like many of his countrymen, he lost his job after the fall of the Soviet Union. He has to work a lot in order to support his big family. His knowledge as a baker came in handy, when his wife and he decided to bake flatbread at home and sell it at the entrance of the food market. It was hard for them at the beginning because they did not have a permanent retail location. Big retailers used to force them out of the market. Now, thanks to a loan from Kiva, they expanded their business and bought a store.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Wholesale purchase of 45 bags of flour

loans.name: Las Activas Group

texts.es: El banco comunal “Las Activas” están representadas por la señora Claudia y conformada por 12 miembros residentes del barrio 1ª de mayo que van cursando juntos su segundo ciclo demostrando responsabilidad, honestidad y ganas de trabajar para salir adelante. Una mayoría de los miembros del grupo se dedican a actividades comerciales como comida, pan, ropa, refrescos y al servicio de amenización de fiestas. La competencia en el ámbito comercial y de servicios es alta pero los miembros del grupo saben como salir adelante gracias a su experiencia y sus ganas de trabajar. El destino del financiamiento es para la adquisición de materiales, insumos y herramientas que ayuden a generar un mayor ingreso ya que de ello depende el sustento de sus familias y mejoramiento de su calidad de vida. Por cursar su segundo ciclo juntas las socias cuentan con experiencia en grupos solidarios por lo que la fundación Agrocapital coadyuva otorgando un apoyo económico mientras el grupo demuestre unidad y solidaridad entre ellos.
texts.en:
The communal bank “Las Activas” [“The Active Ones”] is led by Claudia and consists of 12 member that reside in the 1st of May neighborhood; they are on their second loan cycle together and have demonstrated responsibility, honesty, and a drive to work to get ahead in life. The majority of the group members run businesses in the sale of food, bread, clothing, drinks, and party planning services. Competition in the commercial and services sector is high but the group members know how to get ahead thanks to their experience and drive to work. The loan will be used to acquire materials, supplies, and tools that will help the group generate higher incomes; their families depend on this income and it will afford them a better quality of life. Because they are in their second loan cycle together, the group members count on their experience in solidarity groups for which the Agrocapital Foundation continues given them economic support as long as the group continues showing unity and solidarity amongst themselves.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operation capital (to acquire materials, supplies, and tools).

loans.name: Bingin Sari Group

texts.en:
Ni Wayan Sulastri is a 38-year-old female living in the town of Pangkung Tanah - Melaya. Ni Wayan Sulastri is the leader of an 11-member loan group sponsored by DINARI.  Although each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for repaying the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Bingin Sari (DNR.M-0586).

Ni Wayan Sulastri is married and has 2 school-aged children. To making a living, Ni Wayan Sulastri raises pigs for sale. Ni Wayan Sulastri has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 400.000 IDR a month from these activities.

In 2009, Ni Wayan Sulastri joined DINARI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ni Wayan Sulastri is requesting a loan from DINARI for the first time. She is requesting a loan of 2.200.000 IDR which will be used to expand her business. Ni Wayan Sulastri plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

About DINARI:

The mission of DINARI is to strive for the preservation of the environment, to empower the poor, and to provide socio-economic development opportunities to small business owners.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Ni Wayan Sulastri 0 (0) merupakan 38 tahun wanita.  Dia (perempuan) tinggal di kota Pangkung Tanah - Melaya.  Ni Wayan Sulastri adalah pemimpin kelompok sebuah kelompok peminjam yang terdiri atas 11 anggota.  Meskipun setiap anggota kelompok menerima pinjaman perorangan, mereka semua bertanggung jawab untuk mengembalikan pinjaman rekan anggota kelompok mereka jika ada yang menunggak atau gagal membayar.  Nama resmi kelompok peminjam ini adalah Bingin Sari (DNR.M-0586).


Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari beternak babi untuk dijual.  Ni Wayan Sulastri sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 10 tahun.  Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, Ni Wayan Sulastri menghasilkan sekitar 0,400 IDR.  Dalam 2009, Ni Wayan Sulastri bergabung DINARI untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan  -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis.  Ni Wayan Sulastri telah berhasil melunasi pinjaman sebelumnya dari DINARI.    Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 2.200.000 IDR.


Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 1st pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari DINARI.


Tentang DINARI:

Misi DINARI adalah memperjuangkan kelestarian lingkungan, memberdayakan kaum miskin, dan menyediakan kesempatan pembangunan sosial ekonomi bagi pemilik usaha kecil.


*Catatan: Untuk memaksimalkan efisiensi & menurunkan biaya, pinjaman ini ditempelkan menggunakan templat sehingga dapat diterjemahkan otomatis oleh Kiva. .  Mengingat bahwa terjemahan manual atas profil memakan biaya besar, Kiva menciptakan templat ini untuk Mitra Lapangan untuk memungkinkan mereka terus menempelkan pinjaman dalam  Bahasa sambil memberikan informasi yang bermutu & akurat kepada para pemberi pinjaman Kiva.  ."

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Pauline

texts.fr: Pauline est née le 22/11/1976 à Sègbohouè. Pauline est mariée à Henri, un photographe. Pauline et Henri ont six enfants à charge dont cinq qui sont leurs propres enfants. Certains de ces enfants sont scolarisés. Pauline supporte les charges de la famille avec son mari. Pauline est alphabétisée. Depuis cinq ans, Pauline vend de beignets faits à base de farine de blé et la bouillie de maïs devant sa maison. C’est à Dantokpa, grand marché international du Bénin que Pauline achète ses produits. Pauline est à son septième crédit avec ALIDé et Pauline rembourse très bien ses prêts. Les crédits d’ALIDé ont permis à Pauline d’améliorer le niveau de son activité ainsi que sa vie et celle de sa famille. Pauline sollicite ce prêt pour acheter en gros le maïs, la farine de blé et l’huile végétale.
texts.en:
Pauline was born on November 22, 1976 in Sègbohouè. She is married to Henri, a photographer. Pauline and Henri have six children to support, including five of their own. Some of them are in school. Pauline and her family have been living in Cotonou for six years. Pauline bears the family expenses along with her husband. Pauline is literate. For five years, Pauline has been selling fritters (made from wheat flour) and corn porridge in front of her house. Dantokpa, the grand international marketplace of Benin, is where Pauline purchases her goods. She is on her seventh loan ALIDé and has repaid her loans. ALIDé loans have enabled her to improve her level of business, as well as her family’s living conditions. She’s requesting this loan to buy corn wholesale, wheat flour, and vegetable oil.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn and flour

loans.name: María Del Transito

texts.es: María Del Transito R. T. reside en Armenia municipio del departamento de Sonsonate. María tiene 30 años de edad, madre soltera de su único hijo Cesar de 17 años, estudiante. María ha luchado por sacar adelante a su hijo dándole lo mejor; ella ha logrado comprar su propia casa a través de las ganancias que su negocio le permite, María posee una venta de ropa para niños y adultos, el negocio se encuentra ubicado en una calle con mucha afluencia en la zona de Armenia, el crédito que María solicita es para surtir su negocio con otra variedad de prendas que le permitan generar ingresos para ella y su hijo.
texts.en:
María Del Transito R. T. lives in the town of Armenia, which is in the district of Sonsonate. She is 30 years old and a single mother. Her only son Cesar is 17 years old and a student. María has struggled to get ahead and provide the best for her son. She managed to buy her own home using the profits from her business.

María sells clothing for children and adults. Her business is located on a street in one of the more crowded areas of Armenia. The loan that she requested will be used to restock her business with a variety of clothing. This will enable her to generate more income for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to restock her business

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet is a 50-year-old married mother of seven children, two of whom are still in school.  Her  husband does small scale farming.  Janet buys and sells local chicken breeds at the Jubilee market.  She started her business in 1989.  She has been able to raise her family from her sale proceeds.  Her business does especially well during certain seasons like Christmas.  She requests a 20,000 KES loan to enable her to buy more stock.

loans.use: Additional stock

loans.name: Maria Lilian Tatiana

texts.en:
Maria is 46 years old, single, and has three children.  She is an English language teacher in the city of Cochabamba, Bolivia, and has been teaching for over 20 years.  Maria is a very hard worker; in addition to teaching, she runs a small convenience store.

At the store, Maria sells sugar, grains, crackers, juice, soda, and other basic foods.  When Maria is teaching during the day, her daughter helps run the shop. With this loan from CIDRE, she hopes to increase the variety of merchandise she has to offer, so as to attract more customers and ultimately earn more.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her shop

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel C. is from the village of Don Jose Aguirre. She is 22 years old, married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Maricel owns and operates a food stall. The main source of income for the business comes from selling farm products, such as bananas and vegetables, in the local community. Maricel has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Maricel joined Kiva partner PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. This loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Maricel is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used for the same purpose. This loan will be her second from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies and for her children education. 

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Kumushay's Group

texts.ru:
Акматалиева Кумушай – лидер данной группы. Ей сорок семь лет. Кумушай  вместе с семьёй живёт в г. Токмок. Муж Кумушай работает электриком. Вместе они вырастили троих дочерей. Старшей и средней дочерям по двадцать девять и двадцать шесть соответственно. Обе замужем. Младшая двадцатилетняя дочь живёт с родителями. Кумушай, как может, помогает мужу содержать семью. Еще, будучи молодой, родственники посоветовали ей заниматься животноводством. Ведь заниматься этим делом удобнее всего находясь дома. Выйдя замуж, Кумушай не пренебрегла этим советом, и потихоньку приобрела кое – какую живность. Теперь Кумушай содержит две коровы и двоих телят и продает молоко. Все эти годы Кумушай имела возможность зарабатывать существенные средства от продажи молока, а также постепенно увеличивала поголовье скота  и продавала по необходимости. Младшая дочь и муж после работы всегда помогают Кумушай ухаживать за скотом. Таким образом Кумушай не испытывает никаких трудностей в своём хозяйстве. Кумушай очень заботит будущее младшей дочери. Младшая дочь сейчас учится в университете. И надо оплачивать контракт за обучение. Одному мужу Кумушай было бы не по силам осилить и текущие расходы семьи и контракт одновременно. Поэтому Кумушай решила обратиться за кредитом. Но Кумушай не хочет брать кредит и сразу отдавать за обучение. Для начала, она хочет вложить кредитные средства на приобретение телёнка; откормить его, а затем продать. А с полученной прибыли оплатить контракт. Это позволит сэкономить значительную сумму денег. Кумушай в будущем хочет купить дом в этом же городе.

Партнёры Кумушай по группе:   Зууракан, Нурбек и Жылдыз.

Зууракан сорок четыре. Супруг работает таксистом. Сама же Зууракан домохозяйка и держит коров, продаёт молоко. У них четверо детей. Зууракан обратилась за кредитом с целью купить дойную корову. 

Нурбеку сорок три года. Жена Нурбека реализует продукты питания в магазине. Сам же Нурбек держит скот, продаёт молоко. У них четверо детей. Младшей дочери всего четыре годика. Нурбек надеется получить кредит и вложить деньги на приобретение телят. 

Жылдыз всего двадцать лет. Но она уже занимается большим делом. Рано выйдя замуж, Жылдыз разделила занятие мужа – фермерство. Сейчас она ежедневно доит восемнадцать коров и сдаёт 50л. Молока. Жылдыз надеется получить кредит и вложить деньги в перепродажу крупнорогатого скота.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Kumushay A. is a leader of this group. She is forty seven years old. Kumushay lives together with her family in the town of Tokmok. Kumushay's husband works as an electrician. Together they have raised three daughters. Their oldest and middle daughters are twenty nine and twenty six respectfully. They are both married. The youngest nineteen year old daughter lives with parents. Kumushay helps her husband to support the family the best she can. When she was still young, the relatives advised her to start doing animal husbandry. It's very convenient to run this business from home. When she got married Kumushay did not ignore this advice and had slowly bought some livestock. Right now Kumushay has two cows and two calves and sells the milk. All these years Kumushay had the opportunity to have a good income from milk sales and had also gradually increased the head count of cattle and sold it as was needed. Her youngest daughter and husband also help Kumushay to take care of the cattle after work. This is why Kumushay does not have any difficulties with her business. Kumushay is very worried about her youngest daughter's future. She is now studying at the university. She needs to pay the tuition fees. Kumushay and her husband alone cannot afford to pay the tuition and family's expenses at the same time. This is why Kumushay has decided to apply for a loan. But she does not want to take the loan and spend it all on the tuition. For the start, she wants to invest the loan money to buy a calf; after feeding it she will sell it and use the income to pay the tuition fees. This will allow her to save a great deal of money. Kumushay wants to buy a house in the same town in the future. Kumushay's group partners are: Zuurakan, Nurbek and Jyldyz. Zuurakan is forty four. Her husband works as a taxi driver. Zuurakan is a housewife, she keeps cows and sells milk. They have four children. Zuurakan has come for a loan to buy a milk cow. Nurbek is forty three years old. Nurbek's wife sells food in the store. Nurbek himself keeps cattle and sells milk. They have four children. The youngest daughter is only four years old. Nurbek hopes to receive the loan and invest the money to buy calves. Jyldyz is only twenty. But she is already running a big business. She has married early and took part in her husband's business – farming. At this time she milks eighteen cows daily and sells 50 litters of milk. Jyldyz hopes to receive the loan and invest the money in resale of large cattle. --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and raise a calf and later sell it on the market in order to pay for daughter's university education

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase crops in bulk to sell.

loans.name: Sodnomtseren

texts.en:
Sodnomtseren C. is 48 years old and lives with her husband and four children in Zavkhan Province, Mongolia. She and her family live in a ger, which is a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. Her husband currently works as a loader at a local meat factory. With the help of her children, Sodnomtseren operates a small bakery in her town, making a variety of breads and buns that are very popular among her many customers. She produces on average up to 20-25 loaves of bread and 8-10 kg of buns per day.

Sodnomtseren started her bakery business in 2004. At first she had only a manual oven to make her products, but after several years of steady earnings she was able to purchase a more efficient modern oven last year. Her success has also enabled her to buy new furniture for her home and pay her children's tuition fees. Sodnomtseren is working hard to continue her success in the future. She hopes to soon purchase more tools and supplies to help her business and says, "My goal is to one day own my own workplace." She is requesting a 500,000 tugrug (~350 USD) loan to purchase flour for her bakery. About XacBank XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save. To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team: http://www.kiva.org/team/xacbank_mongolia To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here:http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&queryString=Mongolia&status=fundRaising&gender=All§ors[]=All®ions[]=All&sortBy=Expiring+Soon

loans.use: To purchase flour

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia J. is currently in the business of selling cooking oil at the market and is requesting a loan to purchase more jerrycans of cooking oil to sell.  Lucia is 30 years old and is married to a driver. She has five children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a bar.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase more cooking oil for resale

loans.name: Jusilene

texts.en: Jusilene A. runs a sari-sari (variety retail shop) selling food and daily use products like eggs, canned goods, coffee, milk and more in her community. She is 39 years old, married and has two grown-up children. She is from the village of Mambajao, Camiguin province. Jusilene has been in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2009, Jusilene joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Jusilene has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI which was used to to purchase products to sell. Jusilene is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her third loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of northern Mindanao. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Estrelita's Group

texts.en:
Estrelita G. is from the village of Brgy, Buliwao, Quezon, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 45 years old. Estrelita is the group leader of a 6-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Estrelita is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Estrelita owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Estrelita has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately PHP 5,000 a month for these activities.

In 2007, Estrelita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Estrelita has successfully repaid a previous loan of PHP 25,000 from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. Estrelita is requesting a new loan of PHP 15,000, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Estrelita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies.

loans.name: Liep

texts.en:
Mrs. Liep K. lives in Roneam Tnaot village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land where she cultivates rice for a living. She is facing some difficulty because her field contains infertile soil.  She is seeking a loan to buy fertilizers to support the field and make her crop more productive.  She also intends to use part of the loan to buy pesticides to kill all kinds of insects. Her husband, Mr. Nob Hol, is a rice laborer. 

Mrs. Liep K. is a mother of four children, one of whom is a farmer while the others attend the local school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
Mohamed J. is a hairdresser and a dealer in cosmetics. Born in 1969, he is married with four children. 

Mohamed has a small beauty salon and cosmetic shop along one of the busiest streets in the town.  He has two female trainees in the salon and more people are asking him to train them in hairdressing. He has a plan to rent a bigger space so that he can help them. 

In fact that is why he needs the loan. Mohamed believes that hairdressing can provide employment for a good number of youths and he wants to help in that direction.

He is very hopeful and believes that his vocation is profitable and can help him to realize his dreams in the near future.

loans.use: To rent a larger space for training

loans.name: Josefa

texts.es:
La señora Josefa D. S., vive en la colonia Gerardo lindo, trabaja en la escuela Frank Cortez de Chinandega, es maestra de primaria, es casada tiene tres hijos pero ninguno depende de ella.

Ella solicito crédito en Ceprodel por que necesita realizar unas mejoras en su vivienda  para brindar seguridad a su familia
texts.en:
Señora Josefa D. S. lives in the district of Gerardo Lindo. She works in the Frank Cortez de Chinandega school where she is a primary school teacher. Josefa is married and has 3 children, however none of them depend on her. She is seeking a loan with Ceprodel because she needs to do some home improvements to give her family security.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home improvements

loans.name: Seng

texts.en: Seng V., age 29, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia.  She is engaged in the business of buying rubber for sale, earning an income of $5 per day to help cover the family expenses. Her husband is a worker at the rubber plantation, and he also buys rubber for resale, earning an income of $5 per day. Their standard of living has improved since they started these businesses, and V. is now requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase more rubber, a motorbike, and wood to repair the house. This will be her second loan from CREDIT, partnered with Kiva.

loans.use: To buy rubber for resale

loans.name: Beng

texts.en:
Mrs. C. is a 45-year-old widow. She works very hard as a fish seller in her village, and typically earns around $4 per day. She has four school-aged children who sometimes work as temporary laborers when they are free from studying. This provides a part of the income that supports the family.

C. leads her fish business more smoothly, there being many regular clients. She has had a goal to improve her business for a long time but she can’t do it because she doesn’t have the capital. Thus, C. is looking for assistance to help her to increase the financial capital of her fish-selling business.

loans.use: To increase the financial capital of her fish-selling business

loans.name: Kek

texts.en:
Mr. Kek T. is a 26-year-old married man. (He was not available for photographing, so his wife is pictured instead). Kek T. works very hard raising ducks in his village and typically earns around $4 per day. He built a medium cage next to his house in which he breeds many ducks for eggs and for sale. He has two small kids who are not enrolled in school. He has another financial earner in his wife, who is a vegetable seller in the market. 

Kek T. hopes to operate another business for extra income, but he has not been able to do it because he doesn’t have money. Kek T. decided to seek a Kiva loan through HKL. He will use the loan to buy a cultivating machine, which will enable him to provide plowing services to farmers for a fee.

loans.use: To buy a cultivating machine

loans.name: Lukia

texts.en: Lukia is married with five children and all her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. Lukia sells new and used clothes and sells to all categories of people at retail and at wholesale.  She wants to use this loan to buy more second hand clothes. Lukia uses public transport to and from shopping and does her shopping twice a week.  She buys these clothes from Owino market, one of the busiest markets in Kampala city. Lukia works seven days a week. Her business challenges include transportation and the rainy season, which hinders her customers from reaching her. Her goals and aspirations include getting a permanent business premise and importing clothes.  Lukia resides in and owns a three-room house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more second hand clothes

loans.name: Sharip

texts.en: Sharip N. is 52 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Bayn-Ulgii province, Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, which is a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. They have been living together in their current home for 10 years. Sharip operates a taxi service in his town. He has worked as a driver since 1976. Sharip began his career as a driver for a governmental organization between 1976 and 1989. In 1989 he began transporting coal with his car. Sharip started his current taxi service in 2006. His oldest son, Shalhar, also operates a transportation business with his Russian microbus. He transports his customers to and from Ulaanbaatar and Ulgii. Sharip is an open person and has many plans for the future. His family and business are both very important to him. Sharip says, “I would like to build a house for my son.” He is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase spare parts for his cars.

loans.use: To purchase spare car parts

loans.name: Face Reality Group

texts.en:
These are members of the “Face Reality” group. They are small-scale businesspeople in the town of Magburaka in northern Sierra Leone. This will be their second loan from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of their previous SMT/Kiva loan, these entrepreneurs' businesses expanded. Having repaid their last loan successfully, they are requesting a new loan of SLL 1,000,000 for each in order to further expand their businesses. 

Mohamed S. pictured on the right is the leader of this group. Mohamed was born in Magburaka. He is 35 years of age, married to a businesswoman and they have one child who is in primary school. Mohamed sells toothpaste, toothbrushes, cosmetics, shoes, and so on. He has been doing business for 8 years now. With his share of this loan, he will buy toothpaste, toothbrushes, cosmetics and shoes wholesale.

loans.use: Buy toothpaste, toothbrushes, cosmetics and shoes wholesale

loans.name: Batjargal

texts.en:
Batjargal L. is 47 years old and lives with her husband and children in Uvurhangai province in central Mongolia. She and her family live together in a 'ger'--a traditional housing tent. Her elder son is a student, while the two daughters attend a local middle school. 

Batjargal operates a food selling business out of her own small space at the local market. In 2004 she began her consumer goods retailing business and over the years she has worked hard to build a stable business operation and has gained much experience. 

During the summertime, she sells a variety of dairy products and ice-cream. Her business is very important to her and her family. She says, "I really want to expand my business in order to improve my quality of life and am trying my best to achieve that goal. Plus, my only wish is to provide a good education for my children and to help them become good people." 

Batjargal is a modest and very hard-working woman. She is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to purchase more dairy products to sell in the business.

loans.use: To purchase more dairy products to sell

loans.name: Cyrus

texts.en: Cyrus is a member of Pendano group, which consists of young entrepreneurs, associated with Faulu Kenya.  He runs Agape Auto spares and Car Locks shop. He started the business 15 years ago.  He has seen his business grow with the help of Pendano group in Faulu kenya. He has requested a loan of 20,000 KES to purchase car locks and ignitions.  He hopes to expand his business so that he can earn enough income to educate his child.

loans.use: To purchase car locks and ignitions

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials to improve his homes, such as: cement, sand, gravel, etc.

loans.name: Portia

texts.en: Portia P. is from the village of Magsaysay, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. She is 54 years old. Portia is widowed and has two adult children. To make a living, Portia operates a retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Portia has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2009, Portia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Portia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Portia is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the third loan taken out by Portia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Emme

texts.en:
Emme M. is from the village of Carugmanan, in Banisilan, Cotabato. She is 34 years old, married, and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Emme owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food & daily-use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Emme joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI, which was used to to purchase additional products to sell. She is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory & as working capital. This will be Emme’s 4th loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Sek

texts.en: Mrs. Sek L. H. lives in Roka village in Takeo province and she was born in 1955. She is a farmer who owns a 1.5-hectare plot of land where she grows rice to sell to support her family. Her problem is that her field is infertile, and she does not have enough money to amend it. So, to improve her rice production, Mrs. Sek L. H. is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticide, gasoline, and rice seed. She is a widow with two children, one of whom is a seamstress in a garment factory, while the other is a cosmetician.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticide, gasoline, and rice seed

loans.name: Agrhim Oponi Ole

texts.en:
Agrhim Oponi Ole M. is 23 years old and supports two family members. His spouse, Margaret, is a housewife. For the past four years Agrhim has been a wheat farmer. His wife helps Agrhim on the farm.
