This will be Agrhim’s first loan. He is planning to spend 30,000 KES on chemicals and fertilizer, and 20,000 KES to spray his wheat fields. He is planning to use the anticipated profit from his farming to rent a bigger piece of land and so increase his wheat production.

Agrhim hopes and dreams that he will become a large-scale farmer owning a bigger piece of land and be financially stable enough to support his family.

loans.use: To spend 30,000 KES on chemicals and fertilizer, and 20,000 KES to spray his wheat fields

loans.name: Cotmu Group

texts.en:
Francois was born in 1964. He is married with six children between 16 and 9 years old. Francois has been a businessman for a long time just because he has four years of experience making bricks for construction. Francois is the group leader of 10 people with the same business. All of them make bricks for sale. This group is COTMU. They employ 100 employees from their community.

Francois and his team are requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to expand their business of making bricks. With this loan, Francois and his team will be able to satisfy their market, which will make them more efficient and more effective.

loans.use: To expand their business

loans.name: Mary Aba Nurumah

texts.en: Mary Aba Nurumah O. is married and has four children. Her husband is a mason. She has been through senior high school. Mary cooks rice and yams at Asenadze near Abura for sale. She assists her husband in providing the basic needs of the family. The loan will be added to her initial capital to expand her business. With the new profits from her expanded business, Mary plans to build a shop.

loans.use: add to her initial capital to expand her business

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en: This is 30-year-old Hawa.  She is married and has three children aged 16, 12 and 7. She has two additional dependents who live with her. One is her niece and the other her sister-in-law.  They assist in the business.  In the year 2000, Hawa established her slippers and clothes for ladies business. She began her business because she wanted to be self-reliant. Working 6 days a week and 9 hours a day, she earns about 1,682,000 SLL every month from this business. She needs a loan of 3,000,000 SLL. Hawa has a very good loan repayment history. She requires a loan in order to buy ladies slippers. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 336,400 SLL. In the future, Hawa plans to expand her business to the extent that she can build a house for herself and help her husband to educate her children. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy additional ladies slippers

loans.name: Chiv

texts.en:
Chiv P. is a 31-year-old married mother who currently lives in the province of Kompong Tom. She is a tailor who sews the villagers' clothes when they need to order new clothing for ceremonies such as weddings and parties. She has a life partner in her husband who is a carbon seller in and around her community. The family includes two devoted children, two of whom are single, and still under their roof. 

Because the family's main income comes from her husband's business, he now wishes to expand his business. Chiv P. wants to help her husband but her income is too small and is not sufficient to support her husband's business. To solve this problem, Chiv P. will use her loan for her husband to purchase a large amount of carbon for selling.

loans.use: To purchase carbon for resale

loans.name: Nelius Wanjiku

texts.en:
Nelius is 30 years old and married to Jacob Ngagi, who contributes to the family income. They have two children. Nelius has been running her retail shop for two years with a profit of about Kshs. 5000 per month.

She hopes to own a wholesale shop, give her children a quality education and improve their living standards.

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice and flour

loans.name: Wilfredo Antonio

texts.es: Wilfredo Antonio se dedica a brindar el servicio de enderezado y pintura. Esta no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos, por lo que tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con Fundación León 2000, ha demostrado ser una persona responsable con sus pagos. El solicita este crédito para la compra de pintura, aerosoles, herramientas entre otras cosas. El es una persona muy reconocida y todos sus clientes asisten a su taller pues ofrece un excelente servicio.
texts.en: Wilfredo Antonio works providing paint and body work services.  This is not the first time that he has gotten a loan, as he has been working with Fundación León 2000 for a long time and has proven to be a responsible person with his payments.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of paint, spray cans, and tools, among other items.  He is a very well-known person and all of his customers go to his shop because he offers excellent service.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Sok S., 41, is married and resides with his wife and four children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. He is a farmer, earning an income of $1 per day. His wife is employed at the factory, earning an income of $3 per day to help cover the family expenses.

Each month, the family has to spend $50 on food and $85 on other necessary expenses. S. is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase wood to build a chicken cage to raise chickens. In the future, he would like to use any additional income to repair his house. This will be his first loan from CREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy wood to build a chicken cage to raise chickens

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary W. is a married lady. Her husband is a businessman and they have two children, ages six and three.

Rosemary owns a general store at the Umoja estate in Nairobi. She sells an assortment of goods which includes eggs, cereals, chicken feed and kerosene. She has been in this business for seven years now and has managed to provide employment to two people. She says that this business is profitable.

The only major challenge she has is the transportation of cereals, since they are bulky. Oil prices, too, fluctuate a lot, sometimes leading to people not buying when prices are high, thus causing slow movement of her stock. However, she works very hard from early morning to late evening to keep her business doing well.

She is using her loan of 40,000 KES to buy more cereals to grow her business and meet the demands of her customers.

In the future, she hopes to buy a plot of land to build on. She also hopes to give her children a good education to the university level. She describes herself as humble and hardworking.

loans.use: To buy more cereals to sell.

loans.name: Tima

texts.en:
Tima is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

She has operated a charcoal selling business for the past three years, selling from home to her neighboring community. Tima hopes to open a retail shop in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000, she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal to sell. She decided to join Yehu because of its simple procedures.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Lesly De Los Ángeles

texts.es: La señora Lesly de los ángeles es casada tiene dos hijos en edad escolar ella solicita crédito para comprar a sus hijos  los útiles escolares los libros y las mochilas ya que es urgente ya entraron en esta semana.es un crédito nuevo, agradece a CEPRODEL su agilización en el préstamo
texts.en: Lesly de los Angeles is married and she has two school-aged children. She requests a loan to purchase school supplies for her children, including books and school bags. It is urgent because they have already been in school for a week. This is a new loan and she is thankful to Ceprodel (Kiva Field Partner) for granting this loan to her.

loans.use: To buy school supplies for her children.

loans.name: Nuevas Raices Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “NUEVAS RAICES” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes.  Está compuesta por ocho integrantes, las que están dirigidas por una mesa directiva, que tiene como presidenta la señora Francisca.   

La señora Francisca, indica que es su primera vez que trabaja con Pro Mujer, ya que un equipo movil se aproximo a ella. Ella asume la responsabilidad de la presidencia de la A.C. “NUEVAS RAICES”. Nos cuenta que vende chompas y que aprendió el negocio de su prima. En la actualidad compra su mercadería en la feria de la mañana de la calle Tumusla (las mañaneras)

Con el crédito que ahora sacarà piensa abrir su propio taller y comprará una máquina para dibujar en las prendas. La apertura de este taller apoyara su trabajo, ya que elle apoya a su familia, que consta de su esposo y tres hijos, los que le ayudan en su negocio.

Con respecto a las integrantes de la asociación, podemos decir que ellas llevan adelante  variados tipos de negocios, los que son: Venta de hierbas, fajas de pollera, tienda carnicería, transportista, artesanía, producción de alfombras, costura de enaguas.
texts.en:
The Communal Association “Nuevas Raices” (New Roots) is starting its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Los Andes Community Center. The group consists of eight members and is led by a Board of Directors with Sra. Francisca as its president.

Sra. Francisca says that she is working with Pro Mujer for the first time after she was approached by the mobile promotions team. She takes over the responsibilities as president of the “Nuevas Raices” Communal Association. Francisca sells sweaters and learned this trade from her cousin. She currently buys her merchandise at the morning fair on Tumusla Street (during the early hours).

With this loan, Francisca plans to open her own workshop and buy a machine for designing garments. Having a workshop will help her business and enable her to support her family, which consists of her husband and three children. Her family also helps with managing the business.

The other members of the Communal Association say that they engage in various types of businesses. These include selling herbs, manufacturing skirts, managing a butcher shop, providing transportation, producing handicrafts, making rugs, and sewing petticoats.

loans.use: To open a workshop for producing sweaters.

loans.name: Yanett

texts.es: Yanett, es natural del distrito de Santa Rosa, tiene 23 años de edad, es un mujer muy  comprometida con su trabajo, convive con Julio de 21 años y fruto de esa relación hoy tienen 03 hijos y juntos viven en su propia casa  donde reina la compresión y el apoyo mutuo entre si. La labor que realiza Yanett es labrar la tierra, donde viene cultivando plantas de café y hojas de coca, en total cuenta con 03 hectáreas de terreno. Sus padres le enseñaron  a remover la tierra y creció con los anhelos de poseer su propia chacra. Con los ahorros acumulados pudo concretar sus ansias de contar con su propia parcela. Es conocedora del arduo trabajo en el campo; donde viene trabajando 20 años, y en los días  de cosecha cuenta con el apoyo de los jornaleros quienes se encargan de trasladar los productos cosechados hasta cierto tramo; para luego poder comercializarlo. Se siente muy comprometida con su trabajo; porque gracias a su esfuerzo cotidiano hoy disfruta al ver que sus plantas son muy productivas, así obteniendo buenas ganancias; cuenta que la estación de invierno no es de su agrado porque en estos meses abundan los insectos impidiendo el rendimiento con su trabajo. El crédito que solicita es para poder comprar su propia movilidad que es una moto carguero y así poder trasladar con mayor rapidez sus productos a los mercados. Con el tiempo, espera poder comprar más tierras y variar en sus sembrios, para  así darle una buena estabilidad económica a  su  familia. Este es su octavo crédito con MFP, ha sido muy puntual en sus anteriores créditos y espera serlo también ahora. En su banco comunal es un socio muy querido por el resto de los integrantes. Con los 3,000 nuevos soles solicitados, comprará su propia movilidad, una moto carguero para así poder trasladar con mayor rapidez sus productos  a los mercados.
texts.en:
Yanett is from Santa Rosa district.  She is 23 years old and a woman who is very dedicated to her work.  She lives with 21 year-old Julio and they have three children.  They live together in their own home where understanding and mutual support reign.

Yanett's business is working the land.  She grows coffee and coca leaf.  In total, she has 3 hectares of land.  Yanett's parents taught her how to work the soil and she grew up with the desire to own her own farm.  She used some savings that she had made in order to fulfil her wish of owning her own plot of land.  Yanett knows a lot about the hard work of the countryside where she has been working for 20 years.  On harvest days she has the support of day laborers who transport her harvested produce for a certain stretch so that she can then sell it.  Yanett feels very dedicated to her work because, thanks to her daily effort, she can see that her plants are very productive and she makes good profits.  She tells us that she does not like the winter season because during those months insects abound which harms her yield.

Yanett is requesting this loan so that she can buy her own vehicle.  She will buy a motorbike for carrying cargo so that she can transport her produce to the markets more quickly.  Over time, she hopes to be able to buy more land and vary the crops she grows so that she can provide her family with good financial stability.  This is Yanett's eighth loan from MFP.  She has been very punctual in making her previous loan repayments and she hopes to continue being punctual in repaying this loan too.  Yanett is a very well-liked member of her community bank.  She will use the 3,000 Peruvian soles she has requested to buy her own vehicle, a motorbike for carrying cargo, so that she can transport her produce to the markets more quickly.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for carrying cargo to transport her produce to market

loans.name: Perveen's Group

texts.en:
Perveen is married to M. A. and lives in Pakpattan, Pakistan, which is famous for its agricultural industry. Her house is located in Karampura which is a small residential area of the city. She moved there 20 years ago. Her husband works for a private organization with a reasonable income. Perveen has given birth to four sons and a daughter. Her two elder sons left their education and started work to financially support the family. Her eldest son sells cooking oil while the second one is a rickshaw driver and provides transport services to passengers. Her remaining children are enrolled in a local school and are getting their education. 

Perveen has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, for her second son who wants to repair his rickshaw because it has gone rough and needs urgent repairing. Perveen is hopeful that, after repairing the rickshaw, her son will be able to provide better transport services to his passengers and make more profits. He has been in his business for the past 10 years.

In the photo, the lady with a raised hand is Perveen.

loans.use: to repair a rickshaw.

loans.name: Baraza

texts.en:
Baraza is a married man with seven children, all of whom attend school. He lives in his own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

With the Kshs 10,000 he is requesting he wants to start a poultry business, purchase chicks and chicken feed. He dreams of expanding his business in the future. Baraza decided to join Yehu Microfinance to access loans to improve his livelihood.

loans.use: To start a poultry business, purchase chicks and chicken feed.

loans.name: Levan

texts.en:
Levan is 24 years old. He lives in Samtredia District with his wife, parents, brother and grandmother. 

All members of the family are involved in the family agricultural business. They have a small dairy farm – four cows, whose milk is enough to produce 80 kg cheese per month. The cheese is sold locally. Calves are sold on the local market as well. Also, the family owns 2 ha of agricultural land, where maize is grown. The whole harvest of maize is used on the dairy farm for feeding the cows. They have 900 nut trees, which give them 900 kg of nuts per year. They are sold to retailers. 

Levan plans to rent 3 ha of land. After cultivation watermelons will be sown; Levan already prepared seedlings. Also fertilizers will be purchased and used for the plot. 16% of the total credit will be used for covering an old loan of Levan's, borrowed from Credo. 

Part of the profit will be reinvested in farming in order to expand it and make more sustainable.

loans.use: to pay for tilling the land and fertilizers.

loans.name: Ana Isabel

texts.es:
Ana Isabel de 37 años, vive en una zona urbana en las Orquídeas (llamado así porque en su originalidad había muchas flores orquídeas) de Guayaquil. Su esposo trabajo en un empresa como aperador de maquinas, tiene tres hijos de 10, 8 y 15 años que estudian en colegios fiscales.

Comenzó por medio de una amiga que la inscribió en productos por catálogos y después se se inscribió en un curso de tejidos. Labora sola y diariamente o en su tiempo libre no tiene horarios fijos. Con la ayuda del préstamo desea comprar productos por catálogos y realizas sus tejidos de carteras para incrementar sus ingresos. En un futuro desea poner un a papelería.
texts.en:
Ana Isabel, 37, lives in an urban zone in Las Orquídeas (so called because at its founding there were many orchid plants there) in Guayaquil.  Her husband works for a firm as a machine operator.  She has three children who are 10, 8 and 15 years of age; they all go to public schools.

She started out thanks to a friend who got her into catalogue sales.  Later, she enrolled in a weaving course.  She works alone every day or during her free time; she does not have fixed schedules.

With help from the loan she’d like to buy catalogue products and to weave the purses to increase her income.  In the future she’d like to set up a stationery shop

loans.use: to buy merchandise and thread for her weaving.

loans.name: Maulidi

texts.en:
Maulidi is a married woman with four children, one of whom still attends school, while the others have graduated from school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past 15 years, she has operated a fish selling business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. During hot dry season the availability of fish for sale is lower and demand is higher while during rainy season the availability of fish for sale is higher and demand is lower. Maulidi dreams of expanding and purchasing a freezer to store fish for sale in the future. 

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase bundles of fishing nets and hooks. She decided to work with Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of fishing nets and hooks.

loans.name: Sineoun

texts.en: Sineoun, 32, resides in Prey Veng province, Cambodia, an area known as one of the largest rice producing regions in Cambodia. Sineoun is a housewife while her husband is a driver for a blacksmith, earning an income of $7 USD per day. Each month, the family has to spend $56 USD on food and $24 USD on the other necessary expenses. Sineoun is requesting a loan of $1,200 USD to purchase more supplements to improve her husband’s blacksmith business. This will be her first from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy more supplements to improve the blacksmith business

loans.name: Jose Diego

texts.es:
A sus 62 años de edad Jose Diego se siente orgulloso de su negocio, el cual ha sacado adelante con esmero y dedicación, desde hace varios años Jose tiene un kiosco ubicado en el parque de Caldas, un municipio del departamento de Antioquia donde es reconocido por sus clientes, gracias a la buena atención que les brinda y la variedad de productos que les ofrece.

Sin embargo Jose Diego es conciente que para mejorar el servicio que ofrece deberá mejorar su lugar de trabajo y para esto solicita un préstamo con el cual comprar una nevera que le hace falta para mantener en buen estado sus productos, igualmente necesita surtir su negocio con nuevos productos para seguir posicionando su negocio y con sus ganancias mejorar su calidad de vida
texts.en:
At 62 years old, Jose Diego is proud of his business, which he has improved with care and dedication.  For many years, Jose has had a kiosk located in the Caldas park, a municipality in the Antioquia department where he is recognized by his customers thanks to the good service he has given them and the variety of products he offers.

However, Jose Diego knows that in order to improve the service he offers, he should improve his place of work.  Therefore, he is asking for a loan to purchase a refrigerator that he needs to keep his products fresh.  He also needs to stock his store with new products to continue positioning his business and improve his quality of life with his earnings.

loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator and stock for his store.

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.es:
Consuelo tiene 50 años de edad y vive con su hijo en una comunidad urbana pequeña, humilde y en vías de desarrollo perteneciente al distrito de Castilla en Piura. Los pobladores de esta comunidad son principalmente comerciantes minoristas.

Consuelo se dedica a la venta de ropa y moños hechos a base de junco (ramas de plantas secas). Ella cuenta con clientela establecida en la zona ya que viene realizando esta actividad desde hace 8 años y conoce el rubro a la perfección.

Consuelo solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un  préstamo de 800 nuevos soles para comprar prendas de vestir y junco (para realizar moños) que le permitan abastecer los pedidos con los que cuenta.

El negocio de Consuelo  se está desarrollando cada vez más  y ella espera seguir aumentando su demanda para tener mayores ingresos que le permitan mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Consuelo is 50 years old and lives with her son in a small, modest, developing, urban community in the Castilla district in Piura.  

Consuelo sells clothing and bows made from reeds (dried plant branches).  She has an established customer base in her area as she has had this business for 8 years and knows the trade perfectly.  

Consuelo is requesting a loan for 800 nuevos soles [Peruvian currency] through Edpyme Alternativa to buy clothing and reeds (to make her bows).  This will allow her to fill her existing orders.  

Consuelo's business is growing and she hopes to continue increasing demand so she can increase her income and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: purchase clothing and reeds to make bows.

loans.name: Johanna Del Socorro

texts.es: Johana Del Socorro tiene 41 años. Es madre soltera y tiene 1 hijo que trabajan de manera independencia. Su actividad económica es una pulpería. Ella es una mujer que disfruta mucho de su trabajo es atender a sus clientes hace mas de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que todos los días se levanta muy temprano para atender a sus clientes. Su mayor sueño es mejorar sus ingresos, para seguirle proporcionando a su familia el alimento diario. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de granos básicos, enlatados, detergentes, papel higiénico, refrescos y pan.
texts.en:
Johana Del Socorro is 41 years of age. She is a single mother and has one child who works independently. Her income-generating activity is a general store. She is a woman who really enjoys her work and waiting on her customers. She has been earning a living in this business for more than five years, and gets up early every day to wait on her customers. 

Her greatest dream is to improve her earnings in order to continue providing daily sustenance to her family. The loan she is seeking is for the purchase of basic food staples, canned goods, detergents, toilet paper, drinks and bread.

loans.use: to purchase basic food staples, canned goods, detergents, toilet paper, drinks and bread.

loans.name: Riza Mae

texts.en:
Riza Mae is 20 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 1 child. 
Riza Mae has a retail shop that sells canned goods, breads & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She hasrequested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks.
Riza Mae is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Riza Mae hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks

loans.name: Natalie Sheilah

texts.es:
Natalie nació en la ciudad del Cusco (Perú) y tiene 28 años de edad, ella es madre soltera y tiene un hijo de dos años y medio. Actualmente, ella vive en la misma  ciudad donde nació y donde realiza sus actividades, ella se dedica a la distribucion de productos de locería a pedido del cliente. Ya son siete años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien, ella tambien se dedica a brindar servicio de llamadas a celulares móviles.   

Natalie requiere el préstamo para comprar más productos de locería como platos y vasos. 

El Banco Comunal “Siempre Adelante” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad del Cusco (Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Natalie was born in the city of Cusco (Perú) and is 28 years old.  She’s a single mother of a two-and-a-half-year-old son.  She currently lives in the same city where she was born and where she carries out her activities.  She distributes dinnerware based on customer orders.  She’s been in business seven years and does very well.  She also provides cellular telephone services.  Natalie needs the loan to buy more dinnerware items like dishes and glasses.

The “Siempre Adelante” (Always Forward) communal bank meets every thirty days in the city of Cusco (Perú).  Cusco is known for tourism, commerce, its traditional “Inti Raymi” festival and because one of the Seven Wonders of the World, Machupicchu, is locate here.

loans.use: to buy more dinnerware like dishes and glasses.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 37-year-old married woman and has two children who are in school. She is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Marilou requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Marilou has been raising pigs for 15 years now, and has borrowed 19 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Marilou would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Rosalita

texts.en:
Rosalita is 57 years old and lives in Palayan, Aloran Misamis Occidental. She is married with seven children. 

Rosalita has a dried fish retail store. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan of 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to purchase materials for her house repair.

Rosalita has been a member of PMPC for five years.

loans.use: to purchase materials for her house repair.

loans.name: Lagrimas

texts.en:
Lagrimas is 42 years old and married with four children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 25,000 PHP through NWTF to buy items to sell such as shampoo, groceries, etc. in her sari-sari store.
Lagrimas has borrowed and paid back 11 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for nine years and also earns an income from rice farming and photography.
Lagrimas aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Susannah

texts.en:
Susannah, age 53, is a breadmaker. She has been engaged in this business for the past ten years. She is well-known in her community and makes a good profit from making and selling her bread. 

She is divorced and has three grown children in their thirties. They are attending college and living at home. Susannah herself is a high-school graduate.

At present, she does not have sufficient baking supplies in stock, so she is requesting a loan in order to purchase more sugar, flour, oil, and butter. 

Her eventual goal is to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more sugar, flour, oil, and butter

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose sells cosmetics, pegs and cloth in Takoradi. She is married and has one child. Her husband is a teacher. Rose has been selling cosmetics for five years. She supports her husband to take care of the home. Her loan will be used to buy cosmetics. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a shop.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Therese

texts.en: Therese is 27 years old and has two children, ages 3 and 5. Both of her children are in school. She is married to a technician. Therese sells bed sheets in a store she has been running for five years. She will use the loan to buy more bed sheets to expand her business. She will use any profits to reinvest in her business and renovate her house. She would love to see her business prosper.

loans.use: To buy more bed sheets to sell.

loans.name: Verónica Patricía

texts.es:
La señora Verónica tiene 34 años de edad, es acompañada con dos hijos uno de 5 años y otro de 3 años.

Ella realiza actividades del hogar, pero desde hace dos años se ha dedicado a vender ropa para adultos y niños. Verónica viaja casi 200 kilómetros, para comprar la mercadería en la capital del país, debe abordar dos buses, sale a las 5:00 a.m. y regresa a las 4:00 p.m.

Verónica vende la ropa de comunidad en comunidad, caminando a pie, cargando la mercadería, trabaja por lo menos 8 horas diarias, recorriendo una comunidad por día. Por la experiencia que tiene, ella quiere comprar suficiente mercadería, para la navidad, ya que es una época en la cual la venta se incrementa. 

El préstamo será utilizado, para comprar: 48 pantalones para adulto y 5 pantalones para niño, 5 docenas de blusas para mujer y ropa interior para hombre y mujer. Además quiere comprar sandalias, por que actualmente no tiene ese producto disponible.

Con el préstamo, ella diversificara su negocio, comprara a mejores precios por que lo hará por mayor, ya que ella necesita tener mercadería, para ofrecer y obtener mejores ingresos. Ella desea tener fortalecido su negocio, para contratar a otras personas que le ayuden a vender, ya que en estos momentos lo hace sola.
texts.en:
Verónica is 34 years old, accompanied by two children who are 5 and 3 years old.

She is a homemaker but for the last two years has been dedicated to selling adult and children's clothing. Verónica travels almost 200 kilometers to buy the merchandise in the country's capital. She has to take two buses, and leaves at 5AM and returns at 4PM.

Verónica sells the clothings from community to community walking, carrying the merchandise. She works at least eight hours a day, covering one community a day. From the experience she has, she wants to buy enough merchandise for the holidays since it is a time when sales increase.

The loan will be used to buy 48 adult pants and 5 children's pants, 5 dozen women's blouses and men's and women's underwear. Additionally, she wants to buy sandals because currently she does not have this product available.

With the loan, she will diversify her business. She will buy at better pricess because she will do it at wholesale since she needs to have merchandise in order to offer and obtain better income. She wishes to establish her business so she can hire other people to help her sell since right now she does it alone.

loans.use: to buy 48 adult pants and 5 children's pants, 5 dozen women's blouses, sandals, men's and women's underwear.

loans.name: Makatini Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Makatini Group in Western Kenya! Alice is the facilitator of the Makatini group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Alice takes care of two children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Alice had an excellent maize yield harvesting 18 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Alice was only able to harvest five bags of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Alice and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from her maize sales, Alice will invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Makatini group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Hiris Consuelo

texts.es:
La señora Hiris Consuelo es casada, tiene 4 hijos de los cuales estudian, se dedica a los oficios de casa como a la atención a una tienda, inició su negocio de tienda gracias al apoyo de su esposo, y lleva 5 años de experiencia.

Solicita un préstamo que le servirá para la compra de productos para la tienda que tiene, ya que quiere ampliar su negocio, va a comprar: aguas gaseosas, jugos, golosinas, fideos, lácteos, etc. Espera ver el futuro su tienda grande.
texts.en:
Hiris Consuelo is married and has four children who are in school.  She takes care of her household tasks and also serves in her store.  She started her store with the support of her husband and now has five years experience.

Hiris is requesting a loan to buy products for her store as she would like to expand her business.  She will buy soda, juice, candies, noodles, dairy products, etc.  She hopes to enlarge her store in the future.

loans.use: to buy products for her store

loans.name: Oscar Rodolfo

texts.es: El señor Oscar es cliente nuevo en la institución se dedica a la costura de variedad de  ropa en el taller que se encuentra en su mismo domicilio en la zona villa Nuevo Potosí vive con su esposa en la casa de sus suegros no tienen hijos por el momento pero ese es su deseo poder agrandar la familia,  el crédito esta destinado para la compra de rollos de tela por mayor  fibra , polar y una maquina recta mas adelante piensan en comprar una maquina de bordar y una computadora para tener un taller completo de costura y bordados, es un joven muy trabajador ya esta es su única actividad para mantener a su familia, con el tiempo desea expandir sus productos a las distintas ciudades de Cochabamba y Oruro.
texts.en:
Oscar is a new client of the institution.  He works sewing a variety of clothes in a workshop in his own home in the Villa Nuevo Potosí area.  He lives with his wife in the house of his in-laws.  They do not have children at present, but that is their desire, to expand the family.

The loan will be used to buy wholesale rolls of fabric, polar fleece, and an upright machine.  Later on he plans to buy an embroidery machine and a computer to have a complete sewing and embroidery workshop.

He is a very hardworking young man.  This is his only work to support his family.  In time he wants to expand his products to the different cities of Cochabamba and Oruro.

loans.use: to buy wholesale rolls of fabric and an upright sewing machine

loans.name: Fanny

texts.es: Fanny(en viaje de negocios) es la madre de Lenis quien aparece en la fotografía y describe la historia del negocio de su madre desde que iniciaron la fabricación y comercializcion de bolsos de cuero y de calzado.  “ El  negocio comienza hace 10 años, cuando comenzamos a venderle productos como calzado y sandalias a compañeras de estudios en el bachillerato, cuando estudiaba   en el barrio arroz Barato de la ciudad de Cartagena, luego con el conocimiento de los productos , las ventas fueron creciendo y las mujeres día a día se inquietaban por conocer nuevos productos, así fue como  incluimos   la línea de bolsos además de la línea de calzado y accesorios, esta vez para damas y caballeros; en la medida en que yo iba estudiando en el Sena, escuela técnica apoyada por el estado ,  las personas cada vez se enamoraban de los productos hasta que empecé a trabajar en el área de finanzas en diferentes empresas  y la lista de clientes se incrementaba cada día, fue entonces cuando el negocio tomó  fuerzas  y además de vender artesanías de nuestra tierra natal que es Momil, en el departamento de Córdoba, con los materiales de caña flecha y otros como el cuero, también iniciamos negocios con mujeres tejedoras de san Jacinto Bolívar. Después de todos estos años con un negocio informal,  es en el 2009 que con la participación en un concurso de planes de negocios de varias organizaciones,  nos ganamos un capital semilla para comprar nuestra propia maquinaria, fue gracias a la viabilidad del proyecto y por todas las características de rentabilidad y participación en el desarrollo social de familias artesanas,  lo que nos hizo  merecedores del tercer lugar con $4.000.000 COP,  para iniciar el negocio,  el cual arrojó  como resultado la preferencia que los clientes tienen hacia los productos fusionados con cuero y caña flecha Así fue que decidimos formalizarnos ante Cámara de Comercio, la cual nos ha venido apoyando con programas de emprendimiento y empresario, en su programa de  jóvenes empresarios, mujeres,  ecco ferias a nivel local y regional, foros, y ruedas de negocios, estamos muy agradecidas con esta entidad por el apoyo en las asesorías financieras, de mercadeo y de estrategias que nos han brindado;  hace poco recibimos un microcrédito de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y también le estamos agradecidas debido a que el factor monetario a sido un verdadero reto de afrontar ,  ya que los recursos son pocos pero a pesar de todo hemos salido a delante y este año 2011 ha sido más que todo de arranque ya que para el 2012 nos vemos con el favor de Dios con metas por luchar y cumplir. Siempre hemos trabajado en equipo,  mi mamá   en el área más que todo de producción, publicidad  y ventas y  yo, además de apoyar los procesos productivos y de comercialización,   hago toda la gestión en grandes eventos feriales, locales, nacionales  empresariales, pues   por  haber  calificado como profesional de una institución educativa tecnológica,  tengo la oportunidad de acceder en todos estos programas de las organizaciones que apoya el estado nacional para generar potenciales empleos en Colombia.  Es para nosotras muy grato poder compartirles nuestra pequeña experiencia y sobre todo manifestarles lo mucho que amamos nuestro negocio y el gran compromiso y responsabilidad que tenemos para sacarlo cada vez mas adelante, especialmente apoyadas por los  credikiva, el cual aplicaremos a la compra de cuero en gran volumen, para elaborar bolsos y calzados de buena calidad y exhibirlos en la época mas comercial del año Navidad y año nuevo.”
texts.en:
Fanny (away on a business trip) is the mother of Lenis, who appears in the photograph and describes her mother’s business that they started which is the making and selling of leather purses and shoes.  

“The business started ten years ago when we started selling items like shoes and sandals to fellow high-school students when I was attending school in Cartagena’s Arroz Barato neighborhood.  As we got to know the products better, sales improved and women were excited to see the new products daily.  This is how we included a line of purses to the line of footwear and accessories this time for women and men.  As I continued attending classes at SENA, a government-supported technical school, people became more and more enamored with the products until I started working in the financial area in various firms and our customer roster grew daily.  That was when the business really took off and besides selling crafts from our native land which is Momil in Córdoba Department which are made from “caña flecha” [a tall, tropical grass] and leather, we also started businesses with weavers in San Jacinto, Bolívar.

After all these years in an informal business, in 2009 we participated in a business plan contest from various organizations and won seed capital to buy our own machinery.  Thanks to the viability of the project and because of its profitability characteristic s and the participation of artisanal families in social development, we won third prize: $4.000.000 COP to start the business which took off due to customer preference for items that combine caña flecha and leather.  

We then decided to formalize ourselves with the Chamber of Commerce which has been supporting us with business and entrepreneurial programs as part of their programs for young business people, women, local and regional eco fairs, forums and business roundtables.  We are very grateful to this entity for the support in financial, marketing and strategy assessments it’s afforded us.  

A short while ago we received a micro loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and we are also grateful to it because the monetary factor has been a real challenge to face since resources are few.  Despite it all, we have gotten ahead and 2011 has been for the most part a launching pad for 2012 when we have goals to strive toward and with God’s favor to meet.

We’ve always worked as a team.  My mother in the production, publicity and sales areas and myself, in addition to supporting productive and commercialization efforts, I take care of everything related to the sales expos both locally and nationally because having qualified as a professional from a technological educational institution, I have the opportunity to access all Colombian potential jobs.

For us, it’s very gratifying to share our small experience and especially to show you how much we love our business and the great commitment and responsibility we have to see it succeed more every day especially with support from Kiva loans which we will use to buy leather in large amounts to manufacture good quality purses and footwear to exhibit during the most commercial season which is Christmas and New Year.”

loans.use: to buy leather in large amounts.

loans.name: Matilde

texts.es: Matilde de 62 años,  vive en  el municipio de Soledad y tiene 2 hijos en las edades de 33 y 36 años respectivamente. Allí mismo tiene un negocio, a través del cual se dedica a la venta de mercancías variada y medicinas naturales, entre otros artículos que sus clientes le encargan y ella se los consigue,  para que estos, en la  comodidad de sus posibilidades económicas le paguen a plazos pactados. Su negocio surgió cuando se separó de su esposo y debió buscar oportunidades de ingresos,  para que su familia avanzara y tuvieran todos  bienestar. Su meta es lograr el crecimiento de su negocio, para continuar con la satisfacción de sus necesidades personales y convertir su negocio en una miscelánea, donde sus clientes, tan pronto lleguen identifiquen lo que les hace falta y le compren rápidamente, porque su propósito es minimizar la venta en la calle y salirle al paso a la competencia,  que cada día se muestra con promociones exhibidas. En la actualidad está aplicando a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará omega 3, lociones, perfumes propolio etc, artículos que basa en los pedidos de sus compradores y que aparecen en el mercado, con importantes  descuentos en ésta época de un nuevo año 2012.
texts.en:
Matilde is 62 years old, lives in the town of Soledad, and has two children aged 33 and 36 years old.  She has a business, through which she sells various merchandise and herbal medicines, among other items that her clients request and that she acquires on their behalf.  Due to the limited resources of her customers, they pay her over time according to set schedules.

Matilde's business increased when she separated from her husband and had to look for earning opportunities to provide for her family and allow it to advance.  Her goal is to grow her business, so as to continue satisfying her personal expenses, and to convert her business into a general store where her customers could, upon arriving, identify what they need and purchase it quickly.  She hopes to minimize street sales and outlast the competition, which displays promotions every day.  

She is applying for her first KIVA loan, through the Foundation Mario Santo Domingo, which she will use to buy omega-3, lotions, perfumes, propolis (a resin with medicinal uses), and other products that are requested by her customers and appear in the market, with important discounts in this new year of 2012.

loans.use: to buy omega 3, lotions, perfumes, propolis, and natural medicines.

loans.name: Sinovite Group

texts.fr: SINOVITE est un groupe composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. Afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité, ce groupe sollicite pour la deuxième fois l'appui financier de ALIDé. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Noëlie (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 35 ans. Noëlie n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Noëlie est veuve et mère de trois enfants. Tous ses enfants sont scolarisés et à sa charge. Les diverses charges de la maison sont supportées par Noëlie. Pour cette raison, Noëlie vend des bananes de façon ambulante depuis quinze ans, ce qui lui permet de mieux faire face aux besoins de ses enfants et à leur éducation. Noëlie s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Noëlie sollicite ensemble avec les membres du groupe SINOVITE , un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le crédit reçu antérieurement a été bien remboursé.

loans.use: Acheter des bananes.

loans.name: Nato

texts.en:
Nato is 50 years old married woman, who has 7 members-family and live in Rustavi city. Some of family members are involved in private activities as Nato, who is a washerwoman in spite of her high education. The job is hard for her, but Nato is ready to deal with the difficulties to make better living condition for her family. Now she decided to start trading business and go to Turkey to purchase products at wholesale prices, where located the biggest market. She received the credit in the framework of joint initiative of Kiva and Credo - Startup Program that gives poor people the chance to start or re-start businesses. Nato will purchase stock of various kind of clothing and bed linens and will sell in her community with price mark-ups. 
This credit will be a great support for the family. Nato is thankful to Kiva Lenders for giving her a chance to develop her own trading business.

loans.use: To start trading business with clothing and bed linens

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Margrate wants to buy more milk for sale

loans.name: Sura

texts.en:
Sura is a very active and responsible person. 4 years ago she decided to start her own business.
Sura is 30 years old. She is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli region settled in the Finnish houses, which are built temporarily on front line in the Fizuli region. She is married and has a child.
This business has allowed her family to have a better income.
Having borrowed $400 she bought foodstuffs.
Now she needs a loan of $800 to expand the area of her store.

loans.use: To expand the area of her store

loans.name: Enah

texts.en: Enah  is 45 years old, and is married with one boy.  Enah and her husband  Alam sell basic household goods such as rice, sugar, cooking oil, etc  in front of her house at her small store. In a day Enah can earn  of $3 and eventually she can earn around $75 in a month. She needs a loan of $50 and with this loan, she can buy more goods to sell and thus more or less double her income, therefore she can have a better life.

loans.use: To buy more goods

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.ru:
Бободжонова Мавлуда- 56 лет .Замужем , имеет пятерых детей и несколько внуков. Образование средне- специальное. После работы в свободное время уделяет большое внимание откорму крупнорогатого скота и свиньям ,поскольку эта деятельность является основным источником дохода семьи. И конечно же надо иметь ввиду большую поддержку мужа в этом деле. Будучи став клиентом “Микроинвест” она начала кредитоваться с 150 $. Тогда она брала займ только для покупки корма,так как в хлеву у нее откармливались пару свиней и одна корова .После системачиеского кредитования и ответственностью перед программой “Микроинвест” у нее наработался навык в сфере животноводства и конечно же увеличилось поголовье скота. В будущем планирует расширить хозяйство.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Mavluda B., 56 is married, has 5 children and several grandchildren. She has an equivalent of associate degree education. After work, she dedicates her free time to caring for her livestock—the main source of her family's income. Mavluda B.’s husband helps her run the farm. Mavluda B. began her relationship with MicroInvest with a $150 loan to purchase food for a pair of pigs and a cow. Since then, Mavluda B. earned reputation of a responsible MicroInvest client and borrower. She gained expertise in caring for livestock and was able to increase the number of animals in her farm. Mavluda B. plans to use this loan to continue expansion of her business.

loans.use: To increase total number of livestock

loans.name: Mustafa

texts.en: Mustafa lives in district 7 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is single, and he lives with his family. He has a dress shop. He has been in this business since 2005, and he works hard. He wants to expand his business so he wants to take an individual loan to buy extra materials like shoes, clothes, and bags to attract more clients. He wants to make  a good income to support his family. He is happy that he can expand his business.

loans.use: To buy extra materials like shoes, clothes, and bags.

loans.name: Aitofi

texts.en: Aitofi is 76 years of age and a widow of 12 children. She has a big plantation in the village and with the children's support they have managed to get to where they are now. Aitofi is also a very hard working mother and that is the reason why she is always fit and very healthy. This is Aitofi's second loan with SPBD, she is thankful for the opportunity to be able to support her family and to upgrade her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy equipment and supplies for her plantation

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increase cereal stock

loans.name: Kokou

texts.fr:
Kokou Amégantsè, age 25, is single and is a shoemaker. He has been in this business for two years. With the current loan, Mr. Amégantsè intends to expand his shop and to buy raw materials and other supplies for his shoemaking work.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva volunteer.

Mr Amégantsè Kokou est âgé de 25 ans, non marié et est cordonnier .IL exerce cette activité depuis 2 ans .Avec le présent emprunt il compte agrandir son atelier et acheter des fournitures consommables pour son activité de coordonnerie

loans.use: To buy raw materials for making shoes to sell

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.en:
Nataliya is married and has two kids. She and her family live in Nikopol. Nataliya sells souvenirs, gifts and cosmetics in the local market. Her prices are always reasonable and her attitude towards her customers is very friendly. Nataliya has been in business for 8 years. Her trade has been characterized by stability and consistent growth. Currently, Nataliya has about $8,000 of goods in inventory and her monthly profit is approximately $700.

Nataliya is seeking a loan of $900 to increase her inventory and to generate additional profit. She is hoping to see her venture grow and is planning to buy at least one more vending facility in the market. Nataliya is very good with her finances: she knows how to manage money and makes sound investments. This loan will allow her to maintain a good product selection, which will in turn allow her to earn sufficient income to support herself and her family.

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Muzaffer

texts.en: Muzaffer A. is a 58 year-old man, is married, and has two children. He lives in Beylagan, a small city in Azerbaijan. Muzaffer is engaged in fruits & vegetables sales in a Beylagan city bazaar. He started his business seven years ago. He borrowed two loans from Normicro Beylagan Branch and used those loans for developing his business. Now, he needs a loan of $600 for expanding his business.

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Sharifan's Group

texts.en:
Born in the small town of Kot Radha Kishan, Sharifan L. moved to the nearby town of Raiwind, Pakistan after her marriage. She is a mother of eight children, five boys and three girls, of which four are already married. She and her youngest daughter both embroider and sew bed sheets. She makes these bed sheets on order from a big cloth market in the city Lahore. Currently, she requires an additional embroidery machine in order to improve her services.

Her sub group members are Razia B. who runs a restaurant; Reshma B. and Zubaida B., who both required embroidery machines; and Najma B. who would like to expand her grocery store.

loans.use: Buy an additional embroidery machine

loans.name: Caminando Al Futuro Group

texts.es:
21 people are part of the association “Walking to the Future” that belongs to the focal centre of Villa Exaltacion in the city of El Alto.

There are different activities in the group, for example clothes sales, hand knitted sweaters, general stores, but the main activity is food.

Francisca sells beef meat, Teresa prepares a variety of lunches, Julia sells fast food (burgers and French fries with sliced hot dog sausages). However, with the sale of these items they can only make the minimum income to cover their daily expenses and rent, not only for their houses but also for their businesses; they need more working capital to hire helpers and expand their businesses and this way make more income and improve their quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer.

Veintiún personas forman parte de la asociación “Caminando al Futuro” que pertenece al centro focal de Villa Exaltación de la ciudad de El Alto.

Existen diferentes actividades dentro el grupo por ejemplo la venta de buzos, chompas tejidas a mano, tiendas de consumo, pero la actividad principal se centra en la comida.

Francisca vende carne vacuna, Teresa prepara almuerzos variados, Julia vende comida rápida (hamburguesas y salchipapas). Pero con la venta de estos alimentos solo consiguen ingresos mínimos para cubrir gastos diarios y alquileres tanto de sus casas como de sus negocios, necesitan mayor capital para contratar ayudantes y ampliar sus negocios de esta manera conseguir mayores ingresos para mejorar su calidad de vida.

loans.use: Working capital to expand their business

loans.name: Jasmina

texts.en:
Jasmina is a 36-year-old woman. She is married and she lives with her in the village Tupkovići, near the town Živinice.

Like most women in this area, Jasmina does agriculture and in that way she can earn some money. Her husband has a full-time job, but his income is not enough for the two of them and their three children.

This is her third loan at MCO Zene za Zene (Women for Women) International and she intends to buy a heifer. Her wish is to fatten this heifer and then to sell it in order to earn some money.

loans.use: To buy a heifer.

loans.name: Rokhaya

texts.fr:
Rokhaya P., 44, is married and responsible for 11 children and 2 other people. She has been a member of the village bank of Mbirdiam in Thiès for 7 and ½ years. She wants to buy merchandise (oil, rice, candy) for her little village store and baskets of mangoes to sell by the piece. The income from her business will permit her to improve the living conditions and health of her family and pay school fees for her children. She is requesting a loan that will be reimbursed at the end of 6 months in one single repayment.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Rokhaya P., 44 ans mariée, 11 enfants et 02 autres personnes en charge est membre du banc villageois de Mbirdiam à Thiès depuis 7 ans et demi. Elle veut acheter de la marchandise (huile, riz, bonbon) pour sa boutique villageoise et des paniers de mangues à revendre au détail. Les revenus tirés de son commerce lui permettent d’améliorer les conditions de vie, de santé et de scolarité de ses enfants. Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use:
Purchase of merchandise and fruit for resale in her village shop

Achat de produits pour boutique villageoise et de fruits à revendre

loans.name: Ndeye Fatma

texts.fr:
Ndeye Fatma D. was born in 1971 and is mother to three children. She lives in the Cité Lamy neighborhood of Thies and that is where she conducts her business activities. She stocks up in Mauritania and sells her goods to neighbors in order to provide for her needs.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva volunteer.

ndeye fatma D. est une femme née en 1971 et mère de trois enfants .son domicile se trouve au quartier cité lamy de THIES et elle y mène des activités commerciales .elle fait ses approvisionnements en MAURITANIE et revend ses marchandises au détail à ses voisins dans le but subvenir à ses besoins.

loans.use: To increase working capital

loans.name: Allakabo (God Is Great) Group

texts.fr:
Alllkabo est un regroupement de quatre (4) femmes mariées du village de Farakala de la sous préfecture de Nièna de Sikasso (troisième région économique de la république du Mali). Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 39 ans et 3 enfants et vivent dans des familles polygames avec leurs maris, des coépouses et bien d’autres  parents. Unies par des relations de parenté et de voisinage, ces quatre femmes du groupe Allakabo mènent differentes activités: la restauration, l’achat vente des condiments alimentaires, des fruits et légumes et divers autres petits articles.
Dans leurs soucis d’augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres du groupe Allakabo ont décidé ensemble d’intégrer le programme de crédit de l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis deux (2) ans. Le groupe est à son deuxième prêt  après  avoir correctement remboursé le précédent.
Avec ce nouveau prêt elles comptent achèter, des condiments alimentaires (100kg d’oignon, 25 kg de sel de cuisine, 3 paniers de soumbala et  20 sachets de divers autres produits), des légumes( 100kg de choux, 25kg de carotte et d’aubergine),  50kg de sucre et 200kg de mil (pour la bouillie).
Elles s’approvisinnent exclusivement sur place au niveau du marché de Farakala et vendent au même marché en détail et au comptant.. Les jours de foire sont les périodes propices pour réaliser des ventes importantes. avec la venue des forains.(des grandes villes telle Sikasso, Bougouni et Ségou). 
Elles estiment pouvoir dégager chacune un bénéfice mensuel de 25.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour aider leurs maris dans les dépenses de la famille et payer les intérêts du prêt.
texts.en:
Alllkabo is a group of four married women from the village of Farakala in the Sous-Prefecture of Nièna of Sikasso (third economic region of Mali). They have an average age of 39 and, on average, 3 children, and live in polygamous families with their husbands, co-spouses, and lots of other relatives. United by bonds of family and neighborhood, these four women of the Allakabo group have varied businesses: food service, purchase and re-sale of condiments, fruit and vegetables, and various other small items.

In their desire to expand their businesses, the members of the Allakabo group decided to become members of the loan program of the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso two years ago. The group is on its second loan after having correctly reimbursed the first.

With this new loan, they intend to buy condiments: 100 kg of onions, 25 kg of cooking salt, 3 baskets of soumbala (a condiment made of "néré" tree seeds) and 20 containers of various other products; also, vegetables: 100 kg of cabbage, 25 kg of carrots and eggplant; 50 kg of sugar and 200 kg of millet (for porridge).

They purchase their merchandise exclusively where they live, at the market of Farakala, and sell retail at the same market for cash. Market days are the best chance to make big sales with the advent of the travelling buyers (from the big towns of Sikasso, Bougouni, and Ségou.

They each expect to be able to make a monthly profit of 25,000 FCFA which will be used to help their husbands with family expenses and make payments on the loan.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of vegetables, condiments, millet and sugar (for porridge)

loans.name: Senerita

texts.en: Senerita M., 23, is married with two children. She has 4 years of experience in the Flea Market business. She sells to the public 6 days per week. She has 4 previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 500 Tala (~$208 USD). SPBD loans are Senerita's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. All of her loan will be used to finance what is needed for the business, buying kava bowls, siapo, fine mats, elei materials, earrings, and other handicrafts to resell at her flea market. Her husband doesn't work but helps out with the business.

loans.use: Senerita would like to handicrafts to resell at her flea market.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es: El señor Roberto Carlos B., vive en Bº San Pedro, tiene 44 años de edad, es casado, y tiene 2 hijos.n Es propietario de una gomeria y ventas de cubiertas usadas, trabaja en este rubro hace 22 años, tiene clientela formada, y cuenta con buena ubicación, es muy conocido en la zona.n     El cliente quiere ampliar su local  para comprar màs cubiertas  ya que tiene buena venta con sus clientes. Con el crédito desea adquirir mayor variedad de cubiertas.n
texts.en:
Mr. Roberto Carlos B. lives in the San Pedro neighborhood. He is 44 years old, married, and has two children. He is the owner of a tire shop that sells used tires. He has worked in this field for 22 years, has an established clientele, a good location, and is well-known in the area. Roberto wants to increase his inventory, since there is sufficient demand among his customers. With the loan he will be able to stock a greater variety of tires.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of tires of varying sizes

loans.name: Mrs. Sokha Lay Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The group loan will benefit twenty-two people who live I. Veal Thlan Village I. Kandal Province. Mrs. Sokha L. has been elected village bank president by the members. She owns a small store where she earns a living by selling rice soup. She faces a problem because she does not have enough money to buy ingredients to cook her delicious soup for her consumers. She is applying for this loan so that she can buy those ingredients. Her husband, Mr. Mom Vann, is a journalist. Mrs. Sokha L. is 30 years old and the mother of a one-year-old child.

This applicatiO. includes seven end-of-term loans; the rest have monthly-payment loans. The first group of borrowers are not required to pay any principal O. the loan until the very end of the term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s maI. product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. These loans allow them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments O. time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% O. Kiva loans.

loans.use: To buy ingredients to cook rice soup for her consumers.

loans.name: Pascaline

texts.fr: A. Pascaline s’est marié avec AMOUSSOU Tossou Prosper. Elle est née le 3 avril 1953. Pascaline a un enfant qui vend la nourriture avec elle et qui a 38 ans. Pascaline n’est pas scolarisée, mais sa fille était éduquée, et elle aide avec son entreprise. Pascaline veut un crédit avec Alidé pour acheter la nourriture, les boissons frais, et le charbon. Elle achète son charbon au centre-ville et sa nourriture à Tokpa. Le crédit peut aussi aider avec les frais pour transporter ses produits.  Dans l’avenir, elle veut se débarrasser de la nourriture à cause du feu qui n’est pas bon pour le santé, et de vendre seulement le charbon et les boissons frais. Elle aussi désire d’acheter une parcelle pour construire sa propre boutique.
texts.en:
Pascaline A. is married to Tossou Prosper Amoussou. She was born April 3, 1953. Pascaline has a child who sells food with her and who is 38 years old. Pascaline was not educated, but her daughter was, and she helps with the business. Pascaline wants a loan with Alidé to buy food, cold drinks, and coal. She buys her coal downtown and her food at Tokpa. The loan can also help with the transportation costs for her products. In the future, she wants to get rid of the food-making part of her business because of the cooking fire, which isn’t healthy; she wants to sell only the coal and cold drinks. She would also like to buy a plot of land to build her own shop.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cold drinks and food

loans.name: Phea

texts.en: Mrs. Phea S. is a 30-year-old widow, and she now lives in Kdey Tnaut village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. In this plantation, she faces a problem because her field is infertile, and she also does not have enough money to hire laborers to work the field. In order to deal this problem, Mrs. Phea S. decided to ask for a loan to hire them. She hopes to increase her rice revenue, in order to support the family, with this loan.

loans.use: To hire laborers to work on the field

loans.name: Bharawan Allah Baksh Group

texts.en:
"My name is Bharawan and I’m a 28-year-old married lady and a citizen of a city called Multan, Pakistan for the past 10 years. Multan city is famous for its shrines and handmade items. I married a man whose name is A. B. and he runs a grocery shop with an experience of 10 years. I have three daughters. All of my daughters are getting an education from a school which is located near our house. I am a seamstress and take orders from my relatives and from my neighbors. I do this work to share the financial burden of my husband. I’ve successfully repaid my first loan from Asasah (a micro-finance institute in Pakistan). Now I’m applying again for a loan to buy groceries for my husband’s grocery shop.

I am leading a few more ladies in my group. Manzooran baji and Naziran baji and Shahnaz baji each want a loan to buy buffalos for their milk-selling businesses. Ishrat baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy groceries for our grocery shop

loans.name: Mary Mavis

texts.en:
Mary Mavis N. is seventy-two years old. She is a widow and has three children who are all living independently. Mavis is a dealer in hardware such as assorted paints, nails, roofing sheets, hammers, PVC pipes, etc. at Haatso, a suburb of Accra where she lives with her grandchildren. She buys her supplies from importers in Accra at wholesale prices and sells to her customers at retail prices. 

Mary Mavis requests the loan to enable her to procure increased stock of paints, nails, hammers, etc. to accelerate business progress. With the loan, she hopes to increase savings to expand her shop to include the sale of cement. She would be very grateful for your support. 

Mary is in a group called Strong Trust Bank in her community. The members in the group guarantee for one another as collateral to access the loan and provide support and assistance to one another in handling repayment.

loans.use: To procure hardware for re-sale

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.es: Gabriel tiene 30 años de edad, hace 3 años vive con su pareja, con la que tiene una hija, habitan en una casa alquilada. Desde que se casó siembra papa en chacras alquiladas, hizo su contrata por dos años. Él cultiva para semilla porque le resulta más rentable que para consumo, su producción la envía a la ciudad de Arequipa. También tiene brinda el servicio de Internet en su pueblo, que también le genera muy buenas ganancias. A Gabriel le gustaría incursionar en otros negocios, como ser intermediario en la compra y venta de papa; pero de todas las actividades que realiza se siente  más identificado con la agricultura, aunque algunas veces ha tenido grandes pérdidas, también le ha dado muchas satisfacciones, le gusta labrar y cultivar la tierra por ser parte de su infancia. Gabriel es muy puntual en cada una de sus cuotas, y este es su 8vo préstamo con MFP. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de semillas y fertilizantes, piensa volver a sembrar en el mismo terreno donde acaba de cosechar.
texts.en:
Gabriel is 30 years old. He lives in a rented house with his wife of three years, and together they have a daughter. Since he was married, he has planted potatoes in rented fields. He has had a contract for two years. He grows for seed because it is more profitable than growing for consumption. He sends his product to the city of Arequipa. He also provides Internet service in his neighborhood, which generates a very good income. Gabriel would like to break into other businesses, like serving as a middleman in the buying and selling of potatoes. Of all his activities, he identifies most closely with agriculture. Although he has occasionally had big losses, it has also given him a lot of satisfaction. He enjoyed working and cultivating the land as part of his childhood. Gabriel is very punctual in making all of his payments, and this is his eighth loan with MFP. This loan will be used to purchase seeds and fertilizers, as he plans to plant the same field he has just harvested.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Davaasuren

texts.en:
Davaasuren J. is 45, married, and the mother of two. Both her sons are university students in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She lives with her husband in a "ger" (a nomadic Mongolian tent) district in Arhanghay, one of Mongolian central provinces. 

In 1999, together with her husband Nyamtseren, she started her clothing retail business at the local market. She works as a saleswoman and her husband goes to Ereen, a Chinese border city, to buy cheap apparel. Ereen is a city where many Mongolians go to buy cheap goods to resell in Mongolia. As a result of hard work, her working capital has increased from 400,000 tugrugs to 1,600,000 tugrugs ($1.00 USD=1450 MNT). From her profit, she pays for her sons' tuition. 

She requests a loan to buy men's and women's apparel to increase her business inventory. In the future, she is planning to expand her family business by selling raw clothing materials such as animal skins, wool, and cashmere.

loans.use: To buy men's and women's apparel

loans.name: Candelaria Odilia

texts.es: La señora Candelaria Odilia A. es originaria del departamento de Totonicapan con residencia  el cantón Coxomo que se localiza a 5 kilometros de Cuatro caminos  carretera que conduce a la ciudad de Guatemal su activida principal es la venta de ropa y confeccion ser una persona muy sencilla y responsable en su comunidad hoy necesita de un credito para comprar materiales  de techado de su vivienda, para no tener problemas en el invierno.
texts.en:
Ms. Candelaria Odilia A. is from the department of Totonicapan. She resides in the Coxomo canton, which is located 5 kilometers from Cuatro Caminos, the highway that leads Guatemala City. She makes and sells clothing for a living. She is a down-to-earth and responsible person in her community. She now needs a loan so that she can purchase roofing materials for her house in order to keep from having problems during winter.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase roofing materials

loans.name: Koffi

texts.fr: Koffi T. est un jeune homme de 35 ans, marié et père de 2 enfants. il fait la pépinière des jeunes plants de tecks, palmiers, caféiers et cacaoyers à Wome. Il exerce cette activité depuis 8 ans. Son activité est très prospère à cause de la demande sans cesse croissante. Koffi espère avec ce crédit augmenter la taille de son activité en payant des intrants et des outils de travail nécessaires
texts.en:
Koffi T. is a young man, 35 years old, married, and the father of two. He has a nursery in Wome for saplings: teak, palm, coffee, and cocoa. He has been in this business for eight years. It’s a prosperous business because of the ever-growing demand. He hopes to use this loan to expand his business by buying the necessary fertilizers, supplies, and work tools.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and other supplies for his plant nursery

loans.name: Renacer Group

texts.es: El banco comunal “Renacer” es un grupo renovado por lo que sus miembros cuentan con experiencia en créditos  solidarios ya que provienen D. grupos anteriores y conocen lo que se necesita para formar un conjunto D. socios unido y dispuesto a crecer junto con la Institución. En general los socios se dedican a actividades D. índole comercial como la venta D. refrescos, cosméticos por catálogos y a actividades como la atención en centros D. llamadas, costura, soldadura D. arco y oxigeno y empleados D. diferentes empresas. Los miembros del grupo están representados por la señora Verónica que al igual que sus compañeros lucha diariamente con la competencia en el mercado D. oferta D. productos y desea realizar la adquisición D. materiales insumos y herramientas que ayuden a general una mayor ganancia y mejore la calida D. vida D. sus familias que es su principal motivación apara luchar día a día.
texts.en:
Renacer ('Rebirth') community bank is a group renewing their loans, so the members already have experience in solidarity group (peer-backed) credit. They all come from previous solidarity groups and know what is necessary to form a close group of partners willing to grow together along with the institution. Most of the members dedicate themselves to work of a commercial nature, such as sale of sodas, cosmetics (through catalog order), and services such as attending phone booth centers, tailoring, soldering, and jobs at different businesses. The group is represented by Verónica, who, like her fellow group members, fights daily with the competition of the supply market and hopes to acquire materials and tools that would help generate greater income and improve her family's quality of life, her main motivation to fight every day.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Togoontumur

texts.en: Togoontumur C. is a 38-year-old widow who has one daughter, Enhzul, who is six years old and goes to a local elementary school. Togoontumur lives with her mother and daughter in Arhangay, one of Mongolia's central provinces. Her mother is retired and stays home, taking care of Togoontumur’s daughter.  In 2005, Togoontumur started a business selling souvenirs. She buys unprocessed sheep's wool from local herders, then makes it into a variety of items that remind visitors of Mongolian culture and tradition. She makes most of her income in the summer, when many tourists head to Mongolia. Her dream is to open her own shop in the future.  She has applied for this loan to buy raw materials such as wool, paint and wire.

loans.use: To buy wool, wires and paint for her business

loans.name: Evenor

texts.es: Evenor C. C. tiene la edad de 55 años, es un hombre casado. Tiene 2 hijos a su cargo. Su actividad económica es ofrecer los servicios de alquiler de teléfonos y recargas telefónicas. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio, para sacar adelante a sus hijos. Por lo que fue muy difícil y no tenía el dinero suficiente, para establecer su negocio en un local en particular, pero debido a las circunstancias tuvo que establecer esta actividad económica.  El destino del financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para la compra de recargas y mas teléfonos. Su deseo es proporciónale a sus hijos la comodidad necesaria.
texts.en:
Evenor C. C. is 55 years old and is married. He has two children at home. His economic activity is renting phones and selling phone cards. He has been doing this for five years, to help his children get ahead. It was difficult to establish his business in a particular location because he didn't have enough money, but he had to start this business because because of his circumstances.

This loan will be used as capital to buy more phone cards and phones. His wish is to provide his children with the necessities of life.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Nidal

texts.en:
Nidal is a 40-year-old man who is married with five kids. He owns a business selling car parts and accessories in the downtown Nablus market. Nidal is full of ideas. He has rich experience working in this business. Moreover, he is very enthusiastic about his own small enterprise and has a good attitude. 

Nidal would like to get a loan of 3000 USD to increase his working capital. Nidal is hoping to generate more profit and provide for his kids.

loans.use: To increase his working capital

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is forty two years old and is married with two children who are currently in school. He is a petty trader and sells sponges, socks, shoe laces, curtain robes, etc. He sells through hawking (going door-to-door) and he has been in business.

He wants to use the loan opportunity to buy more sponges, socks, shoe lace, curtain robes, etc., to increase his stock of goods for sale. He hopes to raise an good income to pay his children’s school fees and to take care of the home. It is his desire to build his own house to reduce family cost and would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To increase stocks like socks, shoe laces, curtains robe etc.

loans.name: Johana Azucena

texts.es: Johana Azucena A. tiene 37 años. Tiene 2 hijos a su cargo. Su actividad económica es la venta de cosméticos. Hace más de 9 años que se dedica esta actividad, ella empezó trabajando desde muy joven, por lo que siempre su Mama le enseño a trabajar muy duro pero de una manera muy humilde. Ella tiene que recorrer largos caminos para ofrecer sus productos a pesar del inmenso sol que la acompaña siempre mantiene en mente que todo este esfuerzo que realiza es por sus hijos. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de perfumes, cremas, prendas de oro laminado. Su deseo es mejorar los ingresos de su familia.
texts.en:
Johana Azucena A. is 37 years old and has two children under her care. She makes a living selling cosmetics, which she has done for the past nine years.
