She started working when she was very young because her mother always taught her to work very hard but also very humbly. She has to cover large streets to offer her products as well as deal with the intense sun. She keeps her children in mind in all her efforts. The loan she is requesting is for working capital to purchase perfumes, creams, and golden dresses. Her wish is to improve her family's income.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase perfumes, creams and golden dresses.

loans.name: Las Dos Juntas Group

texts.es: Este grupo está compuesto por dos personas la sra. Juana C. que se dedica a la venta de condimentos y la sra. Virginia B. que se dedica a la venta de crema chantilli y gelatina. Las dos venden en la calle 23 de marzo, de la zona de Pampahasi. Doña Juana vive en la final de la calle 23 de marzo, con cuatro hijos que están en edad escolar, ella se dedica a la venta de condimentos como aji molido con y sin picante, pimienta, comino, mote, y demás. Doña Virginia vive en la zona de Kupini, ella hace crema chantilli, es leche batida con azúcar y limón, batido de bicervecina (cerveza negra), frescos hervidos y gelatina . Invertirán el crédito en incrementar su mercaderia.
texts.en:
This group consists of two people: Juan C., who sells seasonings, and Virginia B., who sells whipped cream and jello. The two women sell from the 23 de Marzo street market, in the Pampahasi district. Juana lives at the end of 23 de Marzo Street with her four children, who are in school. She sells seasonings such as ground aji pepper (mild and spicy), pepper, cumin, stewed maize, and others. Virginia lives in the Kupini district; she makes Chantilly (milk whipped with sugar and lemon), whipped bicervecina (smoothie made from a malt beverage), refreshments made from cooked fruit, and jello. They will use the loan to increase their merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of spices and evaporated milk.

loans.name: Ma. Teresa

texts.en:
Ma. Teresa T. is now 37 years old and married to a driver Samson T. 44 years old. At the long years of their marriage they were given 2 children namely: Khristel Sam now in 2nd year high school and Chivae Rain now 1 year old. Ma. Teresa and her husband is a partner in taking care of their two children and giving them their needs through their growing.

Now as a source of their income her husband is driving a tricycle which is one of main means of transportation in their place. A tricycle is like a cab which has 3 wheels and can ride a maximum of 6 passengers. Although this business is not their main source of income it also contributes revenue for their expense. Also her husband manage their fish cage business, this business give them more income that’s why they focuses on it. As a matter of fact she will use the loan that she received from KIVA field partner Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI) as additional capital to her fish cage business. They will buy necessary things needed in her business like fish net, mini boat, bamboo and different kind of rope and also payment for the laborer. Ma. Teresa also run a variety store that also gives them additional income that they can use in times they needed it. ASHI approved the proposed loan of Ma. Teresa amounting Php 45,000 because she has a good credit rating. She always attend to a center meeting, always pay on time and her 3 businesses are running good.

One dreams of Ma. Teresa is to see her children finish their studies and living a descent and good life, not experiencing the hardness of life.

loans.use: Will be use as additional capital for her business

loans.name: Hoàng Thị's Group

texts.en:
H. Hoàng Thị (10107060006) is a 55 year-old female living in the town of Đông Anh - Hà Nội. H. is the group leader of a 8-member group loan offered by SEDA. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Xuân Canh (4).

H. is married and has 3 adult-aged children. To make a living H. raises livestock. Her main source of income is from raising and selling chickens. H. has been engaged in this business for over 6 years and earns approximately 3.500.000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2006, H. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. H. successfully repaid a previous loan of 4.876.000 VND from SEDA that she used to expand her business. She now requests her 4th loan of 4.142.000 VND that she will also invest in her business. H. plans to use the additional revenue to improve the living conditions of her family.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1. Đào Thị X. (10107060002) is a 45 year-old female requesting a 5.886.000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.

2. Lê Thị T. (10107060003) is a 59 year-old female requesting a 5.014.000 VND loan to support her business running a food stall.

3. Trần Thị T. (10107060004) is a 24 year-old female requesting a 4.142.000 VND loan to support her business running a food stall.

4. Nguyễn Thị S. (10107060005) is a 50 year-old female requesting a 4.142.000 VND loan to support her business running a food stall.

5. Nguyễn Thị H. (10107060007) is a 35 year-old female requesting a 4.142.000 VND loan to support her manufacturing business.

6. Nguyễn Thị T. (10107060008) is a 29 year-old female requesting a 4.142.000 VND loan to support her manufacturing business.

7. Nguyễn THị H. (10107060001) is a 37 year-old female who is requesting a 2.834.000 VND loan to support her business running a food stall.

About SEDA
The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.

Note
To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


H. Hoàng Thị (10107060006) là 55 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Đông Anh - Hà Nội. H. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 8 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Xuân Canh (4). Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi gà để bán. H. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 6 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, H. kiếm được khoảng 3.500.000 VND. Vào 2006, H. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. H. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 4.876.000 VND từ SEDA. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng đầu tư mở rộng công việc kinh doanh. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 4.142.000 VND. Khoản vay sẽ là 4th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA. Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm: 1. Đào Thị X. (10107060002) là 45 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.886.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. 2. Lê Thị T. (10107060003) là 59 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.014.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm. 3. Trần Thị T. (10107060004) là 24 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.142.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm. 4. Nguyễn Thị S. (10107060005) là 50 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.142.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm. 5. Nguyễn Thị H. (10107060007) là 35 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.142.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh sản xuất. 6. Nguyễn Thị T. (10107060008) là 29 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.142.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh sản xuất. 7. Nguyễn THị H. (10107060001) là 37 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 2.834.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm. Về SEDA: Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam *Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta M. is from the village of Lapasan Clarin Misamis Occidental. She is 47 years old. Julieta is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Julieta owns and operates a shoe repair business. The main source of income for the business comes from repairing shoes. Julieta has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Julieta joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Julieta has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Julieta is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional raw materials. This will be the second loan taken out by Julieta from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte, and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional raw materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To stock up on beans, flour, and oil

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
This is Zainab C.. She is 35 years old, married, and is from So-so Town Lane in Waterloo. She has four children: two boys and two girls, three in secondary school and one in nursery school.

Zainab has been a LAPOSL client for some time now and has taken three previous loans. She is a member of a LAPOSL union (a credit group that acts as a collective collateral and guarantor). This is the first loan she will be receiving with the help of Kiva lenders.

Zainab has a shop where she sells alcohol, cigarette, drinks, sugar and other basic goods. With her previous loans she expanded the inventory of her shop and with her new loan she hopes to expand her business once again.

Zainab plans to use the increased profit from her business expansion to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy inventory of cigarettes, sugar, alcohol and drinks

loans.name: Eucila

texts.en: Eucila is 36 and has been married to Felipe for 16 years. They have five children; the oldest is 16. Eucila plants rice on her farm and works hard to produce high quality rice, a food all Filipino's eat. She wants a better income to provide for her family’s growing needs. Eucila needs additional capital for her farm. She applied to CEVI and asked for a loan of Php9, 000, which she will use to purchase farm supplies. She will also buy diesel for the tractor. This loan will surely help Eucila in her business.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Hope Group 1, Mukono

texts.en: K. Rose is 37 years old and married with four children aged 14 – 5 years. They are all in school and she takes care of other orphans. Rose has had a poultry farm business in Kigombya for two years.  She is able to make 400,000/= profit per month from the sale of eggs and broilers for meat. She says that she is faced with the high price of chicken feed due to the season but otherwise, her business is good. She has hopes of expanding her business plus educating her children to the highest level. Rose needs a loan to be able to buy more day old chicks for her farm expansion and to buy more feed for the existing chickens. She will save money by buying in bulk.

loans.use: To buy day old chicks and chicken feed

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie is a rice grower. She currently tills a 3-hectare (7.5-acre) rice field, which she is now preparing for planting.

A 33-year-old married woman, Margie has children who go to school. She does her best to make her farm productive because it is the sole source of her family’s income. It’s where she gets income for food, clothes and her children’s education.

Margie currently needs inputs for her farm. She is applying for a loan of Php 7,000 from CEVI. If granted, the loan will be used for fertilizer and other farm inputs.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and other farm inputs

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita B., age 54, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. She is married to Fernando B., a technician, and they have been blessed with two children. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life. She has been managing her own photocopying center for quite some time.

Teresita has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than 3 years. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow 14 times from CCT’s cooperative. She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to expand and improve her photocopying business.     

Now with your help, she would like to apply for a PHP 22,000 loan.  She will use the funds to buy equipment and expand her photocopying business. She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can have a good and comfortable life with her family.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To buy equipment to expand her photocopying business.

loans.name: Juliette

texts.fr: L. Juliette est née le 25 mai 1956 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin.  Il y a 10 ans que Juliette habite au quartier Gankpodo à Cotonou.  Juliette est mariée à DOSSOU-YOVO Alfred, un entrepreneur retraité.  Le couple a cinq enfants, tous scolarisés, dont un est encore à sa charge.  Juliette vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants et le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille.  Juliette n’a fréquenté que l’école primaire.  Pour subvenir à ses besoins, Juliette vend des produits divers (riz, conserves, farine de manioc, sucre, savons en poudre, huile d’arachide, pâtes alimentaire, etc.) dans sa boutique.   Juliette exerce cette activité depuis 32 ans et s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Juliette a déjà obtenu un crédit à ALIDé, crédit qu’elle a bien remboursé.  Juliette sollicite un autre crédit auprès de ALIDé pour renforcer ses activités et mieux satisfaire ses clients.  Juliette ambitionne plus tard réaménager sa boutique et faire une caisse à étagère vitrée dans laquelle elle pourra exposer les produits cosmétiques pour la vente.
texts.en:
L. Juliette was born on May 25, 1956 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She has been living in the Gankpodo district in Cotonou for ten years.  She is married to DOSSOU-YOVO Alfred, a retired entrepreneur.  The couple have five children, who have all had schooling.  One of the children is still in their care.  Juliette lives together with her husband and child. And the couple jointly ensure that family expenses are covered. Juliette attended primary school only.  To provide for herself, she sells a variety of goods (rice, canned foods, cassava flour, sugar, soap powder, peanut oil, pasta, etc.) in her shop.  She has been in this business for 32 years and gets he supplies at Dantokpa, the international market of Benin.  She has already had an ALIDé loan, which she repaid.  She's requesting another loan from ALIDé for bolstering her business and satisfying her customers further.  Juliette's ambition for later on is to fix up her shop and to make a glass case with shelving in which she'll be able to display her cosmetics for sale.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying peanut oil, rice, charcoal, canned foods, milk, and powdered milk

loans.name: Carlos Manuel

texts.es:
Carlos Manuel Solórzano E., es  una persona de 53 años quien  Labora como Vigilante en el Mercado Mayoreo de Managua, el tiene cinco hijos a su cargo,  y tres de ellos  se encuentra en edad escolar, es casada, ha trabajado un crédito con CEPRODEL durante un  año, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido un crédito en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias al financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL.  
El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: alambres de corriente eléctrica para el sistema eléctrico de su casa de habitación.
 Todo esto con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
Carlos dijo que los préstamos otorgados han sido para el mejoramiento de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Carlos Manuel Solórzano E. is 53, and works as a guard in the Wholesale Market of Managua. He is married and has five children that he supports, three who are school aged. He has been working with a loan from CEPRODEL for a year. In this period thanks to the loan with CEPRODEL, he has been able to improve his home. The current loan he is requesting is to buy construction materials such as electrical wire for the electrical system in his house. All of this is to offer greater security and a better standard of living for his children. Carlos said that the loans he has received have been for the improvement of his home.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To improve and enlarge his house

loans.name: Marites' Group

texts.en:
Marites L. is from the village of Cabaruan. She is 37 years old. Marites is the group leader of a 25-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 'Marites L.'s Group'.

Marites is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Marites owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling bottled gasoline in the local community. Marites has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 36,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Marites joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marites has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Marites is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the third loan taken out by Marites from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokha A. is a villager in Lvea Sa Kandal village in Kandal province and she is 32 years old. She is a Khmer cake seller in the local village and her husband, Mr. Doeun Kuy, is a fisherman who is able to earn some money from selling fish to support his family. Her husband is on the left in the photo.

Now, they have some problems because their boat is too old to use but they do not have money to solve the problem. Thus, Mrs. Sokha A. decided to ask for a loan to buy a boat. The rest of the loan she wants to use to buy timber for construction of her home.

Mrs. Sokha A. is the mother of a child who is two years old.

loans.use: To buy a boat for her husband to use for fishing and also timber to construct her home

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie C. is from the village of Tambagan, Medina, Misamis Oriental. She is 35 years old. Rosie is married and has 2 school-aged children. Rosie owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) shop where she sells food & daily-use products. She is also selling/renting cellphones and prepaid cards. Rosie has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Rosie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Rosie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & to provide working capital. Rosie is requesting a new loan of 17,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Rosie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Mouhamad

texts.en:
Mouhamad is a 35-year-old married man from Lebanon. He has seven family members in his household. He has been working in the agricultural field for 18 years. His main interest is raising different types of livestock, especially sheep and goats. He is proud that he manages his work and money well. His customers include friends and neighbors. He said that his customers have a high levE. of trust for him and his work. He notes that he faced some financial difficulty over the years, mostly due to the ongoing political conflict and war in Lebanon. 

He is requesting a loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua. He plans to purchase more sheep with this loan. He believes the loan will have a positive impact on his family. This will be his second loan from Al Majmoua.

loans.use: To purchase more sheep.

loans.name: Romeo

texts.en: Romeo C. is from Barangay Tucal, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. He is 43 years old, is married, and has four school-aged children. Romeo owns and operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. He has been engaged in his business for over twelve years and earns approximately 44,000 PHP per harvest. In 2010, Romeo joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. This loan will be his first from ASKI. Romeo plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Dependable God Group

texts.en:
Petty trading like the sale of groceries is widespread in Ghana because it is easy to start the business up. It usually begins with table-top selling and then grows to become a kiosk and eventually becomes a supermarket. Angelina K. is an entrepreneur who has been trading in groceries like biscuits, bottled water, candies, canned foods, rice, cooking oil, toiletries, etc. for the past 8 years. She is now 48 years old. 

Angelina hopes that, one day, she will be able to grow her business into a big shop. She is excited to be taking the loan which she plans to invest in purchasing groceries in bulk to serve her customers. She anticipates increasing her profit level and also expanding her market. She also farms to generate additional income.

Angelina is married to a farmer and they have five children from age 9-18 years. She describes herself as a cooperative group leader of 'Dependable God' Borrower Group, made up of 10 members. She says her group members are cordial and as the leader she ensures regular meeting attendance and repayment of loan installments.

loans.use: To purchase groceries in bulk

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna D. is from the village of Bagong Silang, Iligan City. She is 53 years old, widowed and has 4 adult-aged children. Edna owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Edna has been engaged in her business for over 35 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2009, Edna joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Edna has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI, which was used to to purchase additional inventory and working capital. Edna is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will again be used to purchase additional inventory and increase working capital. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Edna from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and increase working capital

location.town: Bagong Silang, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Mercy Roció

texts.es:
Mercy Roció B. G. tiene 24 años. Es casada, y vive con su esposo en el cantón de Ventanas, en la provincia de Los Ríos. Esta esperando una niña.

Mercy es una socia de la ventanilla rural Recinto San Ramón, que esta ubicada en Nuevo San Ramón, a 12 Km. de Ventanas. Son 20 socios en total, que están trabajando en la agricultura de corto ciclo (cosecha de 6 meses). Esto es el primer crédito que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa.

Mercy esta estudiante para ser secretaria administrativa, y al mismo tiempo, ayudando a su esposo en la agricultura (maíz y arroz). Hacen las ventas de sus productos en los comerciales López y G. de Ventanas cada 6 meses. 

Solicita el préstamo para sembrar maíz: comprar semillas y abonos. Piensa que este crédito le ayudara a tener ganancia y más rentabilidad. Sus sueños son tener una casa, comprar un carro y tener una mejor vida para todos los hijos que va a tener (quisiera tener 6). Enfrenta desafíos en los cultivos de arroz con plaga y problemas de salud en la familia. 

Le gusta dormir en su tiempo libre.
texts.en:
Mercy Roció B. G. is 24 years old. She is married and lives with her husband in the Ventanas cantón, in the province of Los Ríos. She is expecting a daughter. Mercy is a member of the Recinto San Ramón solidarity group, which is located in Nuevo San Ramón, 12 kilometers from Ventanas. There are 20 members in all, who work in short-cycle agriculture (harvesting every 6 months). This is the first loan that that they have taken out through Cooperativa San Jose. Mercy is studying to be an administrative secretary and at the same time, she is helping her husband with their farming (corn and rice). Every six months, they sell their products in the López y G. commercial area of Ventanas. She is requesting this loan to plant corn: to buy seeds and fertilizer. She thinks that this loan will help her to make gains and to have greater profitability. Her dreams are to have a house, to buy a car, and to have a better life for all of the children she is going to have (she wants to have 6). She faces challenges like pests in her rice crop and health problems in her family. She likes to sleep in her free time.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to grow corn: to buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Domingo

texts.en:
Domingo S. lives in the village of Lanna, Solana, Cagayan. He is 56 years old,  married and has six adult-aged children. To make a living, he owns and operates a furniture-making business. He has been in this line of work for more than 15 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month.

Domingo joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his life and ability to engage in business. He has successfully repaid nine  previous loans from ASKI and is applying for a new one, for 15,000 PHP, to buy tools and other equipment to expand his business. He plans to use the additional revenue generated by his business to create a reserve to use in future emergencies. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy tools and other equipment to expand his business

loans.name: Keko Ole

texts.en:
For the last three years, Keko has been rearing animals and selling them during peak season at a profit.  He is 36 years old, married to Hannah Mulejo, and they have two children.

He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his first loan.  He plans to buy 10 goats and five sheep which he will rear and sell later at a profit.

Keko also hopes to have an animal farm where he will live with his family as he rears the animals.

loans.use: To buy 10 goats and  five  sheep which he will rear and sell later at a profit.

loans.name: Asuncion

texts.en:
Asuncion B., from the village of Lagonglong, Misamis Oriental, is 46 years old, separated from her spouse, and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, Asuncion owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Engaged in her business for over six years, she earns approximately 10000 PHP a month.

In 2006, Asuncion joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 19000 PHP from HSPFI that was used to purchase additional products to sell, she is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP to purchase additional inventory and use as working capital. This will be Asuncion's ninth loan from HSPFI, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her store.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and use as working capital

loans.name: Cerila

texts.en:
Cerila L. is from the village of Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 46 years old, married and has seven adult-aged children. To make a living, Cerila owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Cerila has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2008, Cerila joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13,000 PHP from HSPFI. This loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Cerila is requesting a new loan of 16,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be her fifth from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Cicilia

texts.en: Cicilia F. is currently in the business of selling green vegetables. She is requesting a loan to stock fish to sell. Cicilia is 25 years old and is married; her husband works in the transportation industry. She has two children who do not go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase fish to sell

loans.name: Maria Joaquina

texts.es:
María de 19 años, tiene una pequeña tienda, vive en el Fortín de Guayaquil( zona periurbana, con caminos de tierra y lomas). 

Una de las hermanas de María le presto el local para que ella tuviera su tienda y así sacar el dinero que le faltaba para completar algunas problemas económicos que tenia debido a la falta de oportunidades. En la actualidad trabaja con la ayuda de su papa mientras que ella comprar los víveres en los mercados. Trabajan desde las 06h00am hasta las 22h00pm todos los días.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar arroz, azúcar, snack para su negocio. En el futuro quiero quiere ampliar su negocio para tener mas ingresos y tener dinero para poder estudiar y ayudar a su papa.
texts.en: María is 19 years old and has a small store. She lives in Fortín de Guayaquil (a suburban zone with dirt roads and hills). One of her sisters loaned her the space so that she could have a store, and she used the money she made to solve some economic problems she had due to her previous lack of job opportunities. She now works with the help of her father while she buys the supplies at the local markets. María works from 6 a.m. until 10 p.m. every day. With the loan, she plans to purchase rice, sugar and snacks for her business. In the future, she wants to expand her business so she can increase her profits and have enough money to study and help her father.

loans.use: Purchase rice, sugar, snacks, etc.

loans.name: Justina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  “ÑAHUPACMAN PURISUN ”;  El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito D. Huanchac, provincia D. Cusco y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra.  Justina;   ella tiene 58 años D. edad, es casada y tiene 3 hijos, La socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista, la socia compra y venD. mercadería (videos D. películas, música, documentales, etc.); La socia desea aumentar su mercadería y D. este modo incrementar sus ganancias. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra D. mercadería para su negocio.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the “Ñahupacman Purisun" communal bank.  The bank is located in Huanchac District, Cusco Province and Cusco Department.

The member's name is Justina.  She is 58 years old, married, and has three children.  She alternates household activities with her retail business buying and selling merchandise (videos of films, music, documentaries, etc.).  Justina  wants to increase her inventory and in this way improve her earnings.  The member asks for the loan to invest in buying merchandise for her business.

Justina is grateful for and values the loan granted her through this medium, and she promises to make her payments on schedule.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise (videos) for her business

loans.name: Kirui

texts.en:
Kirui W. is 31 years old and married. He has four children who range in age from 10 to 8 years old and are all currently attending school.

He is from the town of Litein in western Kenya and has been in the farming business for 10 years. He has been selling pineapples, bananas, chicken, and milk.

He is requesting a loan of 40,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo in order to purchase a dairy cow. This is his third loan through Juhudi, and with the expected profits, he hopes to be able to better support his family and to expand into various types of businesses.

In five years, he hopes to have bought various types of farm input and have at least three livestock animals.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Joohn

texts.en:
K. Joohn is an individual client from Ibanda. He is 32 years old and married with 3 children, with two attending school. He has a retail shop in Rushaka II that has been in existence for 7 years, selling general merchandise. He works closely with his wife, and together they also have a matooke selling business and rentals.  

Joohn’s biggest customers are the people in his locality, most of them being repeat customers. To start up his retail shop, Joohn first sold his cow to get capital and he does not regret this. He is a very hardworking man and hopes for his business to continue expanding.

loans.use: To restock his retail shop

loans.name: Claudine

texts.en:
Claudine owns a bar. She is married and has one child who is seven years old and goes to school. Her husband works as a technician. 

Claudine plans to use this loan to buy more chairs, tables, and drawers and cabinets which will be used in her bar. She said that any profits made will be used solely to reinvest and grow her business.  Currently she has only a few bartenders but would like to have more in the future.

loans.use: To buy more things for the pub like chairs, tables and drawers and cabinets

loans.name: And Dieuf Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité est depuis environs 9 ans, lors de l'ouverture du Banc Villageois. Il est composé de 08 membres toutes issues du même village et tissent de bonnes relations amicales. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois de NG.-NG..

Madame RAMA L. à droite de la photo levant la main main est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 36 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 06 enfants. 

Elle fait depuis longtemps un petit commerce de céréales et d'arachide

Avec son crédit de 100.000 francs CFA elle va augmenter son niveau production d'huile d'arachide et acheter plus de céréales pour revendre.

Son objectif est de participer au différentes charges familiales.
texts.en:
This solidarity group has existed for about 9 years, starting at the time that the Banc Villageois opened.  The group is composed of 8 members, all from the same village, who are building good friendships.  The group is part of the Banc Villageois of NG.-NG..  

Mrs. Rama L., with her hand raised on the right hand side of the photo, is the president of the group.  She is 36 years old.  She is married and is the mother of 6 children.  She has long had a small groundnut and cereal business, and with her loan of 100,000 francs she will increase her production of oil and buy more cereals for resale.  Her objective is to contribute to various family expenses.

loans.use: To develop and promote their small business activity

loans.name: Khaliyar

texts.en:
H. Khaliyar is married father who has 4 children. Khaliyar has been a farmer for the last 11 years. Farming is a passion to him. He practices both dairy farming and mixed crop farming. He says he has chosen farming as a career because the produce he produces in his farm has a ready market. His challenge at the moment is that he is not fully utilizing his whole piece of land because he used up all the proceeds form his last harvest to pay his children's school fees. So, he was not able to buy the seeds and fertilizers needed to plant his whole land. Khaliyar is requesting for a loan of $1500 USD to be able to purchase the resources needed to plough the whole farm for the next planting season. He will purchase assorted fertilizer stock and seeds.  
  
 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seed and mineral fertilizer.

loans.name: Bebelyn

texts.en:
Bebelyn S. is from the village of Sebasi, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 55 years old and married with two adult children. To make a living, Bebelyn runs a general store. She has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Bebelyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC and is now is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Bebelyn from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Mbinga Group

texts.en:
Tabu S., who is in her early thirties, is married with two children.  She has been selling fabrics which she buys from Kigomm, the northern part of Tanzania, to sell in Kariakoo. Kariakoo is near the city center. She also sells from door to door. She works from 6.00am to 8.00pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Tabu's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She wants a loan to increase her capital so that she can increase her stock.  Her dream is to open a shop and start selling clothes.

Tabu will share this loan with her loan group Mbinga, which has a total of 17 members.  The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back the loans.

In the picture, Tabu is behind, second from right.

loans.use: To increase capital for stock

loans.name: Carolina Del Carmen

texts.es: La Sra. Carolina del Carmen C. G. ella es trabajadora activa de una Empresa estatal desempeñándose como Asistente Fiscal tiene ocho años  de trabajar para esta institución. Ha tenido  dos créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno los ha realizado para la compra de materiales de construcción como Arena, Cemento, Piedra, Piedrín, Bloques etc. Para ampliar y mejorar su casa de habitación, los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le ha beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esta manera ella ha  mejorado su condición de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en: Carolina del Carmen C. G. currently works for a government agency as a Financial Assistant, and has done so for eight years. She has had two loans with CEPRODEL and each one has been used to purchase construction materials such as sand, cement, stone, gravel, blocks, etc., to improve and enlarge the house where she lives. These loans with CEPRODEL have been of great help to her since through them she has improved her living conditions and those of her family.

loans.use: Purchase construction materials - sand, cement, stone, blocks, etc.

loans.name: Sagrada Familia Group

texts.es:
Este Comité se formó gracias a la Señora Teofila L. D. A., que vive en la cuidad D. Villarrica.
Encantadas aceptaron conformar el Comité D. Mujeres Rurales nombrando al grupo "Sagrada Familia".
La sra. Mariela Lujan es vendedora ambulante, ella se dedica a comerciar con la venta D. ropas, desD. hace varios años se dedica a este rubro pero como posee muchos clientes desea poder complacerlos más D. acuerdo a sus gustos particulares y necesidades, por ello solicita el crédito, para poder comprar más ropas (shorts, remeras, pantalones, camisas, etc.) a modo D. tener variedades sobre las cuales puedan escoger las distintas personas que compran D. ella.
Todas las integrantes del comité desean progresar con la ayuda económica que puedan obtener D. Fundación Paraguaya y Kiva.
texts.en:
Teofila L. D. A., who lives in the town of Villarrica, formed this committee.  The group were delighted to join the 'Comité D. Mujeres Rurales' (Committee of Rural Women) program, naming their group "Sagrada Familia" (Sacred Family).

Mariela Lujan is an itinerant sales vendor who sells clothes.  She has been in this line of work for several years.  As she has many customers, she would like to be able to cater to their individual tastes and needs.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan, so that she can buy more fashionable clothes (shorts, t-shirts, pants, shirts, etc.) and have a wider range of merchandise so that her customers have more items to choose from.

All the members of this committee are keen to make progress with the financial help that they receive from Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy t-shirts, shorts, shirts, blouses, etc.

loans.name: Sr. De Torrechayoc - Mototaxistas Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal “Sr. de Torrechayoc - Mototaxistas” tiene 5 ciclos de funcionamiento (cada ciclo son 6 meses) entonces tiene 2 años y medio  juntos como grupo,  el banco comunal está conformado por personas que se dedican exclusivamente a  brindar servicios de mototaxi en la ciudad de Urubamba. Las reuniones del banco comunal son cada treinta días en la oficina de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Urubamba. La mayoría de los socios viven en la ciudad de Urubamba del departamento del Cusco, Perú.  El Valle Sagrado se ha convertido en uno de los centros turísticos más importantes del país. Además de contar con una riqueza histórica inigualable, la región del Urubamba ofrece infinitas posibilidades de distracción al turista: caminatas, baños termales, viajes en balsas o kayacs por el rio, vuelos en parapente o ala delta, cabalgatas, montañismo, etc.

Los socios son personas que se sientes muy orgullosos de vivir en la ciudad de Urubamba y aprovechan las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos.  Las actividades económicas de algunos de los socios a las que se dedican son por ejemplo; venta de verduras, chicharroneria, ropa, comida y otros se dedican a brindar servicios como de obreros y mototaxitas 
 
La socia Vilma nació en la ciudad de Quillabamba provincia de la Convección y tiene 24 años de edad. Actualmente, Vilma vive junto con su pareja y sus dos hijos en la ciudad  de Urubamba. Su actividad económica principal de Vilma es la venta de helados, porcorn, caramelos de forma ambulatoria y viene trabajando en este negocio desde hace dos años atrás, ella es mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora que también se dedica a engordar animales como toros, vacas para después venderlo a mejor precio. En esta oportunidad Vilma requiere el préstamo e igual que sus compañeras del banco comunal para incrementar capital del negocio pero ella desea comprar ganado. 

(Los socios que faltan en la foto no están porque pidieron permiso para no estar presente en la reunión).
texts.en:
The “Sr. de Torrechayoc - Mototaxistas” community bank has been through five loan cycles (each loan cycle lasts 6 months).  They have been together as a group for two and a half years.  The bank is made up of people who provide motorcycle taxi services in the city of Urubamba.  The bank's meetings take place every thirty days in Asociación Arariwa's office, in the city of Urubamba.  Most of the group's members live in the city of Urubamba, in Cusco department, Peru.  The 'Valle Sagrado' (Sacred Valley) has become one of the most important tourist centers in the country.  In addition to boasting an unrivaled historical heritage, the Urubamba region offers tourists infinite possibilities for entertainment: hiking, visiting the spas, taking raft or kayak journeys on the river, paragliding or hang gliding, horseback riding, mountaineering, etc.

The members of this group are people who feel very proud to live in the city of Urubamba.  They take advantage of opportunities to get ahead in life and, through their daily efforts, they strive to provide their children with a better future.  The members' business activities include: selling vegetables, running a 'chicharroneria' (a restaurant serving 'chicharrón' - pork crackling), selling clothes, selling meals and providing services as laborers or motorcycle taxi drivers.

Vilma is 24 years old and was born in the city of Quillabamba, in Convección province.  She lives with her partner and her two children in the city of Urubamba.  Her main business activity is selling ice cream, popcorn and candies as an itinerant street vendor.  She has been in this business for two years.  Vilma is a very hard-working and enterprising woman who also works fattening animals such as bulls and cows which she later sells for a better price.  On this occasion, Vilma requires a loan to increase her business capital like the other members of her community bank.  She would like to buy livestock.
 
(The members who are missing from the photo are not there because they requested permission to be absent from the meeting).

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Serah

texts.en:
Serah is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. For the past one year, she has been cooking chapati (flat bread) and beans for sale to the neighbouring school children. 

Serah dreams of expanding her business and establishing a restaurant business in the future. With the Kshs 20,000 she is requesting she wants to purchase two bundles of wheat flour and one sack of beans. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase two bundles of wheat flour and one sack of beans.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene B. M. is a single lady who has 2 children, ages 5 and 10 years old, whom she hopes to give a good education to the university level. Irene makes food, mainly plain beans and githeri (a mixture of cooked maize and beans) by the roadside. She sells to passersby and repeat buyers in a residential area in Mombasa. Mombasa is in the coastal region of Kenya and is well known for its many tourist attraction sites, especially the Indian Ocean white beaches. 

Irene has been doing this business for the last 3 years now. She says that her business is profitable, but the major challenge she has is lack of a premises where she could run and grow her food business. However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well. She is using her loan of 20,000 KES to buy maize and beans to grow her business and meet the demand of her customers. She hopes to open a restaurant in the future. She describes herself as an honest and trustworthy lady.

loans.use: to purchase maize and beans

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es: La señora Virginia se dedica a la venta de edredones para camas y también trabaja como empleada en una embajada. El crédito lo requiere para aumentar el capital, pues  requiere adquirir edredones para este invierno y de distintos colores; esta actividad es la fuente que tiene para complementar sus ingresos que tiene para mantener a su familia Vive en alquiler la misma esta ubicada en la zona de Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz;  es casada y  tiene tres hijos. Virginia es cliente de Impro desde el año 2008.
texts.en: Virginia engages in selling comforters and she is also works in an embassy. The loan she is requesting will be used to increase he working capital, as she needs to buy comforters in different colors for this coming winter. This activity is her main source of income she can count on to provide for her family. She lives in a rented house in Tembladerani, a neighborhood of the city of La Paz; she is married and she has 3 children. Virginia has been a Impro customer since 2008.

loans.use: To buy comforters in different colors to sell them to her customers.

loans.name: Blessing Group

texts.en:
Lucy is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs.  She was born in Kenema, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. She is 39 years of age. Lucy is married to a diamond miner and the couple has 1 child who is attending secondary school.

For over 20 years now, Lucy has been selling palm oil (the most popular cooking oil in the region). This is the first loan that Lucy and her group members have applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. 

Lucy will use her share of the loan (SLL 500,000) to expand her business – she will buy gallons of palm oil to add to her business.

loans.use: buy palm oil

loans.name: Mila

texts.en: Mila is 61 years old and lives in Bañadero, Ozamis City. She is married with three children. To earn a living, Mila has a business selling a variety of products such as shampoo, soap and anything that is needed in the household. She earns about 3,000 Philippines pesos each month doing this type of work. Mila has requested a loan to purchase more stock of products for her grocery store. Mila became a member of PMPC just this year. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of products for her grocery store.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius has been in the mining industry for 23 years in Naivasha town. He is 39 years old. He and his wife Nancy are blessed with four school-going children.

Julius was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend who is also a KADET client. This will be his second loan. He paid his previous loan of 30,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) in full and in good time. He plans to use the new loan amount to buy another extraction site and employ workers for manpower.

In the future, Julius hopes to buy a plot of land and build a house for his family.

loans.use: To buy another extraction site and employ workers for manpower.

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es: Maria De Los Ángeles tiene 47 años. Es madre de 2 hijos a su cargo. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta de ropa. Hace más de 16 años que se dedica a esta actividad. Obtuvo este negocio desde muy joven ya que, tenía que mantener a su familia y decidió luchar, con esfuerzo propio ya que esto le ayudo para que sus hijos pudieran estudiar y aspirar por otros niveles académicos. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de pantalones, camisas, faldas, vestidos y trajes.
texts.en:
Maria De Los Ángeles is 47 years old.  She has two children under her care.

She has been selling clothes for over 16 years.  She obtained this business when she was very young because she had to support her family.  She decided to be tenacious. It was her own effort that helped her so that her children would be able to go to school.

The loan she is requesting is for working capital to buy pants, shirts, skirts, dresses, and suits.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, skirts, dresses, and suits.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal “TAYTACHA  SEÑOR DE CCOYLLORITY DE YUNGAQUI”; El banco pertenece al distrito de Yungaqui, Provincia de Anta, departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Elizabeth; la socia tiene 32 años de edad; la socia es conviviente y tiene 4 hijos, de 14, 12, 8, 7 meses de edad; La socia se dedica a la compra y venta de animales menores y ganados vacunos; La socia tiene toros y vacas, la socia compra ganados y los engorda y vende, ahora ella desea comprar una vaca ternera; la socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de una vaca ternera. 

La socia se muestra muy satisfecha y agradecida por el apoyo que se le brindara mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the Communal Bank "TAYTACHA MAN OF CCOYLLORITY OF YUNGAQUI." The bank belongs to the Yungaqui district, Anta Province, and Cusco department.

The member is Mrs. Elizabeth who is 32 years old, has a partner and has 4 children who are 14, 12, 8, and 7 months of age. She buys and sells small animals and cattle. She owns bulls and cows. She buys livestock then fattens them up and sells them. At the moment she wants to use the loan to buy a calf.

She is very satisfied and thankful for the support being offered through this medium and commits to fulfill the payments in the established time period.

loans.use: invest in a calf.

loans.name: Marcela

texts.es: Marcela es comerciante ya que tiene una pequeña pulpería donde vende los granos básicos y también una venta de cosméticos tales como lociones, shampoo, cremas para el cuerpo y otros.Ella es soltera y vive junto a dos nietas. Es importante destacar que ha utilizado creditos los cuales los ha invertido en su venta. El crédito que está solicitando es para la compra de los granos básicos como arroz, azucar y frijoles para la venta y de igual manera la compra de los cosméticos como lociones, cremas y shampoo. Sus nietas le ayudan a atender el negocio después que llegan de la escuela.
texts.en: Marcela is a businesswoman who has a pulpería [small grocery store] where she sells basic grains and cosmetics such as lotions, shampoo, body cremes and other products. She is single and her two granddaughters live with her. She has benefited from prior loans, which she has invested in her business. The current loan that she is requesting is to purchase basic grains such as rice, sugar and beans to sell, and also to buy cosmetics such as lotions, cremes and shampoo. Her granddaughters help her tend to the business after then arrive home from school.

loans.use: to buy basic grains like rice and beans, sugar, body lotion and shampoo.

loans.name: Sergey

texts.ru:
Сергей женат, у него с супругой один ребенок. Сергей живет и работает в Бердянске. Он торгует разнообразным товаром на центральном рынке своего родного города, а именно он продает постельное белье, нижнее белье, тапочки, туалетную бумагу, полотенца и т.д. Торговля у Сергея всегда идет хорошо, его цены ниже, чем у конкурентов, а торговое место расположено в очень удачном месте для работы. Этим бизнесом Сергей занимается уже 3 года. Его оборотный капитал составляет 20 000 гривен, а доход – примерно 10 000 гривен. 

Сергею необходим кредит в 15 000 гривен, чтобы пополнить ассортимент товара и закупить дополнительные комплекты постельного белья и полотенца. Он надеется продолжать вкладывать полученные средства в развитие своего бизнеса и дальше. Сергей честный предприниматель, который с профессионализмом относится к своему делу и его предприимчивость помогает ему в этом. 

Пометка: история на РУССКОМ языке
texts.en: Sergey is married and has one child with his wife. Sergey lives and works in Berdyansk. He sells a variety of goods in his hometown's central market, in particular, bed linens, underwear, slippers, toilet paper, towels, etc. Sergey's products look good, his prices are lower than his competitors' and his retail space is in an excellent location. Sergey has been in business 3 years. He has 20,000 hryvnia in current assets and his income is around 10,000 hryvnia. Sergey is asking for a loan of 15,000 hyrvnia to add to the range of his products and to purchase more sets of towels and bed linens. He hopes to continue investing his profits in growing his business further. Sergey is an honest businessman whose entrepreneurial spirit has helped him to approach his work with professionalism.

loans.use: increase the variety of his goods and purchase sets of bed linens and towels.

loans.name: Talafulu

texts.en:
Talafulu is 33 years of age and married, with five children. Talafulu  owns & operates a business venture, selling food products in the local community.  She has 1 year of experience in this business. Talafulu  needs a loan of WST 1000 to purchase additional products to sell.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or US $167 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2011, Talafulu  joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Talafulu 's 1st loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Elmaddin

texts.en: Elmaddin, aged 27, is married and lives with his wife and one son in Bilasuvar. He runs a grocery store business and sells foods, cooking oil, and spices. He had not taken other loans previously from the state banks. This is his first loan which he received through AqroInvest. With this loan in the amount of 1000 AZN, he is planning on buying new inventory and renovating his store. Elmaddin is an honest and hardworking man.

loans.use: to buy new inventory and renovate his store

loans.name: Bagdagul's Group

texts.en:
Bagdagul is the treasurer of this group. She is 40, and together with her husband, she brings up a daughter and four sons. The daughter studies at university and the sons are at school. In order to earn money to meet the family needs, the family breeds livestock and then resells it at a higher price after being fattened. They started this activity 16 years ago with an initial investment of 500 soms and now the monthly profit from reselling livestock is about 6500 soms. With money received from the loan, Bagdagul wants to purchase more livestock for breeding, fattening and further reselling. In the future, she wants to provide all her children with a good education.

Where Did This Loan Come From?

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple "P" bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135.
 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
“I dream that my simple business today will improve so I can continue to help my husband in supporting our daily needs,” Nida Manuel of Magsaysay Naguillan, Isabela says.

She is married to Felimon, a carpenter, and their marriage is blessed with five children: Leni is the eldest, a 42-year-old high school graduate who is now in Hong Kong working as a domestic helper; Liza – a 36-year-old high school graduate; Roselene – a 33-year-old who is married and has finished high school; Binsor – a 32-year-old high school graduate who operates a tricycle, and Michael – a 27-year-old, and also a high school graduate.

Nida is currently engaged in food vending, every afternoon selling a variety of grilled foods such as barbecued pork, hotdogs, etc. She displays her products in front of their house. Nida wants to increase the quantity of the food she sells to earn more income and so is requesting a loan amounting to PHP 19,000 with which she will buy meats and other ingredients for her business.

“With such an amount, I hope to add other varieties of food for the hungry stomach. I am very optimistic that I will earn more to support my family's needs,” she says. In addition to her food-vending business, Nida also serves as the caretaker of a house owned by her nieces, who are abroad. This provides her with extra income.

loans.use: to buy drinks, bread, and meats for her business.

loans.name: Danish

texts.en:
Danish is married and blessed with two children.  He has been selling onions for the last six years to make a living.  Danish has employed three people to help him manage the business. In the next 5 years, he wants to become the supplier of onions in his region.  

Danish is requesting for a loan of 80,000 Kenyan shillings to buy onions for resale. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: buy onions to resell

loans.name: Najuwa

texts.en: Najuwa lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with 4 children, only 2 of who go to school. She sells second hand clothes on a retail basis. She sells her products door to door. She has been in business for the last 3 years. She works six days a week. She has requested for a loan of 100,000 from MCDT SACCO which she is going to use to buy more bales of second-hand clothes. Her goals and aspirations are to become a wholesaler and also to buy a plot of land. Her major business challenges are seasonality and ever increasing prices of clothes. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Angela is a 38-year-old married lady. She runs a retail shop to earn a living. She has been in this business for four years and has employed one person. Even though she runs her business in a competitive environment, she is able to retain her customers because of her good customer care. Angela thanks Faulu Kenya for training her on good customer care. She also farms for extra income.
Angela hopes to grow her business in five years. She has requested a loan of 30,000 Kenya shillings (KES) to buy sugar, tea leaves, and maize flour.

loans.use: To buy sugar, tea leaves, and maize flour.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es: Yolanda, de 59 años de edad, es viuda. Vive en compañía de su hijo mayor de 40 años de edad, quien la acompaña y apoya en todo momento, habitando en una casa que es de su propiedad. La actividad que realiza Yolanda en la costura, que aprendió mirando y apoyando a su hermana en su pequeño taller, logrando adquirir los conocimientos y experiencia necesario. Con un pequeño capital, compró una maquina de coser, siendo su primera herramienta de trabajo, e iniciándose en el remendando de las prendas de los clientes. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es el ingreso económico que le genera  para poder pagar los gastos que tiene en su hogar, además que le gusta coser, confeccionar lencería , ropa de todos los géneros. Por otro lado, tiene cansancio físico por las largas horas en una misma postura y eso le perjudica. Pero debe seguir esforzándose, pues desea mas adelante comprarse otra maquina de coser. Ese será el préstamo número 20 con la institución MFP, se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que viene recibiendo y desea seguir contando con este apoyo, por eso se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su cuotas, como en los préstamos anteriores. Con el monto solicitado, lo invertirá en la compra de materiales para la costura tales como telas, elásticos, hilos y demás, buscando la mejor calidad a un menor precio.
texts.en:
Yolanda is 59 years old and a widow. She lives with her grown son, age 40, who is with her and supports her at every moment. Yolanda lives in a house that she owns. She works as a seamstress and learned this trade by watching and helping her sister at her small workshop. As a result, she gained the necessary knowledge and experience. With a small amount of capital, Yolanda purchased a sewing machine, the main piece of equipment for her work. She started mending clothes for customers. What she likes about her job is the income that she generates so that she can pay for the household expenses. In addition, she enjoys sewing and making undergarments and clothing for all ages. Yolanda gets fatigued by the long hours in the same position, which causes her to hurt. However, she continues to strive forward because she wants to buy another sewing machine.

This will be her 20th loan with the MFP organization. She is grateful for the financial support she has received and wants to continue receiving this assistance. For this reason, Yolanda promises to complete her payments, just as she did with her previous loans. The amount she requested will be invested in the purchase of sewing materials such as fabrics, elastics, thread, and other items. She seeks to find the best quality of products at a lower price.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, elastics, thread, and other materials.

loans.name: Pelagie

texts.en:
Pelagie is 27 years old and married. She has two children age 1 and 6 years old. 

Pelagie owns a business selling sorghum. Her business is well known and well organized and she has four years of experience in this business. She currently employs three people to help her and her business runs from 7 a.m. to 5 p.m. per week except on Sunday.

Pelagie has requested a loan from Kiva via Vision Finance Company in order to buy large quantities of sorghum for resale. With any profit, Pelagie will reinvest her profits in her business and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy large quantities of sorghum for resale.

loans.name: Mirian Del Carmen

texts.es:
la sra. Mirian del Camen esta casada y es madre de 2 hijos, los tiene estudiando en el centro escolar público de su localidad, Mirian se dedica al comercio, cuenta con una pulpería, tiene mas de 2 años de tenerla, ahi   vende muchos productos relacionados con la canasta basica familiar,  su negocio esta ubicado en su casa de habitacion, el cual queda frente a un campo de fútbol, esto hace que muchas personas visiten su negocio.
Mirian administra su negocio y lo atiende personalmente. 
gracias a su negocio ha logrado salir adelante con sus hijos.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de abarroteria, granos basicos y otros alimentos, desea tener mas surtido su negocio para la epoca de navidad.
texts.en:
Mirian is married and is the mother of 2 children who are studying at the central public school in their town. Mirian is a business woman and runs a grocery store. She has been doing this for more than 2 years. She sells many products that families need every day. Her business is located in her home, which is opposite the soccer pitch, and this means that many people visit her store. 
Mirian runs the store and staffs it herself.
Thanks to her business she has been able to support her children to move forward in life.
The loan will be used to buy groceries, basic grains, and other food. She wants to have more stick for the Christmas period.

loans.use: to buy soap, butter, oil, sodas, bread, cookies, beans, rice, sugar, doughnuts, powdered milk, cereal, oats, toothpaste, toilet paper, sausages, dairy products, and chicken.

loans.name: Costa Pucu Group

texts.es:
Las mujeres del presente comité son de la cuidad de Caacupé, están en el ciclo numero 9 del programa de mujeres emprendedoras con sus 18 integrantes. Todas ellas son mujeres muy trabajadoras y comprometidas con sus familias, por ellos es que se esfuerzan al máximo, ya que quieren darle lo mejor.
Una de esas mujeres es la señora Rafaela, quien es una mujer muy luchadora y sacrificada, nos cuenta que todos los días empieza a trabajar desde muy tempranas horas repartiendo la leche que vende, ya que quiere que sus clientes ya tengan su producto para la hora del desayuno. Una de sus metas es convertirse en una gran comerciante, para generar mayores ingresos y seguir ayudando a su familia.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de leche en cantidad, para que de esa forma esté abastecida y pueda cumplir con sus clientes. Agradece a la fundación y a kiva por la oportunidad que le da.
texts.en:
The women of this committee are from the city of Caacupé.  They are on their 9th loan cycle of the "mujeres emprendedoras" program and they have 18 members. All of them are hardworking women who are committed to their families. For them they are striving to the maximum, because they want to give their best to their family.

One of the women is Mrs. Rafaela, who is a fighter and sacrificed woman.  She says that everyday she starts works very early distributing the milk she sells, since she wants her customers to have her product for the breakfast hour.

One of her goals is to become a great storekeeper, to generate greater earnings and continue helping her family. 

She is requesting a loan to buy a lot of milk, so that she is well stocked and can meet the needs of her customers. She is grateful to the foundation and Kiva for the opportunity provided to her.

loans.use: To buy milk for later sale.

loans.name: Reynaldo Antonio

texts.es: Reynaldo Antonio es un cliente de Fundación León 2000, tiene una actividad económica que es la renta de apartamentos en el cual este negocio que el emprendió fue por necesidad de generar ingresos a la familia pero al pasar de los años se enamoro de este negocio y hoy en día le dedica mucha dedicación y sus clientes están satisfecho por su servicio que le brinda. Actualmente Reynaldo está solicitando financiamiento para comprar sabanas, colchones, entre otros arreglos necesarios para los apartamentos que renta.
texts.en: Reynaldo Antonio is a Fundación León 2000 client whose economic activity is renting out apartments; he started this business because he needed to generate family income but in time he fell in love with this business and today he is very dedicated to it and his customers are satisfied because of the service he provides.
