Reynaldo at present is requesting a loan to buy sheets and mattresses among other necessary décor items for the apartments he rents out.

loans.use: to buy sheets and mattresses, among other items.

loans.name: Daniel Sahr's Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org based in Makeni, is very pleased to present to you this group of teachers from Koidu, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. They have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to request a loan of 7,900,000.00 SLL in order to meet their immediate financial challenges. At the end of each month, they will repay the loan using their monthly salaries.

Daniel is the leader of this group of teachers. Daniel was born in Koindu. He is fifty-one years old and married to a nurse. The couple has three children, one of whom is in college. Daniel has been a teacher for thirty years. He has requested this loan in order to buy building materials for the construction of a family house.

loans.use: to buy house building materials for the construction of a family house.

loans.name: Ibrahima

texts.fr:
Ibrahima est un cultivateur d'onions basé à ndiakhaye, son âge s'élève à 48 ans, il est marié et père de 6 enfants, il exerce cette activité depuis qu'il est petit accompagné de ses prents, ce prêt lui permet d'acheter du semence d'onions, de l'herbicide et des fertilisants.

Il compte à l'avenir d'accroître sa production et gagner d'autres marchés locaux au niveau des villages environnants.
texts.en:
Ibrahima is a onion crop-farmer based in Ndiakhaye. He is 48 years old, married and the father of six children, and has been crop farming since his childhood alongside his parents.

This loan will enable him to buy onion seeds, herbicide and fertilizer.

He plans in the future to increase his production and win other local markets from surrounding villages.

loans.use: buy onion seeds, herbicide and fertilizer

loans.name: Antoinette's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe créé depuis 2007,rassemble des membres qu habitent le même village et ont comme activité la plantation de bananes.

Antoinette qui se trouve à droite de la photo et levant le bras,est la représentante du groupe,elle est mariée,est âgée de 52 ans et mére de 07 enfants dont 03 garçons.

Son activité est la production de bananes.

Elle compte acheter 02 sacs d'engrais pour 11000f le sac,faire un chargement de fumier de 05 tonnes pour une valeur de 65000f,acheter de la paille pour 35000f,supporter des frais de transport de 7500f,acheter des piquets pour clôturer  son périmètre.

Son objectif est d'assister son mari,pour financer la scolarité de ses enfants,les frais liés à la santé et à la nourriture.
texts.en:
Created in 2007, this group brings together members who live in the same village and all work banana production.

Antoinette, on the right side of the photo with her hand raised, is the group's representative. She is a married 52-year-old mother of 7 children, 3 of whom are boys.

She works in banana production.

She intends to purchase 2 bags of fertilizer at 11,000 francs apiece, to buy a 5-ton load of manure for 65,000 francs, to purchase 35,000 francs worth of straw, to cover 7,500 francs of transportation costs, and to purchase stakes to enclose her plot of land.

Her goal is to help her husband, to fund her children's schooling and healthcare and food expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and manure

loans.name: Touch's Group

texts.en:
A local resident in Tbaung Khmum province, Touch, 35, is married with five dependent children in school. She lives in Tbaung Khmum province where she and her husband are growing rice and cassava for years. Obstacle to cassava farming business is decrease of price. 
Based on past loans which were paid back completely, Touch has been improving living standard gradually. Now, she is leading a group comprising of two members to apply for loans from VisionFund. She is going to use her loan to buy organic fertilizer and organic pesticide and to pay for plowing fees. She hopes that she can get more yields to keep her children in school and to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy organic fertilizer to improve her farmland to keep her children in school.

loans.name: Koffi Agbégnigan

texts.en:
Koffi Agbégnigan A. studied to be a veterinarian. Born in Zafi in 1954, he has known enough hardship during his education because his parents were poor. After finishing his studies, he decided to start his own business devoting himself to raising goats and sheep. Mr. A. applied his training, and his business flourished rapidly, allowing him to support his family. He had obtained an initial loan of $400, which he repaid without a problem. These days, he realizes even more that raising goats and sheep is very profitable and a growth area. That is why he would like to increase his livestock holdings.

Both experienced and talented, Mr. A. has the ability to take care of large herds. He is however limited by his financial means. So he is requesting a loan of $950. This financing would go towards enlarging the corral, acquiring new animals, and buying feed and veterinary supplies on a regular basis. Such a proposed plan deserves support because it would allow him to avoid being unemployed, something that a majority of young people today are experiencing in Togo.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur A. Koffi Agbégnigan est vétérinaire de formation. Né à Zafi en 1954, il a connu assez de difficultés pendant sa formation à cause de la pauvreté de ses parents.Après la formation, il décide de créer son propre emploi en s’adonnant au petit élevage de caprins et ovins. Grâce au savoir faire de Monsieur A., son élevage devient rapidement florissant. Ce qui lui permet de subvenir aux besoins de la famille. Il a obtenu un premier crédit de $400 qu’il a remboursé sans incident. Aujourd’hui, il se rend compte davantage que l’élevage de caprins de d’ovins est un secteur très rentable et porteur. D’où son désir d’agrandir le cheptel. Expérimenté et doué, il a la capacité de prendre soin d’un troupeau important. Seulement, il est limité par les moyens financiers. Voilà qui l’amène à sollicité ce crédit d‘un montant de $950. Le financement va servir à élargir la clôture, à acheter de nouveaux animaux et acheter régulièrement des produits pour leur traitement. Un tel projet mérite d’être soutenu car il permet à Monsieur A. d’éviter le chômage que la majorité des jeunes connaissent au Togo aujourd’hui.

loans.use: Enlarge his corral and buy feed and veterinary supplies.

loans.name: Yulduz

texts.en:
Yulduz lives in village where everyone is engaged in greenhouse-gardening. Yulduz grows saplings and sells them at the market. She has been engaged in this activity for over 8 years. Yulduz says if she had enough capital, she could construct a bigger greenhouse and install better heating. Currently she can only grow young plants in spring. 
Besides, Yulduz has two hogs. She used her fist loan for purchasing one of them and for fodder. Her current request is for reconstructing her greenhouse and the next loan she plans to use for improving its heating system.

loans.use: agriculture, livestock

loans.name: Maria Concepción

texts.en:
Maria Concepción is a hard-working woman who makes an effort day after day to provide the best for her three children. She is married and her husband works for a slaughterhouse, but his salary is quite low, so she decided to start her own business of selling meat 12 years ago. She started selling among her neighbors and since she has gained a lot of clients. She has worked hard to make her business grow and now she has the opportunity to supply big orders for banquets.

Mary is requesting for a loan of $250 that she will use to buy merchandise to be able to cover her clients’ demand and to offer a good service. She offers to repay the loan over a period of 3 to 6 months. With your help Mary can continue to make her business grow. Mary and her family are sincerely grateful of your trust and support.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria Concepción es una mujer muy trabajadora que se esfuerza día a día para darle lo mejor a sus tres hijos, ella es casada y su esposo trabaja para una empresa donde matan los animales para comercializar su carne, pero el salario que recibe es muy bajo, por lo que ella se decidió a emprender su negocio con la venta de carne desde hace 12 años, se ha dado a conocer entre sus vecinas y ha estado ganando muchos clientes, ella se ha esforzado mucho por hacer crecer su negocio y ahora tiene la oportunidad de surtir grandes pedidos que le solicitan en banquetes.

En estos momentos Mary solicita un crédito por $ 250 dólares que destinará a la compra de mercancía para poder cubrir la demanda de sus clientes y ofrecer un buen servicio, ella ofrece retornar esta cantidad en un lapso de 3 a 6 meses. Con tu ayuda Mary puede continuar creciendo con su negocio, ella y su familia agradecen sinceramente tu confianza y apoyo.

loans.use: Buy merchandise

location.town: San Nicolás de los Garza, Nuevo León

loans.name: Tâm

texts.en: Tâm lives in the same house with her 6 children(12-34 years old) and a nephew (7 years old). They care for 500 green dragon plants (grown for their fruit) and she also works as a tailor. Their average income is $12 per month per person. The two younger children are in school; one of them got a Vietnam Plus scholarship last year. Tâm wants to borrow $ 75 to invest in their green dragon plants. She plans to repay the loan over the space of 5 months.

loans.use: growing green dragon (fruit) plants

loans.name: Cheng

texts.en: Mrs. Cheng S., 37, lives with her husband and two children in the Kampong Cham district of Cambodia. Cheng Sokham works at her own grocery store, from which she earns $2 a day. Her husband earns $3 a day transporting customers by horse and cart. Cheng S. intends to use this loan to buy a used car for her husband so that he can operate a taxi business, which will earn more than his current occupation driving a horse and cart.

loans.use: to purchase a used car to operate a taxi business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more cylinders of gas

loans.name: Lim

texts.en: Mrs. Lim C. H., age 39, earns about $1.60 a day as a secondary school.  Her husband is a motor-taxi driver and earns about $2.50 each day in revenue.  They have four children in school and one child working in a garment factory.  She would like to request a loan for $600 to purchase peanut seeds, rice seeds, and fertilizer to grow crops on her piece of land to sell at market.  By purchasing the seeds in large amounts, she hopes to take advantage of bulk discounts and increase profitability.  They plan to use the supplemental income to expand their farm and help fund their children’s education. Her husband is pictured outside their home as she was not available at the time.

loans.use: To purchase peanut seeds, rice seeds, and fertilizer to grow crops on her piece of land to sell at market.

loans.name: Graciela's Group

texts.en:
Lidia, Zonia, and Graciela have been part of the community bank “Virgen Maria” for 9, 9, and 13 years respectively. In their community bank they have learned to be punctual, to save, to be responsible, how to educate their children, and how to have a healthy relationship with their husbands. They mentioned that in their community bank they feel like sisters.

Lidia is 34 years old and is married with five children. She has been selling, grains, animals, cheeses, and potatoes for nine years. She buys these things in the different open markets around the area and sells them in Ayacucho.

Zonia is 48 years old and is single. She travels to the market in the town of Putacca on Thursdays to buy grains and animals. She then sells these products in Ayacucho; she has been doing this for nine years. Zonia has also been raising animals for sale in the market.

On the other hand, Graciela sells meat and grains in the Magdalena market. She also sells, out of her house, products that she buys at the markets. In the past she sold food from the market in Pampa Cangallo market but had to start a new business when her husband changed jobs.

Lidia, Zonia, and Graciela need loans of 1200, 1200, and 400 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in buying potatoes, peas, habas (a local legume), cheese, pork, corn and wheat, and food for their animals.

They plan to use their savings to educate their children, improve their homes, and pay for medical care. Lidia dreams of having a house and more savings, while Zonia dreams of having land to cultivate and a house. Graciela dreams that her children will be professionals, and that she will have the capital to start another business.

loans.use: invest in and expand their various businesses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Continue investing in seafood at wholesale prices

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es:
Maria Cristina is single. She had traveled outside the country looking for a better quality of life, but she had several difficulties so she decided to return to her country and work together with her family in Ticuantepe, an agricultural zone. Making use of the knowledge about agriculture that she and her family have, along with a few hectares of land, she decided to invest her savings and efforts in a small pineapple plantation, hoping to expand the business. In order to have a great crop she is asking for a loan to be able to maintain her crop and hopefully have excellent quality and success with this harvest. Her buyers are people who have purchased from her family for over 15 years and they are ready to buy. She hopes to be able to get ahead financially together with her family, putting all her energy in that which she owns and no one can take away - her land and her work.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

Maria Cristina es soltera, se había ido fuera del país tratando de buscar un mejor nivel de vida, sin embargo se encontró con muchas dificultades por lo que decidió regresar a su país y trabajar junto a su familia en Ticuantepe que es una zona agrícola. Haciendo uso de los conocimientos que su familia y ella tienen en agricultura y de algunas manzanas de tierras decidió invertir sus ahorros y esfuerzo en una pequeña plantación que tenían de piña, logrando expandirse. Teniendo una hermosa cosecha solicita el crédito para darle mantenimiento a la misma y que la calidad esperada tenga éxito, sus compradores son personas que desde hace mas de 15 años le han comprado a su familia su producción y están listos para comprar. Ella espera poder salir adelante junto a su familia poniendo todo su esfuerzo en lo que posee y que nadie puede quitarle como lo es su tierra y su trabajo.

loans.use: Purchase agricultural products

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.es:
Alejandra C. considers herself to be a very serious, hard-working, and honest person. She is a widow and has four children: Margarito, 29 years old, studies and works as a secondary school teacher; Luis Gerardo, 27 years old, is employed; Martha Alejandra, 25 years old, is employed; and Blanca Estela, 23 years old, is married. Only Margarito and Luis Gerardo live with her.

She started her business because when her husband was alive, sometimes his work wasn’t steady and she wanted to help him with the household expenses. She opened a grocery store in March 1985 when her husband was still alive. He worked as a clerk and she attended the store. As their house was on a busy street, they built a wooden store on the patio of their house. They have done well and her son Luis is a carpenter, and he has been expanding the store a little bit and now they are remodeling it because they would like to expand it.

She is requesting a loan of $400, to be repaid over 5 months, to purchase wood and paint, as well as have lettering done, which will make their store look more presentable and large to give their customers better service.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Alejandra C. se considera una persona muy seria, trabajadora y honesta. Es viuda y tiene 4 hijos Margarito de 29 años, estudia y trabaja como maestro de secundaria; Luis Gerardo de 27 años, trabaja; Martha Alejandra de 25 años, trabaja y Blanca Estela de 23 años, casada. Solo Margarito y Luis Gerardo viven con ella.

Inició el negocio porque cuando vivía su esposo a veces no le iba muy bien en su trabajo y ella quiso ayudarlo con los gastos de la casa. Abrió una tienda de abarrotes en Marzo de 1985 cuando todavía vivía su esposo, el trabajaba como empleado y ella atendía la tienda y como su casa quedaba en una calle muy transitada, acondiciono el patio de su casa y puso un local de madera pequeño, como le ha ido muy bien y su hijo Luis es carpintero, la ha estado ampliando un poco mas y ahora la tiene en remodelación porqué quiere hacerla mas grande.

Solicita un crédito por US $400 que pagara en 5 meses para comprar madera y pintura, y mandar hacer algunas rotulaciones, lo que hará que su tienda se vea más presentable y amplia para darle una mejor atención a sus clientes.

loans.use: Purchase paint, wood and make signs

loans.name: Kiwala Harriet, Baligenwa Group

texts.en: K. Harriet is married with children, the eldest being 14 years old while the baby is 6 months. For the past six years, she has been selling used clothing for women, men and children from Jinja Market. She buys her stock from the large market in Kampala at a discount and then brings the items for sale at a higher price. For the stall in the market, she pays a daily fee to the authorities and with her loan, she plans to buy a bale of used clothes now that a store has been opened up in Jinja that sells the same clothes in bales, hence saving the transport costs. By buying in larger quantities, Harriet can get a larger discount, hence more profits. She is a member of Baligenwa lending group for 6 years.

loans.use: Kiwala Harriet plans to buy a bale of used clothes for her stock with her loan.

loans.name: Refika

texts.en:
Refika M. was born in 1965. She is married and lives in the village of Gnojnici.

Her husband works clearing mines that were left over from the war, while she works raising vegetables for their farm.

Refika has a greenhouse, but needs a water pump to cultivate the vegetables that she plans to grow. She is requesting a loan of 1,200 KM (Bosnian Marks) ($950) to buy the water pump and grow her farming business.

loans.use: To buy a water pump.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes J. is 55 years old. She is married with four children. At the moment, three have completed senior high school. She sells babies clothes, pampers, powder, napkins, detergents, and feeding bottles, as well as plastic chairs at the local market. She would like to use the loan to buy more supplies of baby clothes, napkins, pampers, baby oil, detergents and plastic materials to provide her children with a good education. She is a member of the group called ‘Israel Trust Group’. In this group, members guarantee each other's loans and provide peer pressure to repay loans.  Peer pressure and support provide additional incentive to repay, because if one person in the group defaults, the group members make up the repayment amount

loans.use: To buy more supplies of baby clothes, napkins, pampers, baby oil, detergents and plastic materials.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama K. is 38 years old and a married woman with four children. All of her children are currently in school. 

Ama treks to the farming communities to purchase her products and then sells them in the town market. She says that the price of commodities is on the rise and, therefore, she wants to use the loan to buy more yams and rice to avoid price hikes and frequent travels. She hopes to increase her savings to support her husband and pay her children's school fees. 

She is a member of the group called "Aseda wura." Members agree to guarantee for one other as social collateral and assist each other to repay their loans. Ama appears in the photo with two of her kids.

loans.use: To buy more yams and rice.

loans.name: Dragana

texts.en: Dragana  is a married woman from Doboj.  Her husband has a job as a automobile electrician. He can earn about 1,500 KM. She has one child, 17 years old. This is her first loan from WWI in the amount of 1,200 KM. Dragana will use it to buy compost and seedlings for her vegetable garden. She wants also to prepare her land for the winter.

loans.use: To buy compost and seedlings.

loans.name: Pepe

texts.en: Pepe M., 49, is married and has four children.  She has many years of experience in the plantation/fishing business. She sells to the village people four days per week. She has five previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 500 Tala ($208 USD).  SPBD loans are Pepe's only access to capital because she cannot qualify for a loan with  traditional banks. She will used her loan to buy fishing nets, goggles, spears, and a canoe. Her husband is one of the very professional fisherman in the village.

loans.use: Purchase fishing net, goggles, spear, and a canoe

loans.name: I Komang Muriada

texts.id: Mendapatkan hasil panen yang baik dan pendapatan yang lebih banyak merupakan impian bagi semua petani. Tak terkecuali juga dengan I Komang Muriada. Dari sebidang tanah milik orang tuanya yang ditanami dengan sayuran yaitu Kacang panjang, I Komang Muriada berharap mendapat hasil yang maksimal. Namun Karena keterbatasan yang ada, impian itu belum bisa I Komang Muriada wujudkan saat ini. nDari hasil panen periode pertama, I Komang Muriada hanya mendapat keuntungan yang sangat tipis yaitu Rp. 1.000.000 / 3 bln . Hal ini disebabkan karena faktor alam ( kekurangan air ). Namun begitu, I Komang Muriada tak patah semangat.  Bahkan saat ini tanah garapannya telah di tanami kembali dengan tanaman yang baru. Besar harapan I Komang Muriada musim kedepan ini hasil panennya akan lebih baik, dan untuk mendukung hal itu I Komang Muriada masih mengharapkan mendapat pinjaman dari Dinari untuk  tahap  yang ke dua. Pinjaman ini akan dipergunakan untuk biaya perawatan tanaman sayurnya seperti : untuk beli pupuk.dan obat-obatan. nUntuk menunjang usahanya, I Komang Muriada bergabung dengan program Dinari yang jangka waktunya selama 6 bulan dan pengembalian pinjaman pada akhir periode. n
texts.en:
To have a good harvest is every farmers' dream. This is also a dream of I Komang Muriada who is a long bean farmer. In the last harvest season, he only got a net revenue of IDR 1 million (around USD 105) for a 3 month farming period. This is due to difficulties in the irrigation system.

For this farming season, he wants to get a better result. He hopes that he can get a loan from DINARI foundation to enable him to buy fertilizer and pesticide.

He participated in a 6 month DINARI foundation program where he can repay the loan at the end of the program period.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticide etc (Membeli pupuk, anti hama dan ongkos tenaga kerja)

loans.name: Phea

texts.en: Mrs. Phea N. is a farmer in Thorm Ney village in Takeo Province. She owns a small piece of land on which she cultivates rice. Aside from this farm, she also sells water lilies in the local market. Due to rampant inflation, she has been unable to earn enough money to support her family. Thus, she decided to request a loan to buy a cow to start a cattle breeding business. She hopes thereby to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions. Mrs. Phea N. is a 51 year old widow with four children: one is a waitress in the restaurant, one helps on the farm, and the others are attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy a cow to start a cattle-breeding business

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.es:
La señora Jacinta es socia del Banco Comunal “Víctor Echave” del distrito, provincia y departamento de Puno. Tiene 46 años de edad, es casada y madre de 3 hijos estudiantes, a los que mantiene. 
Con su primer préstamo que recibió de S/.300 compró golosinas para vender en el carrito que tenía para trabajar en la calle. Nos cuenta que ha vendido golosinas en un carrito hace 15 años y posteriormente construyó su casa donde desde hace un mes abrió su tienda.
Con este préstamo de S/.1,500, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará panetones y otros productos que se venden más en las fiestas de navidad.
Jacinta desea seguir trabajando para que sus hijos continúen sus estudios superiores y lleguen a ser profesionales.
texts.en:
Mrs. Jacinta is a member of the communal bank "Victor Echave" in the district, province and region of Puno. She is a 46-year-old married mother of three children, all of whom are students and she supports. With the first 300 soles loan she received she bought sweets to sell from her street cart. She had been selling sweets from her cart for the past 15 years and then built her home, where just a month ago she opened up her store. With this 1,500 soles loan, which will be repaid in four payments, she will buy holiday breads and other products which sell during the Christmas holidays. Jacinta wishes to keep working so her children can continue their studies and one day begin their professional careers.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy holiday breads and other products.

loans.name: Samson Gitam

texts.en:
Samson Gitam M. is a volunteer member of the Runyenjes Group in Runyenjes, Kenya. The group has received training from K-MET on home-based patient care services and is also part of the K-MET microfinance program.

Samson has been a member of the group since 2007 and is a church minister in Runyenjes, Kenya. He also owns a small taxi business in town. Samson has had the taxi business since 2002 and now has one employee. The competition is stiff, so he tries to have the best car in the area so as to get more business. With his first loan from K-MET, Samson painted his taxi and bought some spare parts.

He has applied for a second loan of 400 USD in order to repair the car as it is currently in bad shape and not running well.

Samson is married with 5 children, 2 boys and 3 girls. Four of the children are currently enrolled in school, while the 5th, at 3 ½ years old, is still waiting to begin.

loans.use: Repair of Taxi used for transportation

loans.name: Ma. Nenita

texts.en:
Ma. Nenita A. sells fish. She is 50 years old and has 10 children. When she was just a child, her parents, also  fish vendors, always took her to sell fresh fish in the market. She dreams that all her children will graduate from college and continuously chase their dreams.

In 1979, she started selling fish and has been able to grow her business. Her profits go to pay the family's daily expenses, as well as for school fees and other projects. She is asking CEVI for a loan of Php 18,000 ($400 USD). She will use the loan to buy a pump boat. Once she has the boat, it will be easy for her to catch more fish to sell.

CEVI gives their clients like A. credit assistance, training, and insurance coverage to help them grow their businesses.

loans.use: To buy a pump boat for her fish business.

loans.name: Paula Isabel

texts.es: Doña Paula Isabel es casada, maestra titulada, es dueña de la propiedad en construccion ubicada frente a la gasolinera Shell en Juigalpa, actualmente esta construyendose en un 80% y está en la parte de detalles que por el tamaño de la obra cada detalle es caro, cuenta con el apoyo de su marido para esta gestion; la inversion será para compra de puertas y ventanas de 8 cuartos que ya estan terminados.  El mayor sueño de doña Paula es ver concluida la obra, ya que estos cuartos son parte de un proyecto para hotel que le generara ingresos adicionales.
texts.en:
Ms. Paula Isabel is married and is a licensed teacher. She is also the owner of the property being built in front of the Shell gas station in Juigalpa. Right now the building is 80% complete and they are putting the finishing touches on. Because of the size of the project, even the small details are expensive. She counts on her husband’s support for this project. This loan will be used to buy doors and windows for 8 rooms that are already built. Paula’s biggest dream is to see this project finished because these rooms are part of a project to build a hotel that will generate extra income.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase doors and windows

loans.name: Sat

texts.en:
Sat K. is a villager in Sramouch Hae village, in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice to earn a living.

On her plantation, she doesn't earn enough income to support her family. In order to improve their lives, she decided to ask for a loan to buy two cows for breeding to earn more income. Sat would also use them to plow the field to reduce her expenses.

Sat is a 48 years old widow with a child who is employed.

loans.use: Buy two cows for breeding to earn more income and use them to plow the field to reduce her expenses.

loans.name: Manzura

texts.ru: Манзура- женщина 49 лет , замужем, имеет четверых детей, занимается бизнесом продажи детской одежды.Её точка реализации на рынке Костакоза.Она завозит товар с Истаравшана.Решила получить кредит для увеличения оборотного капитала.Её муж работает мастером по евро ремонту квартир.Все её дети самостоятельно живут отдельно от родителей.Проведя мониторинг было выявлено, что Манзура действительно торгует и имеет хороший спрос на товар.
texts.en:
Manzura is a 49-year-old woman, married and has four children. She is in the business of selling children's clothing. Her sales outlet is at the Kostakoz market, and she brings goods in from Istaravshan. Manzura decided to take out a loan to increase her working capital. Her husband remodels apartments to European standards. All her children are grown and no longer live at home. When we visited it was evident that Manzura is quite a businesswoman and her goods are in demand.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sale of children's clothing

loans.name: Videla

texts.es:
VIDELA S. D. SALDAÑA, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las estrellitas D. Pucallpa” vive en Asentamiento Humano 4 D. junio del distrito D. Manantay, en la ciudad D. Pucallpa, tiene 59 años D. edad.

Con su primer préstamo D. S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, inició su negocio D. venta D. alimentos, compró víveres para elaborar platos típicos, los mismos que ofrece a sus amigos y moradores D. la zona.

En la actualidad se dedica a preparar platos propios D. la región como juanes hechos en hoja D. bijao (planta regional) además hace tamales con productos D. la región, D. esta manera está  progresando y el negocio ha mejorado.  Con este préstamo D. S/. 1,000.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará más víveres, gas (combustibles), vajilla y otros insumos como arroz, azúcar.

“Me da mucho gusto D. trabajar con Manuela Ramos porque me permite tener un negocio y además me hace sentir que puedo lograr muchas sueños y confía en mi capacidad”.
texts.en:
VIDELA S. D. SALDAÑA belongs to the community bank "Small stars of Pucallpa" and lives in the "4th of June" settlement in the district of Manantay, in the town of Pucallpa. She is 59 years old. With her first loan of 300 soles, she started-up her business selling food: she bought provisions for making typical dishes which she offered to her friends and local inhabitants. Currently, she makes typical dishes from her own region such as "juanes" wrapped in a bijao leaf (from a regional plant). She also makes tamales with regional products and in this way she's the business is importing and she's progressing. With this loan of 1000 new soles, she will buy more provisions, such as gas (combustible), dishes, and other ingredients such as rice and sugar. She says "it gives me a lot of pleasure to work with Mauela Ramos because it has allowed me to have a business and also has given me the feeling that I can realise my dreams and have confidence in my own abilities".

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for making food. Purchase of gas and dishes.

loans.name: Mariame

texts.fr:
Madame  Mariame Djiré a 46 ans et vit  dans une famille polygame avec  ses 7 enfants (3 garçons et 4 filles), son époux et sa coépouse  à Sanoubougou II, un des quartiers périphériques de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
N’ayant pas été à l’école pour des raisons sociales, cette  femme s’est initiée à une activité génératrice de revenus qui  est la teinture,  apprise à Bamako (capitale du Mali) auprès d’une célèbre teinturière de la place ANTOU. Elle jouit d’une forte réputation dans cette activité et reçoit beaucoup de commandes surtout lors des cérémonies (mariage, baptême, fêtes, etc.) mais ses ressources propres ne peuvent pas lui permettre de les satisfaire.  C’est ainsi, qu’elle sollicite la collaboration de Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elle est à son 4ème prêt individuel, après avoir correctement  remboursés  tous les prêts précédents.
Elle compte acheter, 5 pièces de bazins blancs, 10 sachets de soude caustique et 10 boites de teinture de couleurs différentes. Elle s’approvisionne auprès des grossistes à Bamako en matières premières (bazins blancs, soude caustique et teintures). Les bazins blancs sont mis dans les différentes couleurs avant d’être revendus  soit au comptant ou à crédit, à une clientèle composée en grande partie de revendeuses des bazins teintés, des couturiers et des femmes de son quartier.
Avec ce quatrième prêt, elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 300 000 FCFA qu’elle utilisera essentiellement pour ses dépenses personnelles, contribuer aux dépenses familiales en aidant son époux, payer les intérêts de son prêt et renforcer son activité de teinture.
texts.en:
Ms. Mariame Djiré, age 46, lives in a polygamous family with her seven children (3 boys and 4 girls), her husband, and her co-spouse in Sanoubougou II, an outlying district of Sikasso City (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Not having gone to school due to societal reasons, this woman was introduced to an income-generating business, the dyeing of cloth. She learned this trade in Bamako (capital of Mali) from ANTOU, a local celebrated dye expert. Mariame enjoys a solid reputation in this business and receives many orders, especially for ceremonies (marriages, baptisms, holidays, etc.). But her own resources cannot allow her to meet the demand. And so, she's requesting a collaboration with Soro Yiriwaso, with which she is on her fourth individual loan, after having correctly repaid all the preceding ones. She intends to buy five bolts of white damask fabrics, ten bags of caustic soda, and ten containers of dyes of different colors. Supplies are gotten from wholesalers in Bamako for her raw materials (white damask, caustic soda, and dyes). The white damask is put into different colors and then sold, either in cash or credit transactions, to customers composed of women in her area. With this fourth loan, she intends to realize an average monthly profits of 300,000 francs CFA that she'll use essentially for her personal expenses, for helping to cover family expenses by helping her husband, for making loan interest payments, and for bolstering her dye business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy white damask fabrics, caustic soda, and dyes

loans.name: Tania

texts.es:
Tania es socia del Banco Comunal Morenita II.
Tania es conviviente, tiene 33 años y 3 hijos, Tania tiene un puesto en el mercado Magdalena en donde vende carne, actividad que realiza todos los días, los animales los compra en las ferias y los beneficia en el camal.
Tania necesita un préstamo de 750 soles dinero que será invertido como parte de pago de una res.
Los sueños de Tania son implementar su carnecería con una cortadora, moledora y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Tania is a member of the Communal Bank Morenita II. Tania lives with her partner, is 33 years old, and has 3 children. Tania has a stand in the Magdalena Market where she sells meat, an activity that she carries every day. She purchases the animals at regional markets and processes them at the slaughterhouse. Tania needs a loan of 750 PEN, money that will be invested as part of payment for a head of cattle. Tania’s dreams are to furnish her butcher’s shop with a meat cutter and grinder, and that she is able to offer her children a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay part of a payment for a head of cattle.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia T. is starting to worry about how she can stretch their limited income. She has been worrying so much, especially because her three children are studying, and always need support for their allowance, their books, and other school fees. She is 43 years old this year. Her husband, Felixberto T., is a farmer. They both work so hard to make their rice farm a productive business to support their daily needs. 

She is requesting a loan of PHP15,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy 2 sacks of fertilizer and other farming needs. The loan is truly a help, especially for additional capital in her business. She aims to have a rice mill some day for her family.

Now that she receives loans form CEVI, she is able to manage her farm well. Aside from the credit CEVI provides, she enjoys having training and insurance coverage that helps her small business grow.

loans.use: To purchase 2 sacks of fertilizer and other farming needs.

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị

texts.en:
T. Nguyễn Thị (54005119) is a 30-year-old woman living in the town of Ý Yên.  She is married and has two school-aged children.  To make a living, T. owns & operates a business raising livestock.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising cattle for sale.  T. has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 4300000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2005, T. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  T. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15000000 VND from TYM Fund.  This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock.  T. is now requesting a new loan of 20000000 VND, which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies.  The loan will be the fifth loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund.  T. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed & other supplies.

loans.name: Eunice Anyango

texts.en:
Eunice is a 23-year-old mother of one four-month-old girl. She sells vegetables, primarily cabbage and tomatoes, from a small stall in the neighborhood of Nyamasaria. She also sells charcoal, a popular item with her customers. She has been in business for five years, and things are going well. However, there are times when things are difficult. The rainy season in Kisumu lasts from January through May and the rains make it difficult to get in a full day’s work outside. Eunice would like to put a waterproof shelter over her stall so that she can sell even when it’s raining.

Eunice has been married for five years. Her husband is a mechanic in town and helps her to provide for their daughter. She hopes to buy more charcoal with her loan proceeds.

loans.use: To buy charcoal for resale

loans.name: Harry

texts.fr: Harry Diaïté est une femme de 52 ans, elle est veuve et a en charge ses trois enfants. Elle développe une activité de vente d'huile de palme dont elle a une bonne expérience pour l'avoir exercé depuis plus de six ans. Les bénéfices réalisés à partir de son activité lui permettent de prendre en charge la nourriture de ses enfants et d'assurer leur suivi sanitaire.
texts.en:
Harry Diaïté is a 52-year-old woman. She is a widow and has three children to support. She is developing a business selling palm oil. Having run this business for over six years, she has good experience in it. The profits realized from it enable her to provide food for her children and to ensure that their health is monitored.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bolster her self-financing capacity for developing her business selling palm oil

loans.name: Ondina De Los Ángeles

texts.es: La señora Ondina
texts.en: Sra. Ondina

loans.use: Purchase materials for making shoes

loans.name: El Amanecer Group

texts.es:
el Grupo Amanecer se conforma de tres mujeres las cuales son muy trabajadoras, a continuacion se detalla cada una de las actividades que ellas realizan:
FIDELIA AMPARO F. se dedica a la venta de golosinas negocio que lleva a cabo en la caseta del C.E.B. "Juan Lindo" de la aldea de Quebrada Larga, Jamastran; y los fines de semana se dedica a la elaboración de nacatamales y pan.
es casada y su esposo se dedica al transporte de carga, tiene un vehiculo de su legitima propiedad y viaja todos los dias de Quebrada Larga a Danlí y viceversa,  ellos tienen 26 1/2 años de residir en esta aldea.
del matrimonio dependen 2 hijos de los cuales dependen a un 100% de ellos, con los ingresos que le genera su negocio ella apoya a su esposo a cubrir ciertos gastos del hogar, pero cubre todos sus gastos personales y financieros que adquiere.
ANA BERTA H. tiene 2 años de dedicarse a la venta de venenos para la tierra (agro insumos) este tipo de negocio no es comun en la aldea donde ella reside, también se dedica a la venta de 
recargas y targetas para celulares.- vive en union libre y es madre de tres hijos, su compañero de hogar trabaja como motorista de transportes de personas el cual cubre la zona de Santa Maria - Jamastran y viceversa, Ana desidio dedicarse a este tipo de negocio al ver que no habia nadie que vendiera este tipo de productos en dicha zona, con los ingresos que le genera el mismo apoya a su compañero de hogar a cubrir ciertos gastos del hogar, y cubre a un 100% sus gastos personale y fiancieros que ella adquiere.
ELIZABETH R. H. su actividad principal es la venta de charamuscas (topollillos) negocio que lleva a cabo en la caseta del C.E.B. "Juan Lindo" de la aldea de Quebrada Larga, jamastran
y los fines de semana se dedica a la elaboración de pan, y de nacatamales.
ella vive en uniómn libre, y su compañero de hogar trabaja para una fabrica de tabacos de esta ciudad de danlí, las empresas tabacaleras son las de mayor fuentes de empleo en dicha zona.
Doña Elizabeth, es madre de 2 hijos de los cuales dependen de ellos, actualmete se encuentran cursando sus estudios de primaria.
 con los ingresos que le genera el negocio cubre sus gastos personales, las obligaciones financieras que adquiere; y en colabora a su esposo a cubrir ciertos gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
The group "Amanecer" is comprised of three very hardworking women. The details of each of the activities that they perform are described below: Fidelia Amparo F. sells sweets, conducting the business from the booth of C.E.B. "Juan Lindo" in the village of Quebrada Larga, Jamastran. On the weekends she bakes the nacatamales (large steamed tamales) and bread. She is married. Her husband transports freight using a vehicle that he owns, and he travels each day between Quebrada Larga and Danlí. They have resided in this town for 26 1/2 years. They have 2 dependent children, and with the income that she generates from her business she supports her husband and covers certain household expenses; she also covers all of her own personal expenses including the financing that she acquires. Ana Berta H. has had a business selling herbicides (agricultural supplies) for two years. This type of business is not common in the town where she resides. She also sells refills and cards for cellular phones. She lives with a partner and is the mother of three children. Her partner works as a driver, transporting people between the Santa Maria area and Jamastran. Ana decided to undertake this type of business, seeing that there wasn't anyone who was selling these types of products in her area. With the income that she generates, she supports her partner with certain household expenses, and covers 100 percent of her personal expenses including the financing that she acquires. Elizabeth R. H. sells charamuscas (popsicles), conducting the business from the booth of C.E.B. "Juan Lindo" in the village of Quebrada Larga, Jamastran, and on the weekends she bakes bread and nacatamales. She lives with a partner who works in a tobacco factory in the City of Danlí. The tobacco companies are a major source of employment in that area. Elizabeth is the mother of 2 dependent children, who are currently in elementary school. With the income that she generates from her business she covers her personal expenses, the financing that she acquires, and she pitches in with her partner to cover certain household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy soft drinks,cookies, churros,chocolates, corn masa mix, cabbage, sausages, chicken, ground beef, eggs, juice, butter, oil, cell refills, sugar, milk, nances, flour, margarine and Gramoxone

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Even as she approaches senior citizenship, Emma S., a 57-year-old widow is still determined to stay independent and earn her own income. She does not want to rely on her children to support her. Emma lives in the village of Brgy Tagda, Hinigaran Negros Occidental. She has been a widow for 19 years and has raised her six children well.  Now that they are all adults, have their own families, and are gainfully employed, Emma wants to save for her future support so she will not be a burden to her children in her old age.

When she was widowed, the demands of her business and the need to sustain a young family impelled Emma to slowly recover from the grief of losing her husband at such a young age. She continued running her business until the increasing financial needs of the family prompted her to look for an external source of capital. In 2004, Emma became a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon and was able to sustainably increase her income and meet the needs of her household. 

Along with a general store, Emma later invested in a fish vending business in her community, where regular customers come to buy fish. Her general store and fish vending business have a combined average income of PHP 6,000 per month, which is enough to cover her household expenses with some left over for savings so she can stay independent in her old age. 

Emma borrowed PHP 13,000 on a previous loan, and was able to repay it on an installment basis in full and on time without any delays. Since it is the rainy season now, Emma expects sales to be slower than it was earlier this year, so she is requesting to loan the smaller amount of PHP 11,000  right now which she foresees as sufficient additional capital she needs to continue expanding her general store without sacrificing her profitability because of the anticipated slower inventory turnover.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the call of not just a few women but thousands of them. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a meager $1 a day, to creating realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: Additional capital for her general store

loans.name: Rosinah

texts.en:
Rosinah is a 31-year-old married mother of two children living in Machakos, a small market town near Nairobi. She has run the Superstar Salon for the last six years and employs one person. She was previously a vegetable vendor and still earns some extra income through small-scale farming. She is requesting Kes. 30,000 to purchase Abuja braids, a hairdryer, hair relaxer, and shampoo. In the future, she hopes to open two more big salons and become a wholesale supplier of salon supplies. She describes herself as hardworking.

About Faulu Kenya:
Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: To buy braids, shampoo, hair relaxer, and a hair dryer.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en: Rehema T. is a Tanzanian entrepreneur. She runs a business where she sells second hand clothes in the Kitunda district in Dar es Salaam. She purchases the business goods wholesale from Mnazi Mmoja city shopping center and sells it retail to customers. She is married and her three children are in primary school. She has been running the business for three years at Kitunda and the business income is used to meet her family's daily demands. She needs a loan of TZS 800,000 to expand the business further.

loans.use: Expanding the business.

loans.name: Sunday Group

texts.en:
Sunday W. is the leader of a group of five borrowers called the Sunday Group. He is 57 years old, married and has five children, aged between 15 and 35 years old. Their educational levels are between 3rd grade and university student. Sunday and his family live and work in the Westpoint community, close to downtown Monrovia, Liberia.

Sunday has never been to school. He started fishing when he was a child, and has been running a fishing business for 30 years. He fishes in a small canoe on the Atlantic Ocean, and sell to retailers in Westpoint, Monrovia. Sunday talks to his customers well in order to encourage them to continue buying from him. He is requesting a loan to expand his business. He dreams of giving his children a better education and good health.

loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To construct the kind of store from which she can run her business safely

loans.name: Mbalwa Group, Mukono

texts.en:
N. Margaret is the leader of her lending group in Mukono. She is 52 years old and a widow with three children aged 29 to 21 years with only one child still at the university. Margaret also helps to take care of two orphans.

Margaret has had a poultry business in Namugongo for twenty years from which she is able to earn 200,000/= a week as profits. She says that her major challenge is lacking enough feed although her major business trick is being able to feed her chickens well.

Margaret needs a loan to be able to buy more feed for her chickens as well as booking more day old chicks for business expansion. In future, Margaret needs to build rentals for an increased monthly income.

loans.use: To buy feed for her chickens and to book day-old chicks

loans.name: Srey

texts.en:
Mrs. Srey M., 45, and her husband, Mr. Pet Port, 51, have been married since 1978. They have seven children: three sons and four daughters. Three of their children are married and live in separate homes, one works in a garment factory, one is a construction worker, and the other two attend school. The family lives on an island in the Mekong River. Her husband is a farmer.

Srey has been a silk weaver since she was twenty years old. She sells her finished products to a middleman who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. She is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase silk materials for her weaving business. She also will use a part of the loan to help provide capital for her husband’s farming business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her weaving business and capital for her husband's farm

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Numanjanova Tursunoy`s Group

texts.en:
Tursunoy is 53 years old. She is married and has four sons. She also has four grandsons. Her husband is a taxi driver. She lives with her family in Aravan Village. Her family is involved in agriculture. They own land where they usually grow cotton and potatoes. Now, almost every member of her family is preparing for the spring planting. 

She will use this loan to buy potato seeds and mineral fertilizers. She also has some livestock. In the future she wants to increase the number of cattle she owns. So far, because of their business, they were able to raise children, build a house for their eldest son, and build a sheep yard. Her monthly income is about $200 USD. 

Zohrohon, age 51, is married. She is the most respected teacher in the local school. Her husband is a pensioner. His pension is about USD $70. She has 4 sons who work in the village, but because they don't earn much, in a few months, two of them are going to Russia to find better jobs. This loan will be used to buy potato seeds. Her family will plan them in their own land. 

Mukaddam is 41 years old. She is married with children. Her husband is in Kazakhstan, where he works as a builder. Her eldest son is disabled person and younger two are student. Mukaddam works a mailer in the local post office. Her family gets additional income from agriculture. They grow cotton, potatoes, and sunflowers. This loan will be used to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers. 

Nigoroy, age 20 is not yet married. She lives with her parents. She is involved in agriculture and she is going to buy seeds with her loan. Her family also has some cattle, and they sell milk and milk products to the local population. Their total monthly income is about USD $300. 

This loan is the first one for all of the members of this group. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135.

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our lending team, Supporters of Kyrgyzstan, http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva fellows in Kyrgyzstan and the Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To buy potato seeds

loans.name: Richard

texts.en: Richard is a 33 year old man married to a primary school teacher looking after five people in his home stead. He dreams of constructing a modern home for his family. His business interests are butchery and car washing in Fort Portal Uganda.  He has ten years of experience in butchery and four years in car washing. Before doing all that, he was a luggage carrier in Kampala, Uganda’s capital city. He then worked in some one else’s butchery before starting his own using small credit. He believes with more credit from Hofokam he will be able to transform his car washing bay into a modern one.  The  purpose of this loan is to buy cows for his butchery for selling as beef.

loans.use: Cows for selling as beef

loans.name: Sreymom

texts.en:
Mrs. Sreymom S., age 26, and her husband, Mr. Chek Hom, 29, have been married since 2005 and just have a young son. Besides her son, Sreymom also has her sister and grandmother living with her on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Sreymom has been a silk weaver for ten years, a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to a middleman who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh market. Her husband has been a construction contractor for five years. He works in his village and in the nearby districts.

He husband doesn’t have enough materials to operate his business and so it’s difficult for him when he works. Hence Sreymom is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase construction materials for her husband’s business.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials for her husband’s business

loans.name: Phea

texts.en: Phea O. is 32 year old married mother of four who lives in Prey Phnhi village, in Takeo province. She is a vegetable seller and her husband is a construction worker.  They don't earn enough income to support their family.  Phea wants to began a silk weaving business and buy a cow for breeding.  With this loan, she hopes to increase her income to support her family.  One of Phea's children is a construction worker and the other three attend a local school.  Her husband is on the right of the picture.

loans.use: Buy silk and a cow.

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.en:
Bernadette is 44 years-old and married with three children, she lives with her family in the province of Rizal in the Philippines.  Her husband Geronimo operates their tricycle business (motorcycle with a sidecar).   To supply additional income for her family, Bernadette is expanding the family business of Avon dealership which has been in operation for almost ten years.

Bernadette would like to receive a loan of 40,000 PHP to purchase an inventory of Avon products including lotions, lipsticks, bras, underwear, perfumes, cologne and other supplies.  As a dedicated member of Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI), a Kiva microfinance partner in the Philippines, since 1999, Bernadette is thankful for access to capital and loans to support her entrepreneurial dreams.  Bernadette also has been a model member in the branch of Rizal Central Branch demonstrating regular attendance at weekly meetings and steady repayments on previous loans.  

With the support of ASHI and Kiva, she is hopeful that her expanded business will generate steady income to improve her financial stability and her family’s quality of life to bring them far away from the cycle of poverty.  Bernadette hopes to diversify her revenue in the long term by supporting the maintenance of her secondary business endeavors including her husband’s tricycle business. 

Bernadette’s dreams are for her two youngest children to complete college.  Additionally, she hopes to continue business as a sustainable livelihood to support her family.

loans.use: To purchase an inventory of Avon products including lotions, lipsticks, bras, underwear, perfumes, cologne, etc.

loans.name: Geetha

texts.en:
Geetha is a 36-year-old married woman living with her husband and three children in Kekanadura, part of the Matara area of Sri Lanka. She is a hardworking woman and enthusiastic. She has one son and two daughters. Her husband is a jewelry maker.

Geetha and her husband have managed a business of making and selling jewelry for three years. She has requested a 30,000 rupee (LKR) loan from BRAC Sri Lanka for the business.

Geetha is grateful to BRAC Sri Lanka because of the financial support it provides to her. Thank you for taking the time to consider supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: To buy more materials and tools for making jewelry

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a 39-year-old married man who has a one year old child and a seven year old child. He has been selling clothes in an open-air market called Kawangware Market. He has hired one person to assist him in his business. He is an active member of a Faulu Kenya group. He attends the weekly group meetings and pays his dues consistently. 

He is requesting for a loan of KES 20,000 to buy two bales of denim trousers. He is a hard-working and determined man who hopes to own a big boutique in the future.

loans.use: To buy two bales of denim trousers

loans.name: Edison

texts.en:
Edison E. is from the village of Brgy. Escoting, Diadi, Nueva Vizcaya. He is 40 years old. Edison is married and has three school-age children. 

To make a living, Edison owns a business venture which provides motorcycle transportation services. Edison has been engaged in his business for over ten years and earns approximately 4,700 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Edison joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Edison is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to repair his existing vehicle for better service. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Edison from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to contribute to the financial needs of his family.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair his existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Seydou

texts.fr:
Monsieur Seydou S. est un homme marié de 36 ans et sans enfant qui  vit avec sa femme dans le  quartier Hérémakono  Nord de Bougouni.
Suite à la pauvreté de ses parents, il décida d’abandonner l’école et commença les activités génératrices de revenus auprès de son oncle pour apprendre la vente  d’articles divers de boutique.
Avec une expérience de plus 6 ans, Monsieur Seydou S. maitrise son activité et est très sollicité.
Afin de satisfaire sa clientèle en nette croissance, il décida de rejoindre Soro Yiriwaso pour acheter, une importante quantité d’ articles divers pour sa boutique.
Il est à son deuxième prêt avec Soro Yiriwaso et le prêt précédent a été correctement remboursé.
 Il s’approvisionne à Bamako (capitale de la république du Mali) et effectue sa vente à une clientèle diverse et variée.
Avec ce prêt, il compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 38 500 FCFA Avec ce bénéfice il envisage agrandir sa boutique.
texts.en:
Mr. Seydou S. is a married man who is 36 years old and has no children. He lives with his wife in the Hérémakono Nord district of Bougouni. As a result of his parents' poverty, he decided to leave school and set up income-generating activities with his uncle in order to learn how to sell various shop items. With more than six years' experience, Mr. S. now masters his business and is very much in demand. In order to satisfy his customer base which is growing sharply, he decided to join Soro Yiriwaso in order to be able to buy a significant quantity of miscellaneous items for his shop. He is on his second loan with Soro Yiriwaso, and the previous loan was repaid on time. He gets his supplies in Bamako (the capital of the Republic of Mali) and sells to a diverse and varied customer base. With this loan he is expecting to make a monthly profit of 38,500FCFA. With this profit he is planning to expand his shop.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of various items for his shop

loans.name: Vann

texts.en: Mr. Vann S. is a low-income earner living in a rural area of Siem Reap, Cambodia. He operates his own business, buying and selling a variety of vegetables at the market. Additionally, Vann S. and his wife plant a few crops on their own farmland. They have four teenage children, all of whom are no longer in school and currently work at different jobs. In the past, not having his own vehicle, Vann S. always hired a neighbor’s motorcycle to pick up his vegetables to sell at the market. He now hopes to reduce this fee by asking for a loan to purchase a new motorbike. With any remaining cash from the loan, he will grow rice crops.

loans.use: To purchase a new motorbike

loans.name: Santos David

texts.es:
El Sr. Santos García se dedica a la venta de productos escolares y de productos de uso personal, sus condiciones de vida han mejorado y el crecimiento en su negocio es notable.
Tiene seis años de dedicarse a este tipo de negocio.
El señor García es casado y con las ganancias que ha percibido de su negocio a pagado los gastos estudiantiles y manutención de sus 2 hijos, su esposa la señora Ada Luz Zelaya es enfermera y juntos han mejorado sus condiciones de vida.    
Su negocio opera bajo el nombre de “Variedades MELISSA” este luce de una gran variedad de surtido como ser: Papelería (cuaderno de espiral, tarea, dibujo, caligrafía, bong, cartulina, lápices etc.) cremas, desodorantes, regalos para toda ocasión, y venta de ropa nueva y americana.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar mas mercaderia y asi tener mas surtido su negocio.
texts.en:
Santos García sells school products and personal use products. His living conditions have improved, and the growth of his business is notable. He has been devoting himself to this type of business for six years. Mr. García is married. With the income from his business he has supported his two children and paid their educational expenses. His wife, Ada Luz Zelaya, is a nurse. Together they have improved their living conditions. His business operates under the name “Variedades MELISSA”. His business carries a great variety of stock like paper products (spiral notebooks, forms, drawing paper, calligraphy products, cardboard, and pencils, etc.), creams, deodorant, gifts for all occasions, and new and American clothing. He will use the loan to buy more merchandise. That way his business will be better stocked.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy deodorant, shampoo, soap, pencils, papers, markers, erasers, liquid corrector, glue, and tooth paste

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase a toilet for his home.

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
Chan U., 40, is married and resides with her husband and six children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. The area is well-known for Pre-Angkorean Temples. 

U. sells groceries and snacks for an income of  $1 USD per day, and is pictured above at her grocery store. Her husband is a construction worker, earning an income of $2.50 USD per day. U. and her husband are also farmers, and the rice they grow from the field is for feeding their family.

U. is requesting a loan of $600 USD to purchase cows to help plow the rice field. In the future, she would like to repair her house. 

This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy cows to help plow the rice field

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie D. C. is from the village of Landing, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. She is 30 years old, married, and has four school-aged children. To make a living, she makes and sells banana cue (fried bananas coated with carmelized brown sugar) for sale in the community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately $110 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Rosemarie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. 

Rosemarie is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make the products she sells. This will be her 2nd loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make the products she sells

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina G. is from the village of Mabasa, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 35 years old. Cristina is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Cristina owns & operates a transportation business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from providing motorcycle transport to local community members. Cristina has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Cristina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cristina is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Cristina from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair a transport vehicle used in the business

location.town: Mabasa Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: The Truth Group

texts.en:
Meet members of “The Truth” group from Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to apply for a loan of SLL 1,200,000 for each. With the help of this loan they will be able to further expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. 

Anjay A. T. (pictured on the left) is the leader of this group. The forty-five-year-old is married and has six children – three in   primary school and three in secondary school. Anjay sells audio and video CDs, VCDs and DVDs. He has been running this business for many years now. With his share of this loan, Anjay will buy the above-mentioned items wholesale to add to his business inventory.

loans.use: buy goods wholesale for resale

loans.name: Fausta

texts.es: Fausta tiene 47 años, vive con sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace 3 años vende cosméticos de las marcas más reconocidas del mercado, es así que recorre las principales calles de la ciudad en busca de clientela nueva para que sus productos tengan mayor salida y pueda obtener mayores  ganancias. Hoy ve los resultados que tiene y esto es gracias a la constancia que tiene, logrando superar su propio record de ventas. Su forma de venta es dejar a crédito el producto, pero siempre procurando que sean clientes cumplidos con el pago. Con el control estricto que tiene en las cobranzas, puede ver con claridad sus ganancias que le son satisfactorias, es por ello que desea seguir incrementándose de mercadería para que tenga variedad que ofrecer a sus clientes. Es su crédito número 5 que tiene con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas que muy solidarias. Por otro lado agradece a todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de más mercadería en cosméticos y ropa.
texts.en:
Fausta, 47, lives with her two children in her own house.  For the last three years she has sold cosmetics of well known brands in the market.  She wanders the main streets of the city seeking new customers so that her products will sell better and she will earn better profits. Today she sees the results of her efforts and thanks to her dedication she has surpassed her own sales record.

Her sales methodology is leaving items on credit but always making sure that the customers are reliable with respect to repayments.  With the strict control she has on collecting she can clearly see that profits are satisfactory so she wants to continue to increase the merchandise in order to have variety to offer her customers.

This is her 5th loan with MFP and she is happy to know that she can count on financial support.  Besides, she enjoys being part of a communal bank because all the members are very mutually supportive.  On the other hand, she thanks all the people who will fund the loan she is requesting that will be very useful for her business’ success.

She will use the requested funds o buy more cosmetics and clothes.

loans.use: To stock up on clothing and cosmetics to have a variety of products to offer her customers.

loans.name: Nancy Piedad

texts.es:
Nancy Piedad C. P. tiene 21 años. Es casada vive con el esposo y los hijos, vive  en el cantón de Guaranda en la Provincia de Bolívar. No tiene hijos.

Nancy pertenece a la Ventanilla Casaiche Chilipamba ubicada a media hora de Guaranda perteneciente, es un grupo que se dedica a la agricultura y a la ganadería como vacas lecheras y chanchos, esta ventanilla tiene 20 miembros.

Nancy se dedica a la agricultura de maíz, trigo fréjol y papa y a la ganadería cría vacas lecheras, las comprar las realiza en Guaranda y vende en el mercado mayorista de la  misma ciudad.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos para la siembra maíz, trigo fréjol y papa y animales para engordar . Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades de la familia. Su sueño es ponerse comprar casa y carro.

Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Nancy Piedad C. P. is 21 years old.  She is married and lives with her husband.  They live in Guaranda canton, in Bolívar province.  They don't have any children.

Nancy belongs to the Casaiche Chilipamba solidarity group which is located half an hour from Guaranda.  It is a group that works in agriculture and farming livestock such as dairy cows and pigs.  The group has 20 members.

Nancy grows corn, wheat, beans and potato and also raises dairy cows.  He makes his purchases in Guaranda and sells in the wholesale market in the same town.

She is requesting a loan to buy supplies for sowing corn, wheat, beans and potatoes and also animals to fatten and then sell.  The support from the loan will help her to fulfil her family's financial needs.  Her dream is to be able to buy a house and car.

She likes to take part in sports.

loans.use: To buy supplies for sowing corn, wheat, beans and potatoes.  To buy animals to fatten and then sell

loans.name: Freddy Gerardo

texts.es: Freddy Gerardo A. Borbón, tiene la edad de 47 años, está casado, y tiene 3 hijos que son su mayor prioridad. El quiere comprar  maquinas que le faltan para la construcción de viviendas, como son el taladro, maquina de soldadura entre otras. Tiene varios años que él se ha dedicado a la construcción de casas y le va muy bien en su negocio por lo cual quiere invertir en esas nuevas maquinas. Es el primer préstamo que ha recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no tiene problemas con su negocio pero si quiere aumentar las maquinas a su posesión para poder desempeñar trabajos con mayor facilidad, también tiene el deseo de seguir con su pequeño negocio y seguir creciendo con su pequeña constructora a su vez generar más ofertas de trabajo para su ganancia. También el no ha realizados otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más bajas. El  también tiene el deseo de superación, tanto personal como el crecimiento de su pequeña empresa   para poder llegar a generar más ingresos para su bienestar propio y de su familia.
texts.en:
Freddy Gerardo A. Borbón, 47, is married and has three children who are his main priority in life.  He wants to buy some machines, like drills and a welding machine among others, he needs for housing construction.  He has been in the housing construction business for several years and does quite well so he wants to invest in new machinery.

This is his first loan from FUDECOSUR.  He has no problems with his business and wants to increase the number of machines he owns in order to do the jobs more easily.  He also wants his small construction firm to stay in business generating more work offers for profit.

He has had no other loans with state banking institutions.  FUDECOSUR has offered the best terms and the lowest interest rates.

He also hopes for personal growth and for the growth of his small firm so that he can generate more income for his own and his family’s wellbeing.

loans.use: For construction tools.

loans.name: Sao

texts.en:
Sao K. is a 51-year-old man who lives in the province of Kompong Tom. He drives a car taxi between his village and Phnom Penh City every day, and can make a profit of approximately $6.5 per day.  Sao K. has four children, two are single, and the other two are married. 

To generate extra income, Sao K.’s wife has built a pigpen behind their house where she raises many pigs. Because the pig-raising business is a very profitable one for Sao K. and his family, Sao K. has requested a loan for his wife to buy additional feed and piglets to raise for sale during the period when pork is commanding the highest prices. 

Sao K. was not available while taking photo so his wife is pictured instead.

loans.use: To buy feed and piglets

loans.name: Biyinzika Productive Group - Mpigi

texts.en:
Twenty-eight-year-old N. Gorret operates a restaurant business in Kayabwe, Mpigi. She describes herself as progressive and open-minded. Gorret is happily married with 2 kids. 

She has been engaged in this business for the past 4 years and before that, she was working as a bookshop attendant. She says the availability of customers is the underlying reason for her business' growth and why she began it. In a week, she says her profits are to the tune of 30,000 shillings. With this loan, she says she is going to buy more food, beverages, and furniture for her restaurant business.

loans.use: To purchase more food, beverages, and furniture for her restaurant

loans.name: Sebastian

texts.es: Sebastián tiene 31 años, su actividad es una barbería ya que hace más de 2 años que tiene este negocio. El es un hombre muy trabajador y disfruta con este negocio la variedad de de sus clientes, el tiene que levantarse temprano desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde pues afluencia de clientes empieza circular muy temprano por las calles. El motivo de este financiamiento es para la compra de peines, navajas, tijeras, talcos, entre otras herramientas.
texts.en: Sebastian is 31 years old and for over two years has owned a barber shop. He is a very hard-working man and enjoys his business and working with a variety of clients.  He is up and running from 8 in the morning until 6 in the evening, as his clients start coming in very early.
