This loan will be used to purchase combs, razor, scissors, talcum powder and other barbering tools.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: 43 years old M. Stephen has been selling bananas in Kyanyamuromba food market, Ibanda for the past decade. It is a business the happily married father of four says he began with savings from a crude alcohol sells business. Earnings from this business have in a way enabled him to shoulder some of his family's responsibilities, although by and large, he says he still faces long financial odds especially on the issue of expanding his business. He says his wife is always at his beck and call. Monthly he says this business generates him shillings 250,000 and with this loan he says he is going to purchase farm agricultural inputs.

loans.use: The purchase of farm agricultural inputs

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna R. is a widow who lives in Poblacion, Santander, Cebu. She earns her living by operating one business venture: a used clothing business.  Lorna joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2008 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 4 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Lorna has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. 

Her previous loan of PHP 10,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 7200, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 5th loan, she is again borrowing PHP 10,000, which she intends to use to purchase stock of used clothing so that she can continue to save up for the future and the improvement of her business. Lorna R. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF:

 In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase a stock of used clothes to sell

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is a forty-nine year-old woman, married to a police officer  and living in her own house in Fort Portal, Uganda. She longs to drive a car and run a big poultry project. She has been keeping poultry and cattle for two years, and the business is very profitable. Sarah intends to use the credit facility to buy chicks.

loans.use: Buying chicks

loans.name: Aura Del Socorro

texts.es: La Sra. Aura del Socorro  P. ella es trabajadora por cuenta propia en el negocio de Venta de Ropa Usada y productos de la AVON ella vende de casa en casa ya tiene a sus clientes a quienes les entrega la mercadería y el producto tiene dos  años  de dedicarse a esta actividad. Ha tenido  once créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno los ha realizado Para la Compra de Pacas de Ropa  y así   invertirle a su negocio para ampliarlo y mejorar la condición de  su negocio, los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le ha beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esta manera ella ha  mejorado su condición de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en: For two years, Aura del Socorro  P. has been self-employed selling used clothing and Avon products. She sells door-to-door and then delivers the merchandise and products to her customers. She has had eleven loans with CEPRODEL and each one has been used to purchase bulk clothing packets, thereby investing in her business in order to improve the business and see it grow. These loans with CEPRODEL have greatly benefited her since in this way she has improved the quality of life for herself and her family.

loans.use: Purchase bulk packages of American clothing and Avon products.

loans.name: Jenny Roxana

texts.es:
Jenny es una madre de familia de 28 años de edad que reside junto a su  esposo y sus dos hijos en el distrito de Patapo una zona rural dedicada a la producción agrícola y ganadera que se encuentra ubicada al norte del Perú a cuarenta y cinco minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Ella cuenta con una pequeña bodega instalada en su domicilio. Allí ofrecen en venta a los vecinos y clientes de la zona diversos productos de consumo diario, entre productos de primera necesidad, abarrotes, bebidas gaseosas, golosinas y recargas a celulares. El negocio cuenta con muy buena acogida, gracias a la amabilidad  que tiene Jenny con sus clientes. Con esta actividad ella ayuda a su esposo con el sostenimiento económico de su familia.

La creciente demanda que la bodega de Jenny ha venido experimentando ha hecho que ella piense en ampliarla adquiriendo más productos.  Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles.

Jenny es una mujer bastante trabajadora y de muy buen carácter, las personas que le conocen le tienen mucha estima y cariño.
texts.en:
Jenny is a 28 years old mother. She lives with her husband and two children in the Patapo District. It is a rural farming and cattle zone located in the north of Peru, forty five minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

She has a small grocery store in her house and sells various products like groceries, soft drinks, snacks and cell-phone’s re-chargers to neighbors and costumers in her area. The business is well received due to Jenny’s amiability. She provides financial support to her husband and family through this business. 

Jenny would like to expand and buy more products due to the increase in demand from her costumers. This is the reason she is requesting a loan of 500 New Soles from Edpyme Alternativa. 

Jenny is a hard working woman of good character. She is appreciated and loved by people who know her.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her grocery store.

loans.name: Maria De Jesus

texts.es:
María de Jesús A.   tiene  48 Años de edad y   vive en el Municipio San  Jacinto  en el departamento de Bolívar; allí esta dedicada a un pequeño negocio donde  vende víveres y vive con su esposo dedicado a la agricultura y sus  3  hijos en las edades  de 10 a 23  años, todos actualmente estudiando. Maria de Jesús inició su tienda con recursos propios y con créditos a proveedores; María A. es una mujer  que fue desplazada por el conflicto  que tuvo la región de Bolívar hace 8 años, cuando vivía en un corregimiento de  allí y debió trasladarse a San Jacinto para construír su tienda   y ayudar a genera ingresos para educar sus hijos mientras su esposo trabaja en actividades agrícolas. 
Este su credikiva,  es el cuarto financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo con el comprará ranchos, víveres, enlatados, abarrotes para surtirla. Desde que ha recurrido a los financiamientos de la FMSD sus inventarios han mejorado y por eso acude nuevamente para comprar de contado en mayor volumen y obtener descuentos, con lo cual garantiza un mejor precio de venta a sus clientes y también ella podrá mejorar los ingresos familiares cada día más y logrará cosechar nuevos éxitos como su sueño de que sus hijos logren ser profesionales de éxito
texts.en:
Maria de Jesus A. is 48 years old and lives in the town of San Jacinto in the Department of Bolivar. There she has a small business selling groceries. She lives with her husband, who is a farmer, and their three children aged between 10 and 23. All of them are students.

Maria de Jose started her business with her own resources and loans. Maria is one of the women who was displaced because of the conflict the Bolivar area had eight years ago when she lived in one of its towns. She had to move to San Jacinto to be able to open the store and help generate income to educate their children while her husband farms.

This is her fourth loan with ‘Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo’ and she will utilize it to buy canned goods, foods and various groceries. Since she started to obtained loans from FMSD her stock at the store has increased.  This new loan will allow her to buy wholesale, pay in cash and obtain better prices. In turn, she will be able to offer her goods at better prices and day be day increase her income to reach her goals.

loans.use: to stock up on canned goods, foods and groceries.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith N. lives in the Ndeeba neighborhood of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has 4 children, all of whom are in school. Edith owns a beauty salon business. She has been in this business for 8 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Edith sells her products from home, by means of wholesale/retail. 

Edith has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva's partner, MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more boxes of cream relaxers, weaves and braids. She also generates additional income through operating a boda-boda (motorcycle for hire).The main business challenges for Edith include defaulters, seasonality and thieves. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a fully stocked bar and also to build her own house.   Edith lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees, rent and food.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of cream relaxers, weaves and braids for her beauty salon

loans.name: Liduvina

texts.es: Liduvina tiene 35 años. Vive con su pareja y sus 2 hijos en casa de sus padres.Se dedica a la ganadería desde hace 10 años, ella adquiere los animales cuando tiene meses de nacido, aún por desarrollar a un menor precio, entonces se encarga de la alimentación y al cabo de un tiempo cuando ya tiene un peso considerado, es ahí que los vende a un mayor precio en las ferias ganaderas que se presentan en su ciudad. Cuenta con un amplio terreno, espacio suficiente para criar a sus animales. Considera rentable este negocio ya que le permite sostener a su familia e incrementar su capital de trabajo para tener más ganancias, por ello espero que le ayuden a dar un préstamo. Es su crédito número 7 con MFP, se siente muy feliz  de estar en su banco comunal de la que tiene experiencias positivas de trabajo y por la que se compromete una vez más a ser puntual en sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de un toro.
texts.en: Liduvina is 35 years old and she lives with her partner and their 2 children in her parents' home. She has been a cattle farmer for 10 years. She acquires the livestock a few months after they are born to raise them and later sell them at a better price. So she takes care of their feeding and when they have reached a considerable weight she sells them at a better price at the farm fairs that come to the city. She has ample land, enough space to raise her livestock. She considers this business very profitable because she is able to support her family and to increase her working capital. For this reason she hopes to acquire a loan. This is loan number 7 with MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and she is very happy to be part of a communal bank because she has positive work experiences. She is committed once again to be on time with her payments.  With the loan that she requests she will invest in the purchase of a bull.

loans.use: to purchase a bull.

loans.name: Kondo Tchilalo

texts.fr: Agée de 34 ans,  kondo  est mariée et mère de 02 enfants. Depuis 1995 elle   s’est lancée dans la fabrication de boisson locale faite à base de mil et très appréciée  par la population. Elle se boit frais ou à température ambiante. Pour maximiser son profit elle vend aussi du mil et des ignames. Elle s’approvisionne de mil à Anié  une localité située au nord de Lomé  dans la région des plateaux revend après  à domicile. Ce  prêt lui servira à acheter du mil  et des ignames  et augmenter le stock existant.
texts.en: Kondo, aged 34, is a woman who is married and the mother of two. In 1995, she began making a local beverage made of millet that is very popular. People drink it chilled or at room temperature. To maximize her profit, she also sells millet and yams. She gets her supplies of millet in Anié, a town located north of Lomé, the capital of Togo, in the plateau region. She then sells out of her house. This loan will be used to buy some millet and yams and to increase her existing inventory.

loans.use: to buy millet and some firewood for making tchouk

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly is 49 years old and married with nine children. With four children in school, Nelly works very hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell like sugar, groceries, etc. in her sari-sari store.

Nelly has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, noodles, soap, etc. 

In the future Nelly would like to save money to expand her business and send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en:
Florencia, 52, is married with six children and lives in Linconan, Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. She is a farmer and grows corn to earn a living, which she has been doing for five years. She has requested a loan to buy additional fertilizer for her rice field.

Florencia has been member of PMPC for two years. In the future, she hopes that she can financially support the needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for her rice field.

loans.name: Elvia

texts.es: Elvia tiene 34 años habita en la localidad de San Pedro de Cajas. Ahí formó su familia junto a su esposo, Ambos tienen 6 menores hijos a los que quieren mucho y cuidan en su casa propia. El trabajo constante le enseñó a ser una persona optimista y luchadora. A pesar de las constantes dificultades que tiene, siempre mantiene el ánimo para salir adelante. El trabajo al que se dedica es la artesanía, elaborando prendas de vestir a base de lana de diferentes colores y texturas. Su secreto es elaborar las prendas de forma manual, así inyecta su propio esfuerzo y sentimiento a lo que realiza. Además cuenta que la elaboración de mantas es su especialidad, ya que lo comercializa por intermediarios a la ciudad de Cerro de Pasco, donde por ser zona frígida tiene mucha demanda del producto. Al mes Elvia realiza de 4 a 5 frazadas de las cuales obtiene buenas ganancias. Asimismo se dedica a la siembra de papa por temporada, solo una vez al año, extrayendo un producto lleno de vitaminas y con un excelente sabor, debido a que la tierra reposa durante un tiempo antes de ser sembrado. Pero su principal deseo es mejorar la calidad de sus tejidos. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Mujeres al futuro” y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde espera de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos. Además agradece a su banco comunal por confiar en ella, razón por lo que se compromete a pagar puntual sus cuotas. Elvia de recibir su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de lana, madejas y varios hilos de colores para continuar con la confección de prendas artesanales.
texts.en:
Elvia is 34 years old and lives in the town of San Pedro de Cajas. She started a family there together with her husband. They have six minor children that they love very much and care for in their own home. Constant work taught her to be an optimistic person and a fighter.

Despite the constant difficulties that she has, she always maintains her spirit to get ahead. The work she makes her living at is artisan crafts, making wool garments in different colors and textures. Her secret is to make the garments by hand and that way she brings her own effort and feelings into what she does.

She also mentions that her specialty is making blankets. She sells them through intermediaries in the city of Corre de Pasco where there is a lot of demand for the product because it is a cold area. Elvia makes between 4 and 5 blankets per month from which she makes a good profit.

Additionally she plants potatoes seasonally, just once per year. The result is a product full of vitamins and excellent flavor due to the fact that the land lies fallow for a time before being planted. But her main desire is to improve the quality of her weavings.

She belongs to the “Mujeres al Futuro” community bank and this is her first loan with MFP where she awaits your collaboration to be able to press on with her goals. She also thanks the community bank for having confidence in her, which is why she is committing to being punctual with her repayments. Upon receiving the support, Elvia will invest the money requested into the purchase of wool, skeins of yarn and several colors of thread to continue to make artisanal items.

loans.use: to buy wool and different colored thread.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane, who is a married mother of three children, started her retail shop and bar business three years ago and she earns 300,000 Uganda shillings per week as profits. The 35-year-old lady explains that she gathered her capital from selling agriculture produce, the activity she still carries on. Her children are between 4 and 10 years of age, and this hardworking lady is happy to say that she has been able to send all her children to school.

Jane has a dream of expanding her business and having a family of self-reliance in terms of finances. With the Kiva loan, she plans to buy things like sugar, soap, salt, beans and posho (made from cassava) to increase her stock to meet all the demands of her customers

loans.use: To buy things like sugar, soap, salt, beans and posho (made from cassava) to increase the stock.

loans.name: Marleni

texts.es: Marleni, de 28 años, vive en su casa propia en compañía de su esposo Eduardo y de su pequeño hijo Luis. En armonía familiar ellos viven en el caserío de Cumutay (sierra peruana). Desde muy joven se dedica a la agricultura, aprendió las técnicas del cultivo ayudando en la labor a sus padres, luego cuando formo su propia familia empezó a trabajar junto a su esposo. Dice que la labor de campo es muy sacrificada, pues siembra papa y alverja en sus chacras propias, y debe vigilar sus cultivos todos los días, desde muy temprano, para cuidarlos de las plagas y las inclemencias del tiempo que muchas veces afectan y atacan sus cultivos. Ahora se encuentra sola en esta labor, ya que su esposo comenzó a trabajar como peón en la fabricación de una hidroeléctrica. Lo que le disgusta es cargar los pesados sacos de sus productos naturales, para llevarlos a comercializar hasta los mercados de la ciudad. Y como es una mujer emprendedora para más adelante tiene planeado aumentar su producción, además quiere comprar ganado vacuno para criarlo y luego venderlo a mayor precio. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Lindo amanecer de cumutay” y este es el noveno crédito con MFP, donde promete ser puntual y responsable en el pago de sus cuotas, además esta muy agradecida con todas las personas que hicieron posible el crédito. Marleni de recibir su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de una bolsa de semilla de alverja para su próxima siembra.
texts.en:
Marleni, 28, lives in her own house with her husband, Eduardo, and their little boy, Luis, in familial harmony in the hamlet of Cumutay (Peruvian highlands).  Since a very young age she’s been farming.  She learned farming techniques helping her parents with their farm chores.  Then, when she formed her own family she started working alongside her husband.  She says that work in the fields is very demanding for she grows potatoes and peas on her own land and must watch over her plants daily from very early on to keep them safe from infestations and weather extremes which often affect and attach her crops.  

She’s currently doing all the work herself because her husband started working as a laborer building a hydroelectric plant.  What she dislikes is carrying the heavy sacks of her natural products to take them to market in the city.  Since she’s an enterprising woman, however, she’s planning to increase production later on and also wants to buy cattle to raise for subsequent sale at a higher price.

She’s a member of the “Lindo Amanecer de Cumutay” (Beautiful Cumutay Daybreak) communal bank and this is the 9th MFP loan.  She pledges to be very punctual with her installment payments and is also very grateful to all the people who made the loan possible.  

If Marleni were to receive your support, she will invest the requested money in the purchase of a sack of pea seeds for her next planting.

loans.use: to buy a sack pea seeds.

loans.name: Angeline

texts.en:
Angeline is 27 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single and has 2 children. 

Angeline makes and sells snacks like rice & pancakes. She has had this business for 5 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients for making snacks.

Angeline is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Angeline hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making snacks.

loans.name: Rovshan

texts.ru: Rovshan rodilsya v 1982 qodu. On jenat i imeyet 3 detey. Rovshan vmeste so svoyey drujelubnoy semyoy jivet v Baku regione. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit balki i kulenku dlya svoyego parnika. Uje 7 let kak Rovshan zanimayetsya selskim xozaystvom. Etomu biznessu on nauchilsya u svoyego otca.
texts.en: Rovshan was born in 1982.  He is married and has three children.  Rovshan and his friendly family live in the Baku region.  Currently, he needs 2000 AZN in order to buy beams and plastic for his greenhouse.  Rovshan has been involved in agriculture for seven years.  He learned this business from his father.

loans.use: to buy plastic and beams for a greenhouse

loans.name: Kazem

texts.en:
K. is from Iraq. He is 30 years old, married and has four children.

K. has owned an entertainment store since 2008. He has all kinds of video games. He has a deep understanding of local customers and a good reputation, and he is well known in his area. His store is situated in a crowded area so a number of potential customers pass by.

He decided to apply for a $1,500 loan in order to renovate and change the decorations in his store. He is aiming to gain more profits in order to provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: to renovate and change the decorations in his store.

loans.name: Sadridin

texts.ru: Садридин житель города Вахдат. Ему 52 года. Он женат. У него двое детей. Его жена занимается домашним хозяйством. Сам Садридин имеет средне - специальное образование, шафер. По специальности работает 15 лет. Кроме того он занимается разведением крупнорогатого скота. Разводит скот у себя дома. Этим видом деятельности он занимается восемь лет. Кредит берет для закупа несколько голов бычков.
texts.en: Sadridin lives in the town of Vahdat. He is 52 years old. He is married, with two children. His wife is a homemaker. Sadridin has received a secondary technical education; he is a driver. He has been working in his profession for 15 years. In addition, he raises cattle by his home. He has been doing this for eight years. He is taking out a loan in order to buy several heads of cattle.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 29 years old and is married and blessed with two children. To earn a living, she sells cigarettes.  She started her business one year ago and employs one person to assist her.  Previously, she ran a cafeteria.  

Grace is requesting a 10,000 KES loan to add to her stock of cigarettes.  She dreams of expanding to a wholesale business.

loans.use: to purchase cigarettes

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: El señor Juan es artesano en cerrajería y su esposa es tejedora. Con el dinero del crédito adquirirá material de trabajo como fierros y metales para elaborar productos artesanales que vende en las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto. Vive en alquiler en una casa ubicada en la zona de Ballivián de la ciudad de El Alto; es casado y tiene un hijo. Es la primera vez que el cliente solicita un crédito. Sus deseos de mantener su negocio y proveer a su familia son encomiables y por  esta razón es que su solicitud es enviada a los financiadotes de Kiva.
texts.en: Juan is a metal craftsman and his wife’s a weaver.  With the money from the loan he will acquire work supplies like iron and metals to make the crafts he sells in various markets in the city of El Alto.  He lives in a rented house in the Ballivián sector of the city of El Alto; he’s married and has a son.  This is the first time the client has requested a loan.  His desire to maintain his business and provide for his family is commendable and this is why his request is sent on to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy iron and metals for his metal crafts.

loans.name: Kasele

texts.en:
Kasele is 47 years old and married to Kimotho. Together they have four children who are 22, 18, 16 and 14 years old. She operates a green grocery and has been in the business for the past three years. She earns a monthly income of KES 5,000 from the business.

This is her second loan from KADET LTD. She paid her previous loan successfully. She will use the loan to purchase cabbages, green maize and vegetables for stock in the business.

She will use the anticipated profit to pay school fees for her children. Her dream is to see her children through education to the university level.

loans.use: to buy more cabbages, green maize, and vegetables

loans.name: Lily

texts.en:
Lily is 38, married, and blessed with one child. Her husband is a tricycle driver, which transports passengers. Her husband's daily earnings are used for their daily expenditures. Lily and her husband have planted rice in the Philippines for four years. She earns an income of approximately PHP 50,000 from her her two hectare farm. Her earnings are invested back into the farmland in order to have additional areas to plant.
 
Lily has gone abroad and worked as a domestic helper for four years. She works abroad because of their financial difficulties. She comes back to the Philippines when she has enough earnings that can serve as her capital for her farming business. Still, her earnings are not enough. Therefore, Lily is asking for a loan of PHP 50,000 to purchase seeds, fertilizers, insecticides, and pay for labor. She is looking forward to having a successful farming business.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, insecticides and pay for labor

loans.name: Apolonio

texts.es:
El señor Apolonio tiene su carpintería, pero el trabajo era espontaneo, hacia un trabajo y lo entregaba y recibía un pago, como muchos de estos oficios de trabajos. 
Don Apolonio decido empezar a elaborar muebles y venderlos en abonos, donde la gente adquiera el producto y van pagando en abonos pequeños, y así ayudar a la gente y a su economía. Solicita el préstamo para comprar medra, clavos, pintura y pegamentos y empezar hacer los muebles ya que tienen varios pedidos y entregarlos a tiempo, para iniciar la venta. 
Con la ayuda de su esposa y una de sus hijas van a iniciar una pequeña mueblería, para tener mas ingreso a la familia.
texts.en:
Apolonio has a carpentry shop but work was sporadic.  He’d do a job, deliver it and get paid like lots of these types of jobs.  He decided, therefore, to start manufacturing furniture and sell it in installments so that people could acquire the product and pay for it in small payments.  This way he could help people and his own economy.  

He’s asking for the loan to buy lumber, nails, paint and glue to start making the furniture since he already has several pending orders and he wants to deliver them in time to start his sales.  With help from his wife and one of his daughters they are going to start a small furniture store to have more family income.

loans.use: to buy lumber.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 30-year-old Lebanese married man. He lives with his wife and only one child. They really depend on him especially because of the heavy costs of life. 

Ali opened his own bakery in 2008 and he’s looking forward to further grow the business. For this reason, he’s requesting, today, a loan of $1600 from kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase the needed raw materials for his bakery such as sugar, flour and many other products. He notes that this kiva loan will help him to earn a superior income. In the future, he plans to collect money and to enlarge his bakery to be able to receive more customers.

loans.use: to purchase the needed raw materials for his bakery such as sugar, flour and many other products.

loans.name: Ajorgnon Group

texts.fr: Le groupe AJORGNON est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. C'est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante  du groupe, du nom de Gilberte est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Gilberte est âgée de 35 ans et vit au Bénin. Gilberte a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire. Gilberte est mariée à un agent de banque du nom de Jules. Le couple a trois enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Gilberte vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Afin d'assurer les diverses charges de la famille, Gilberte vend depuis une dizaine d’années, des tissus et des chaussures par le système de distribution. Gilberte s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin et au Togo. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Gilberte sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe AJORGNON, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits précédents ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The group AJORGNON consists of three members who live in the same neighborhood. This is the group’s third time seeking financial support from ALIDé to bolster their activities. The representative of the group is Gilberte, seen with her hand raised in the photo. Gilberte is 35 years old and lives in Benin. She ended her studies in primary school. Gilberte is married to a bank clerk named Jules and they have three dependent children who all attend school. Gilberte lives with her husband and their children, and the couple handle together the various household responsibilities. 

In order to help provide for her family, Gilberte has been selling fabrics and shoes through the distribution system for the past ten years. She buys her stock at a market in Benin, and also in Togo. 

Eager to achieve customer satisfaction and to increase her sales and revenue, Gilberte is seeking a third loan from ALIDé together with the other group members. All previous loans were correctly repaid.

loans.use: to buy bales of fabrics and shoes for resale.

loans.name: Enrique

texts.es:
Enrique, de 50 años, es un hombre muy sincero y trabajador, vive en su casa propia solo. Desde hace algunos meses se separó de quien fue su esposa por muchos años y con quien tuvo tres hijos de los cuales dos ya son mayores e independiente y solo la menor de 17 años depende de él para poder continuar con sus estudios y por quien trabaja día a día para darle una mejor calidad de vida. El trabajo que realiza Enrique es uno de sus múltiples oficios que realizó en toda su vida, ahora se dedica al trabajo de la albañilería y es muy solicitado por sus vecinos, pues ha demostrado tener mucha experiencia en su zona. Trabaja con la cantidad de personas que requiere, dependiendo de la magnitud del trabajo. Le está yendo bien en lo que hace ya que a parte de tener éste trabajo, también se dedica a manejar su mototaxi que le da una entrada adicional a su economía. Disfruta mucho de trabajar en la construcción, sabe que con esta digna profesión pudo brindar educación y buena calidad de vida a su familia, lleva 12 años realizando esta profesión y considera que lo más difícil de su trabajo es cargar los pesados ladrillos y tener que manejar el cemento hasta con las manos, lo que ha hecho que sus manos envejezcan rápidamente. Ahora desea renovar sus herramientas para mejorar el trabajo que hace, además de remodelar algunas piezas que necesita para su vehiculo. Este será crédito número 12 con MFP, esta muy emocionado de saber que le darán un respaldo económico para continuar con sus planes. Y por ello noo quiere dejar de pagar sus cuotas y es por eso que se compromete en ser muy puntual y sobre todo responsable. Esta muy contento se continuar con este grupo ya que son muy cumplidos y amables.
Con el monto solicitado 3000 soles, comprará materiales para continuar con su trabajo como maderas y listones, además de algunas herramientas y piezas para cambiar a los que están defectuosas de su mototaxi.
texts.en:
Enrique, 50 years old and a very sincere and hard worker, lives alone in his own house. Some months ago, he separated from his former wife after many years of marriage. They have 3 children, of whom 2 are now adult and independent, and only the remaining 1, a minor aged 17, is still dependent upon his father for support in his studies. It is for the sake of this child that Enrique works day after day, to offer him a better quality of life.

Enrique works at one of the multiple trades he has performed in his life; he is a brick mason and much in demand by his neighbors, because he is well known and experienced in his zone. He works with the number of helpers he requires, depending on the size of the job. Things are going well for him in this business. And he also operates his moto-taxi which offers an additional income.

Enrique enjoys a great deal working in construction. He understands that in this worthy profession he can provide education and a good standard of living for his family. Enrique has done this for 12 years and he considers the most difficult task transporting heavy blocks and having to mix cement with his own hands. This has caused his hands to age rapidly.

Enrique wants to replace his old tools in order to improve his work, and to buy replacement parts for his moto-taxi. This will be his 12th loan through MFP and he is very moved to know that we will provide economic backing so that he can continue with his plans. That's why Enrique will not fail in his payments; he promises to be punctual in paying and, above all, responsible.  He is very content to continue with his group which is very reliable and friendly.

With the solicited 3,000 new sols, Enrique will purchase materials to continue his work, especially  lumber and wood lath,  as well as parts to replace defective ones on his moto-taxi.

loans.use: buy tools and lumber, plus replacement parts for his moto-taxi.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothing for eventual resale.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a 46-year-old married man with four children ranging from five to 27 years old. For the past 20 years, Peter has operated a farm where he grows tea to sell. His business is located in an area with many customers. Peter's biggest business challenge is high transport fees. He describes himself as aggressive. 

Peter is requesting a 20,000 KES loan to pay school fees. His business goal is to become a large-scale farmer within five years. This is Peter's first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to pay school fees

loans.name: Aida

texts.en: Aida is 47 years old, married entrepreneur from Alegria, Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur with four children. She earns an income from her transport service business. She started it almost two years ago and she earns 4,000 PHP a month net. To improve her business, she is borrowing 35,000 PHP from GDMPC micro credit, which she just joined in 2011 to obtain accessories and tires. Before long, she’s hopeful of the possibility of expanding her business.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts and tires.

loans.name: Josiane

texts.en:
Josiane G., about 50 years old, is the mother of six children and guardian for two others, the children of her deceased aunt. She is in business selling bath soap (Lagossidi). This soap is made in Nigeria and Ghana, and everybody appreciates this fact, since the soap is good for the skin and inexpensive too. Her husband, a substitute teacher in a local private school, has not been able to provide for the family given his meager and sporadic salary. So, over 75% of household expenses is resting on Josiane herself. Using an initial loan of $400, which was repaid regularly, she managed to grow her business a little. To do more would require more substantial funding.

Mrs. G., lacking the funds, must get her stock of soap from retailers who ultimately leave her with only a small profit margin. So, she is requesting financial support in the amount of $950 as capital to create a significant inventory of soap and to act as a wholesaler.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer.

Agée de 50 ans environ, Madame G. Josiane est mère de six (06) enfants et a à sa charge deux (02) enfants de sa tante décédée. Elle a comme activité la vente du savon de toilette (Lagossidi). C’est un savon fabriqué au Nigeria et au Ghana que tout le monde apprécie car c’est très bon pour la peau et économique. Son mari, un enseignant vacataire dans une école privée de la place, n’arrive pas à subvenir aux besoins de la famille avec son maigre salaire et encore très irrégulier. Ainsi, plus de 75% des charges du foyer reposent-t-elles sur la femme. Avec un premier crédit de $400 obtenu et régulièrement remboursé, Josiane est arrivée à augmenter légèrement ses activités qui nécessitent aujourd’hui un financement assez consistant.

N’ayant pas de moyens, Madame G. Josiane s’approvisionne chez les revendeurs ce qui lui laisse pas une marge bénéficiaire conséquente. Aussi, sollicite-t-elle un appui financier de $950 qui va lui servir de fonds de commerce pour faire un stock consistant de savon et agir comme une grossiste.

loans.use: Buying and stocking soap in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her mobile phone and accessories dealership

loans.name: Francisco

texts.en:
Francisco is 44 years old, married, and has 3 children. His specialty is the repair of the electric parts of all types of vehicles. He has owned his own repair shop for more than 15 years. Francisco has a lot of experience in this, which he obtained in practice by working in car repair workshops. In reality, he teaches, and several technical highschool students have done internships in his garage.

Francisco believes that, like other technical professions, he too needs to keep his knowledge up to date because every day new technology is developed for cars, and he has to be prepared to satisfy inquiries and needs of the customers.

He wants to add to his business the sale of car batteries, and for this he needs the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

Francisco tiene 44 años, es casado y tiene 3 hijos. Su especialidad es la reparación de la parte eléctrica de todo tipo de vehículos. El posee su propio taller hace ya más de 15 años. Francisco tiene mucha experiencia en este oficio y gran parte de la misma la adquirio en forma práctica en los talleres donde fue empleado. Actualmente es un capacitador, ya que varios alumnos bachilleres técnicos han hecho pasantías en su taller.

Francisco, también cree que como otros oficios técnicos, también el de él requiere estar actualizado ya que día a día surgen novedades en cuanto al funcionamiento de los automóviles y uno tiene que estar preparado para satisfacer las consultas y necesidades de los clientes.

Tiene previsto incorporar en su negocio, la venta de baterías para automóviles y para esto necesitaría un crédito.

loans.use: To purchase car batteries to sell

loans.name: Anabela

texts.pt:
Anabela is married with 3 children. She joined FDM in November of 2006. With an initial loan of approx. 400 dollars, she purchased products for her grocery store. Her business grew, and she started helping her husband purchasing agricultural supplies and practicing horticulture. She asks for a three-month loan of 1,175 dollars to invest in groceries, increasing her stock.

Translated from Portuguese by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Casada, mae de 3 filhos, entrou para o programa em Novembro de 2006, com um emprestimo de 10.000mts, para a compra de produtos para a mercearia, foi desenvolvendo e comecou a ajudar o seu marido na compra de insumos para agricultura,produzindo horticolas. pretende tomar a 06/08/07, 30.000mts, num prazo de 3 meses, para investir na mercearia, aumentando o seu stock.

loans.use: To purchase groceries

loans.name: Jumsiti

texts.en: Jumsiti is 45 years old and lives with her only son. Her husband passed away and now she is working on her own. She has a small shop and sells some foods and household goods.  She usually earns $5.50 per day and it's just enough for her daily needs. She requests a $100 loan to expand her business. Jumsiti is a member of MBK, and as a result, her business does increasingly well. She projects that she can earn $33 per day. She is willing to repay this loan within the loan period.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Ujunwa

texts.en: C. Ujunwa is 46 years old; she is a widow and a mother of 4 who comes from Mebamu, a semi rural area in Lagos State, Nigeria. She has been with LAPO as a client for the past 5 years. She sells drinks and pure water. She needs the loan of $625 to buy more drinks, recharge cards, and pure water for sale.

loans.use: To buy drinks, cards, and bags of pure water

loans.name: Masitula

texts.en: Masitula is 30 years old, married with 2 of her own children and she cares for 4 orphans. She is in the poultry business and has 350 chickens. Her chickens are layers, so she gets a little less than one egg per day per chicken. She will sell them wholesale in trays of 36 eggs to a tray and each tray will be sold for about 3,000 schillings or about $1.75US per tray. Therefore, if you do the math, she will get about 9 trays per day x $1.75 per tray and you see she will gross about $15.00US per day. Out of that she will have to take into account the cost of the chickens, the feed, etc. But this is a very good business if you have enough room for a lot of chickens, and on a small plot of land 350 chickens are a lot of chickens. You also have to construct a well ventilated room with a roof for the chickens. But in a country where the average annual income is about $1,085.US, this can be a good business. With her loan, Masitula will buy more chicken feed for her chickens.

loans.use: Masitula plans to use her loan to buy chicken feed for her layers.

loans.name: Thi Bay

texts.vi:
Mrs. Bẩy, 41 years old, sells seasonal fruits. Everyday she buys fruits by riding a moped scooter to the wholesale place. If she is busy she can make a call and fruits will be delivered. While she sells fruits at the near by market, her husband tends a bicycle repair shop and her children are at school. She can borrow money from Binh Minh to buy fruits without credit and she also can have a long term loan.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Bẩy, 41 tuổi, đi chợ bán hoa quả. Mùa nào chị bán hoa quả đấy. Mỗi ngày một lần, chi đi lấy hàng bằng xe máy. Nếu bận chị có thể gọi điện sẽ có người mang hàng đến tận nơi. Chị thường bán ở chợ gần nhà, chồng chị mở cửa hàng sửa xe máy, các con chị còn đang đi học. Chị vay vốn để mua thêm hàng về bán, vay trả góp, chị sẽ không còn lo lắng phải trả nhiều tiền khi đến hạn, đặc biệt chị được vay vốn lâu dài không cần phải thế chấp khi có nhu cầu.

loans.use: Buy fruits

loans.name: Musilimot

texts.en: Musilimot O. is 50 years old; she is married with 4 children and hails from Lagos State. She sells kerosene. She has been in business since 1997. She needs the loan amount of $450 to buy more kerosene for sale.

loans.use: To buy more kerosene for sale

loans.name: Norma Leticia

texts.en:
I, Mrs. Norma Leticia, have been selling used and new clothing for more than 2 years. This business is the source of income for my family. I operate this business from my home, so that I do not neglect my three children. Now I need more merchandise, especially new merchandise to sell because my clients are asking for certain styles of clothing. I am seeking a loan of $1200 to buy new better quality merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Jenny Dean, Kiva Volunteer.

L. Sra. Norma Leticia tiene ya más D. 2 años con su negocio D. venta D. ropa usada y nueva. Este negocio es L. fuente D. ingresos D. mi familia. El negocio lo tengo fuera D. mi casa esto es para no descuidar a mis tres hijos que tengo. Pero me esta haciendo falta mas mercancía y nueva para vender ya que mis clientas me están pidiendo ciertos modelos D. ropa. Solicito un préstamo D. $1,200 Dlls Para L. comprar D. mercancía nueva y D. mejor calidad.

loans.use: To Buy New Merchandise for My Business

loans.name: I Nengah Sedra

texts.id:
I Nengah Sedra is a diligent and tenacious farmer, who strives to meet his family’s needs. His wife does not work, and thus, he carries the burden alone through his farming income to meet his family’s needs. I Nengah Sedra works on a 1-hectare farm owned by his parents. His family’s daily expense is quite expensive especially since his children are still in school. His harvests are sometimes not maximized because his cultivation method and seeds are not the best. Better farming equipment, seeds and supporting materials require a larger capital, which he didn’t have. I Nengah Sedra is relieved that DINARI is helping him get a loan he needs to improve his farming. This loan will be used to buy superior seeds, organic fertilizers and pesticides. I Nengah Sedra rents a tractor to till his farm because he doesn’t have an ox to do the job. I Nengah Sedra is waiting for his next harvest, which he hopes to yield better results from his previous harvests. He will use his farming income to support his children’s educational needs, and if there is still some money left, he really hopes to fix his unfinished house.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Joan, Kiva volunteer.

I Nengah Sedra seorang petani yang sangat rajin dan ulet, semua dilakukan supaya ekonomi keluarga bisa tercukupi. Apalagi istrinya tidak mempunyai penghasilan tambahan sebagai pendukung keuangan keluarga. I Nengah Sedra hanya mengandalkan penghasilan dari pertanian untuk mencukupi kebutuhan keluarga. Sawah yang dikerjakan seluas 1 hektar dan itu pun masih menjadi milik orang tuanya. Biaya yang dikeluarkan setiap hari cukup besar apalagi anak-anaknya masih duduk dibangku sekolah. Sedangkan dari hasil panen yang diperoleh tidaklah maksimal karena dalam pengolahan tanah maupun pembibitan dan pemeliharaan tidak bisa dilakukan dengan maksimal,ini semua karena terbentur dengan modal. Tetapi sekarang I Nengah Sedra sudah merasa lega karena adanya pinjaman dari Yayasan Dinari untuk menunjang usahanya dibidang pertanian. Modal tersebut dipergunakan untuk membeli bibit unggul,pupuk organik dan juga obat pestisida. Pengolahan tanah dilakukan dengan menyewa traktor, karena I Nengah Sedra tidak mempunyai sapi untuk membajak. Kini I Nengah Sedra sedang menunggu panen tiba, ia sangat berharap panen kali ini berhasil dan mendapat keuntungan yang meningkat dari panen sebelumnya. Keuntungan ini nantinya akan dipergunakan untuk menunjang pendidikan anak-anaknya dan apabila ada sisa I Nengah Sedra ingin sekali bisa memperbaiki rumahnya yang belum selesai dibangun.

loans.use: To buy quality seeds, fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Von Kev Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Von K. is 58-years-old and the mother of two children, both of whom are employed in a garment factory. Her husband, Mr. Man Nut, is a farmer.

Mrs. Von K. is the group leader of four in Prey Taing Thnong Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is a farmer and sells cakes to her fellow villagers. Mrs. Von K. sells her cakes on credit to her customers and thus does not have a strong cash flow. She would like to start a new business selling cheese and is requesting a loan to purchase cheese for resale.

loans.use: To purchase cheese for resale

loans.name: Yevgeniya

texts.en:
Yevgeniya is married with two teenage sons. She and her family live in Kamenka, where Yevgeniya runs her own venture selling household items in the local market. She has been in this business for 10 years. Yevgeniya currently has invested about $8,000 in the business, and her net profit is about $1,400 each month.

Yevgeniya has been a client with Hope Intl-Nadiya Ukraine since its founding in the mid-1990s. She has proven to be a stable and trustworthy client. Yevgeniya has started the reconstruction of a facility that will serve as a store after it’s finished. The store will give her a serious advantage over other outdoor market vendors. Yevgeniya is hoping to use the current loan to help her finish this reconstruction project and expand her business as a result.

(Note: this is a short term “express” loan that will be paid back in one month.)

loans.use: To finish reconstruction of her store

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.es:
Rosalia is 77 years old. She doesn’t have an education and speaks only Aymará (an Andean native language). She is married and has six children, five of whom have their own families. She owns her own home, which is located in Chimbo center in the Yunguyo district and province. For 50 years, Rosalia has raised the cows and pigs that her husband buys in various fairs and which he also sells in the Chacachaca and Yunguyo fairs.

Rosalia is a member of the Central Progreso Community Bank where she had an initial loan of 300 soles (about $105). She invested the loan money in the purchase of a calf. With this loan of 2,500 soles (about $900), which will be paid back in 4 months, Rosalia plans to purchase two small bulls. The bulls later will be sold for profit. As a member of the Community Bank, Rosalia has learned to make payments on time and support the bank. Her biggest dream is for her children to have good jobs. She also would like to buy a few more cows.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson

Rosalia tiene 77 años D. edad , no tiene estudios y habla solo el aymará, está casada, tiene seis hijos D. los cuales cinco ya tienen familia, la casa donD. vive es propia y se ubica en el centro poblado D. Chimbo, del distrito y provincia D. Yunguyo. La actividad a la que se dedica es la crianza D. vacas y chancho, que su esposo compra en las diferentes ferias, los cuales también venD. en las ferias D. Chacachaca y Yunguyo, se dedica ha esta actividad desD. hace 50 años atrás

Es socia del Banco Comunal " Central Progreso" donD. tuvo un crédito inicial D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles el cual invirtió en la compra D. una ternera. Con este préstamo D. S/. 2,500.00 nuevos soles, el cual será cancelado en 4 meses, comprará dos toretes pequeños, los cuales serán vendidos para generar ganancias. Al pertenecer al Banco Comunal ella aprendió a ser puntual y solidaria. Su sueño mas granD. que tiene es que sus hijos tengan un buen trabajo y a ella le gustaría comprarse unos cuantas vacas mas.

loans.use: Purchase of livestock (calf)

loans.name: Celestina Juana

texts.es:
Celestina is a member of Confianza Communal Bank.

Celestina lives with her boyfriend, she is 27 years old and mother of 3 children, Celestina has a stand in the market Vivanco which is located in the center of the city of Ayacucho, where sells chickens, eggs, and other products. Celestina obtains the product from business that stop by her stand. Celestina has been doing this for about two years. Celestina works every day of the week from the 7 in the morning to 3 in the afternoon.

Celestina needs a loan of 1000 soles, money that will be invested in the purchasing more eggs and chickens.

Celestina’s dreams are to have a bigger business, with various stands, and to proviD. her children with a good education.

Translated from Spanish by AntonelL. Sacconi, Kiva Volunteer

Celestina es socia del Banco Comunal Confianza.

Celestina es conviviente, tiene 27 años y 3 hijos, Celestina tiene un puesto en el mercado Vivanco que se ubica en el centro D. L. ciudad D. Ayacucho, en donD. venD. pollo, embutidos y huevos, los cuales son adquiridos D. empresas que le traen a su puesto, actividad que realiza hace dos años, Celestina venD. todos los días D. L. semana desD. las 7 D. L. mañana hasta las 3 D. L. tarD..

Celestina necesita un préstamo D. 1000 soles, dinero que será invertido en L. compra D. embutidos, huevo y pollo.

Los sueños D. Celestina son tener un negocio mas amplio, con sucursales y que sus hijos estudien en colegios particulares.

loans.use: Celestina needs a loan of 1000 soles, money that will be invested in the purchasing more  eggs and chickens

loans.name: Saret

texts.en:
Mr. Saret C., 34, and his wife, Mrs. Seam Put, 34, who live about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 2006 and have no children.

Mr. Saret and his wife have been farming for two years. They grow vegetables for selling to the middle man in the village. Currently, the couple is expanding their farm but lacks the money. Therefore, he is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase a net to sheathe plants from the sun, seeds, fertilizer, and pay the fee for renting one plot of land to plant vegetables.

loans.use: To purchase a net to sheathe plants from the sun, seeds, fertilizer, and pay the fee for renting one plot of land to do farming.

loans.name: Guillermina Ignacia

texts.es:
Inició su pequeño negocio solicitando permiso a la directora del colegio para la apertura de un Kiosco escolar, donde le oferta a los estudiante, golosinas variadas, helado, gaseosa, frutas, enchiladas etc. Ella trabaja de 8:00 a.m. a 5:00p.m ya que atiende los dos turnos,  los productos refrigerados los lleva en termos para mantener su temperatura, ya que ella manifiesta que con el próximo crédito, poder comprar una refrigeradora y de esta manera almacenar mayor cantidad de productos.
Ella vive dedicada a su negocio, puesto que no tiene hijos y solo la administra con su compañero. Su mayor propósito es tener una pulpería en su casa, la cual dice que solo lo lograria con la ayuda que ADIM le pueda brindar.
texts.en:
She started her business asking for permission from the school principal to open a school kiosk where she could sell candy, ice cream, sodas, fruits, enchiladas and more to the student body. She works from 8:00 am to 5:00 pm since she works two shifts. She takes her refrigerated products in thermos to maintain their temperature. With this loan, she will purchase a refrigerator in order to store these products. She is very dedicated to her business since she has no children and manages it with her partner. Her main goal is to own a small store based out of her home, and says she will be able to do so with the help that ADIM can provide her.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Hidaya

texts.en:
Jambo (Greetings) from Tanzania! This is 42-year-old Hidaya B. from Dar es Salaam. She is married with three children, aged from 13 to 23 years old. Since 2007, Hidaya has been running a shop that sells traditional clothing worn by Tanzanian women, called kanga and vitenge. The kanga is a piece of printed cotton fabric often with a border along all four sides. It is printed using the silkscreen method with its pattern in frames. Kitenge (the Swahili plural is vitenge) is a cotton fabric with wax print, printed by using rotary printing machines. Kitenge is a communicating textile - the various colors, patterns, writings and symbols represent moods, feelings, cultures, and traditions of native African people.

She is requesting a loan of $250 in order to purchase additional inventory at bulk prices in order to expand her business. She thanks you in advance for supporting her!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional material in bulk in order to expand her business

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Nanay Letty came from a very poor family in which she experienced having nothing to eat, as well as eating ground corn instead of rice, and bamboo shoots as their main dish. Nanay Letty does not want to experience again what she experienced before, and that’s why she works very hard to give her best for the family and to change the level of their means of living. 

She is a positive thinker who strives very hard for the education of her children, so that they can find stable jobs and move out of poverty.

Nanay Letty dreams of owning a fishing boat with a motor engine, but because of a lack of financial support, she cannot get it. That  is why she is asking people who are concerned to provide capital to finance this business. ASHI is a great help to her in developing her skills in dealing with other people, not only in their community. She wants to do what is best for her family, and that is why she performs very well.

loans.use: Fishing

loans.name: Jossie Ada

texts.es:
La señorita Jossie es socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Unidas al Triunfo” del distrito, provincia y departamento de Puno. Tiene 21 años de edad, es soltera y espera un hijo. 
Con el primer préstamo de S/.300 compró abarrotes para venderlos en su puesto de trabajo en el mercado central. Tiene casi 2 años trabajando con el banco comunal.
Con este préstamo de S/.700, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará más abarrotes para ofrecerlos en su puesto de trabajo en el mercado central.
Jossie desea continuar trabajando para mantener a su hijo que viene en camino.
texts.en:
Jossie is a member of the “Mujeres Unidas al Triunfo” Communal Bank located in the district, province and state of Puno. She is 21 years old, single, and pregnant. With the first loan for S/.300 she bought groceries to sell in her stand in the central market. She has been working with the communal bank for almost 2 years. With this loan for S/.700, which will be repaid in 4 payments, she will buy more groceries to sell in her stand in the central market. Jossie wishes to continue working to support her child who will soon be born.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy groceries to sell in her stand in the market

loans.name: Mercy

texts.fr: Mercy D. est une jeune femme de 31 ans, mariée et mère de 2 enfants. Coiffeuse de profession, Mercy exerce cette activité depuis bientôt 3 ans à Lomé, la capitale du Togo. Avec ce crédit, elle espère rendre plus professionnelle son activité et gagner plus la confiance de sa clientèle en achetant un séchoir et des mèches destinées à la reve
texts.en:
Mercy D. is a young 31-year-old woman; she is married and the mother of two children. Mercy has been a professional hairstylist for almost three years in Lomé, the capital of Togo. She wants to use this loan to give her business a more professional look and gain the confidence of her customers by buying a dryer and hair extensions for resale.

Translated from French by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a hair dryer and beauty products for resale.

loans.name: Augustina

texts.en: Augustina M. sells groceries like biscuits, canned products and other items at Domamudo, near Elmina. Augustina has received junior high education.  She is married and has 2 children. Her husband is a carpenter. Augustina started selling groceries like biscuits, canned products and other items not too long ago. She has no financial responsibilities since her husband takes care of all the financial expenses of the family. Her loan will be used to buy more groceries to meet the increase in demand from her costumers. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save towards the expansion of the her trade.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to meet the increase in demand by her costumers.

loans.name: Basilia

texts.es: Basilia tiene 36 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos en su propia casa. Se dedica al cuidado de  su establo para vender la leche de sus vacas, lo viene haciendo desde hace 10 años. Se levanta muy temprano para cortar el pasto que será el alimento de sus animales, por las mañanas sale a vender la leche que ordeña, hasta 60 litros por día, la que vende a una empresa procesadora de productos lácteos, con esta actividad Basilia puede solventar los gastos de sus hijos.  Pero también hay riesgos, como por ejemplo que sus vacas se enfermen por el clima tan frío que están atravesando actualmente en su zona, por lo que está tomando las medidas de precaución cuidando que su establo este bien protegido del frío. Para el fututo le gustaría ampliar el espacio donde cría a sus vacas, para incrementar la cantidad de estas y con ello producir más leche. Es la tercera vez que  Basilia tiene un préstamo con MFP, es una de las integrantes más dinámicas que promueve la unidad y sobre todo disfruta del trabajo en equipo con su grupo. Con el dinero que está solicitando comprará una vaca de raza para mejorar su producción. La vaca está valorizada en 3000 soles.
texts.en:
Basilia is 36 years old and lives with her husband and their three children in their own house. She tends to her barn and sells her cows' milk, and has been doing so for 10 years. She wakes up very early to cut the grass to feed her animals. During the morning she goes out to sell the milk she's collected, up to 60 liters per day. She sells it to a company that processes milk products, which covers her children's expenses. There are risks, however; for example, her cows get sick with the type of cold weather they're experiencing in their area right now. Because of this, she is taking precautionary measures to protect her barn from the cold. In the future, she would like to expand the space where she raises her cows to increase their number and produce more milk. This is her third loan from MFP. She is one of their most dynamic members, promoting unity and above all enjoying working with her group. With this loan, she will buy a breeding cow to improve her production, which costs 3000 soles.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a good breed of cow

loans.name: Sesilia

texts.en:
Sesilia T., 49, is married with five children. She has two years of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the general public and villagers four days per week. She has had a previous loan with Kiva's partner SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 450 Tala (about $187).

SPBD loans are Sesilia’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her loan will be used to purchase farming equipment, sacks of fertilizers and chemicals for the plantation.

loans.use: Purchase of a plant sprayer, chemicals, fertilizer and knives

loans.name: Chaguani

texts.en:
Chaguani has been a clothes, juice and bites seller in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for 20 years. She belongs to the Tujidhatiti group loan (Group code 2091). She currently earns an average monthly profit of $125. Each day, she works at her business for 8 hours.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more food items (like juice, wheat flour, cooking oil, and sugar) and clothes for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business and save money for future use.

Chaguani is 42 years old, married, and has four children: ages 23, 18, 17 and 12. She also cares for one additional dependant.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and food items like juice, cooking oil, wheat flour and sugar for her business.

loans.name: Yolita

texts.es:
YOLITA P. I., pertenece al Banco Comunal “MUJRES SHIPIBAS” vive en Jr Bellavista, en la ciudad de Pucallpa, tiene 58 años de edad, 3 hijos, y su pareja es jubilado (recibe pensión del estado).

Se inició en el negocio de venta de pescado, con el primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, compró una balanza y pescado para vender, cuenta con clientes frecuentes.
 
Hoy, ella ha progresado con su familia y el negocio de la  venta de pescado es rentable ya que en la Región contamos con 120 diferentes tipos de pescado.
Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará pescados en variedad y sobre todo frescos.

“Me encanta lo que hago, cuento con clientes muy amables y todo lo que compro para vender lo vendo.  Si no fuese por aquel primer préstamo que me dió Manuela Ramos, hoy seguro que estaría en mi casa aburrida o quizás enferma, por ello doy gracias al apoyo que da Manuela.
texts.en:
Yolita P. I. belongs to the community bank “Mujeres Shipabas,” lives on Jr Bellavista, in the city of Pucallpa, and is 58 years old. Her partner is retired and receives a state pension.

She began a business in fish sales. With her first loan of S/ 300.00 Nuevos Soles, she bought a scale and fish to sell. She has frequent clients.

Today, she has made progress in her family, and the fish business is profitable. Already, the region has 120 different types of fish.

With this loan of S/2,000.00 Nuevos Soles, she will buy fish in different varieties and, above all, fresh.

“I love what I do. I have friendly customers and everything I buy, I sell. If it weren’t for the first loan that Manuela Ramos gave me, today I would surely be in my house, bored and maybe sick. For this I give thanks for the support Manuela gives.”

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fish in bulk

loans.name: Masuda

texts.ru: Бобочонова Масуда кредитор Фонда, которая занимается продажей канцелярских товаров. Её точка реализации  находится на рынке Худжанда. Свои кредиты она использует на расширение своего бизнеса. Она закупает школьные товары, тетради, ручки, пеналы и т.д . Следующий займ она хочет потратить на завоз общих тетрадей и школьных альбомов.
texts.en:
Masuda B. is a client who works selling school supplies. Her sales booth is at the Khudjand market. She uses loans to expand the business. She buys school supplies, notebooks, pens, pencil cases, etc. The next loan will be used to supply writing and sketch books.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: School supply sales

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora E. is from the village of Cabunga-an, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 58 years old. Leonora is widowed and has one grown child. To make a living, Leonora owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector, operating a "sari-sari" or general store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap, and toothpaste in the local community. Leonora has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Leonora joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services. She wanted to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Leonora is requesting a loan in the amount of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Leonora from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and obtain working capital

loans.name: Gulshod

texts.en:
On her own initiative, when Gulshod was 23 she learned how to make national dresses using a sewing machine. This activity has made it possible for her to contribute to her family's income and satisfactorily meet the most urgent needs of her two small children. Every item of dresses Gulshod produces is superior, and due to this, her orders have markedly increased. She has some very large orders so that many times it would be impossible to fulfill them if she didn't have an assistant. Her incredible energy, fortitude, and commitment to her clients drive her to offer them new and improved service. To this end, Gulshod wants to speed up her dress production by purchasing fabrics. To accomplish her objective, she is asking for a 4000 Somoni loan to buy new modern fabrics. With your help, you can make her dream come true. Gulshod thanks you for your generous contribution.    


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing new fabrics for sewing national dresses.

loans.name: Dionita

texts.en:
“To see is to believe,” is Dionita’s favorite quotation in life. She is not the type of woman who is easily convinced until she has seen something proven. Dionita is already 42 years old and she is married to a tricycle driver named Teodoro S.. They have four children--two are still studying while the other two are already working as apprentices near their hometown. Dionita still dreams that her two eldest children will pursue their education in college. She is proud that her children also sacrifice to help reach their goals.

Dionita has always wanted to help her children but because she belongs to an indigent family their living conditions sometimes make this harder. She is glad that her husband is earning an income from driving a boundary basis motorcycle in their village. For 15 years, the business has served as their source of daily income. Dionita wants to help her husband meet their financial needs, especially for the maintenance of the motorcycle he uses in transporting passengers. She is requesting a loan of 6,000 PHP from Kiva. She hopes that Kiva will help them with their business to increase their income.

loans.use: Motorcycle maintenance

loans.name: Ayawa

texts.fr: Cette dame exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de pagnes, elle a commencé ce commerce depuis trois ans, ce commerce est très rentable à Lomé, ce commerce connaît  un essor remarquable au grand marché de Lomé où elle s’approvisionne. Elle dispose d’une grande clientèle. Son stock actuel a baissé, voulant se réapprovisionner elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 20 pièces de pagnes de grande qualité. Elle est mariée et a un enfant.
texts.en:
To generate income, this woman sells pagnes (lengths of printed fabric). She began this business 3 years ago. This business is very profitable in Lomé. This business is booming in the large market in Lomé where she gets her supplies. She has a large clientele. Her current stock has decreased. Wanting to restock, she is requesting a loan from WAGES to purchase 20 high quality pagnes. She is married and has one child.

Translated from French by Heather Nicholson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase pagnes (lengths of printed fabric)

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes D. is married and has two children. She has received schooling through senior high. Her husband is a trader.

Agnes sells maize at the central market in Hohoe, which he has done since 1998. Agnes uses her income in providing food and clothes for the children.

Agnes will use the loan to purchase other staples like beans, millet and groundnuts (peanuts) to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Agnes plans to reinvest.

loans.use: To purchase other staples to sell like beans, millet and groundnuts

loans.name: Maria Natividad

texts.es:
María  Natividad V. es socia del Banco Comunal Si Se Puede vive en el  sector de Yanuncay en la ciudad de Cuenca, tiene 51 años edad, es divorciada hace 20 años, tiene 2 hijas de 29 y 20 años de edad, la primera ya es casada y vive independiente de ella, la segunda de sus hijas está estudiando en la universidad de Cuenca la carrera de Derecho, ella vive en una casa arrendada y su hija soltera es la que le hace compañía.

Es empleada privada (camarera) en el Hotel Tomebamba, mientras que los sábados, domingos y feriados trabaja vendiendo salchipapas y hotdogs en su domicilio, y cuando la venta esta buena da gracias a Dios porque con eso se ayuda para el pago de el agua y la luz.

Este es su cuarto préstamo, pertenece a un gran grupo ya que entre todas son muy solidarias y se llevan muy bien, el préstamo que adquirió lo va a invertir en la compra de mesas, sillas y materia prima para  en ampliar su negocio

Los sueños que tiene es ver a su hija ser una profesional y que tenga un postgrado en otro país.
texts.en:
Maria Natividad V. is a member of the Community Bank "Si Se Puede". She lives in the Yanuncay district of the city of Cuenca. She is 51 years old and she is divorced now for 20 years. She has 2 children, 29 and 20 years old. The eldest is already married and is independent, but the youngest is attending the university in Cuenca, studing law. She lives in a rented house with her youngest daughter.

She is on the cleaning staff of Hotel Tomembaba, but on Saturdays, Sundays and on holidays she sells salchipapas (a regional specialty of sausages and potatoes) as well as hotdogs from her home. And when she has had good sales she thanks God because this is how she is able to pay for the water and hydro bills.

This is her fourth loan. She is part of a large group that help each other and do very well in consequence. The loan will be destined to invest in the purchase of tables and chairs, as well as ingredients to expand her business.

Her dreams are to see her daughter have a career and that she do graduate work in another country.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand her business purchasing ingredients, tables and chairs.

loans.name: Idis Sonay

texts.es:
la sra. idis tiene 30 años de edad, es casada, tiene 2 hijos de los cuales 1 estudia. Idis por la mañana da clases en una escuela de san lorenzo donde labora como docente y por la tarde prepara el producto que va ha vender al negocio que tiene con su esposo desde hace 02 años.
antes se dedicaba a vender ropa para damas, caballeros y niños.
dentro de los productos que vende la sra. tenemos: tacos,enchiladas,tajaditas, palomitas de maiz,sopas,churros,refrescos naturales y de botellas;cabe mensionar que la sra. H. tiene una buena clientela y sus productos son de buena calidad y tiene un mercado bastante competente en la zona. su sueño es que sus ventas crescan cada dia mas.

loans.use: compra de refrescos, carnes de res, cerdo y pollo, mariscos, hielo.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Regina is thirty – nine years old. She is married and has given birth to four children, all in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a town called Dormaa in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana. Dormaa is a commercial and farming town. Regina is a trader. She trades in ready-made textiles. She buys her goods from Sunyani. She hawks to sell in her community and also treks to nearby communities to sell. Regina has been in business for four years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk.

loans.use: To buy ready-made textiles

loans.name: Francis' Group

texts.en:
Francis N. is the leader of her group in Kyaliwajjala. She is a hard working and married lady with four children all in primary school and she also takes care of one dependent. 

Francis has a retail shop and a bar in Kyaliwajjala that has been running since 1995.  She is grateful that the loans have helped her business to succeed through increased recapitalization. In a week, Francis can make 60,000/= as profit which helps her expand her business further. 

During the day, she is mostly into shop-keeping and in the evening, customers come in to have a bottle of beer or two. Hence she makes a double income every day. Francis works so hard to ensure that she has an educated family. 

With her loan Francis hopes to boost her bar business by buying more chairs for her customers to sit on.

loans.use: Buy chairs for patrons and expand business.

loans.name: Mrs. Mot Chum Village Bank Group

texts.en: Thirteen people all living in Angk village in Kandal province make up the village bank loan. Mrs. Mot C. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members, and they all will use the loan for different purposes. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land used to cultivate rice to earn a living. On this plantation she has an obstacle in that she does not have enough money to cultivate rice, and thus she decided to ask for a loan. Her husband, Mr. Tith Sary, is a laborer who has been hired by a villager to work on his farm. Mrs. Mot C. is 41 years old and the mother of five children who are all enrolled in the local school.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy rice seeds for rice cultivation

loans.name: Abel

texts.es:
Abel A. B. es un señor de 52 años de edad que vive con su esposa y sus tres hijos en una comunidad llamada Cimarrón de Santa Teresita de Turrialba, Provincia de Cartago.  Es una pequeña comunidad rural de aproximadamente dos mil habitantes. Sus pobladores se dedican a la producción de leche y la agricultura. Tiene un relieve irregular y mucho del terreno se mantiene como bosque tropical húmedo. Cimarrón se localiza aproximadamente a hora y media en bus de Turrialba, el centro de comercio más cercano.
