Sin embargo, varias veces al año el camino se vuelve intransitable por las lluvias.

Don Abel se dedica a la producción de leche y en estos momentos desea obtener un microcrédito por ¢500.000(quinientos mil colones) para comprar una vaca lechera más y así aumentar la producción. El sabe que contar con una vaca más es un mayor sacrificio y demandará más trabajo pero dice que si quiere sacar su familia adelante tiene que esforzarse en producir más.

Él ordeña en un local que acondicionó para tal fin y dice que por día logra producir aproximadamente 80 litros de leche y con una vaca más su producción aumentaría a 100 litros diarios por lo cual esta muy emocionado de poder ver como su negocio crece y se fortalece.

Don Abel es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Nuevas Esperanzas para Cimarrón, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su segundo préstamo y con él espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico además de participar activamente en la organización de crédito en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Abel A. B., 52, lives with his wife and their three children in a community called Cimarrón de Santa Teresita de Turrialba in the Cartago province. It is a small, rural community with approximately 2,000 inhabitants. The population works in milk production and farming. The landscape is irregular, and much of the land is humid tropical rain forest. Cimarrón is located approximately one and a half hours by bus from Turrialba, the closest commercial center. However, several times a year the road becomes impassable because of the rains. Abel is a milk producer. At this time he wishes to get a loan for ¢500.000 (five hundred thousand colones) to buy one more dairy cow to increase production. He knows that having another cow is a big sacrifice, and that it will demand more work. He says that if he wants to get his family ahead, he needs to make the effort to produce more. He does his work in a place equipped to milk. He says that he produces approximately 80 liters of milk a day. With an additional cow his production would increase to 100 liters daily. That is why he is very excited to be able to see how his business grows and gets stronger. Abel is a member of the Empresa de Crédito Comunal Nuevas Esperanzas para Cimarrón (the New Hope for Cimmarón Communal Bank), one of the 100 member organizations of Edesa in Costa Rica. This will be his second loan. With the loan he hopes to continue growing on a personal and economic level. He will also actively participate in the credit organization in his community.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Vida

texts.en:
Vida A. sells ready-made clothing for both boys and girls in Jukwa near Abura. Vida has received a commercial education (business studies, such as economics). She is single and has two children. Vida has been selling clothing for the past ten years. She is responsible for the payment of school fees and utility bills.

Her loan will be used to buy more clothes to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to invest in her children’s education.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy more dresses for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy and sell jewels, colored sticky labels and medals

loans.name: Hel

texts.en:
Mr. Hel P., age 48, and his wife, Mrs. Kolayan Phork, age 40 and shown with him in the photo, have been married since 1990 and have three children: one son, who is assisting his parents in their farming business, and two daughters who are attending school. The family lives approximately fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Hel and his wife are farmers; they grow rice and cucumbers on their farmland in the village. The couple hopes to increase the volume of their products, so Hel is asking for his first loan of $800 to pay plowing fees and to buy fertilizer and pesticide to use on his farm.

loans.use: To pay plowing fees and to buy fertilizer and pesticide

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion P., 54, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. Married to Bernard Pasalbon, she is blessed with six children. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn in their family business so that their family can have a better life. They have been selling dried fish for several years.  Her business lets her earn a profit of PHP 4,500 per month.

Concepcion has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than three years now. She regularly attends the weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow nine times from CCT’s cooperative. She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to buy added fish stock for her business.

Now, with your help, Concepcion would like to apply for a PHP 16,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital for her expanding business by buying more dried fish to sell. She dreams that her family will someday have better living conditions through the help of her expanding business.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of fifteen to thirty community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To buy more dried fish to sell

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica B. is from the village of Upper Lamac Oroquieta City. She is 26 years old. Veronica is married and has one infant child. To make a living, Veronica owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and selling anthurium flowers. Veronica has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Veronica joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Veronica is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizer. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Veronica from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Jose Elias

texts.es:
José T. de 40 años, vive en una zona urbana en el Suburbio de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento solo cuenta con luz y agua como servicio básico. Su esposa vende cosméticos con ella tiene 3 hijos de 8, 10, 12 años.

Inicio vendiendo pan en una bicicleta en casi todo Guayaquil, después de un largo tiempo compro los hornos.

Ahora el trabaja desde las 06h00 hasta las 20h00 todos los días, el tiene una producción de 600 panes diarios, el alquila un local cerca de su casa. Una de las dificultades que ha tenido es la delincuencia que hay en el sector.  

Con el préstamo quiere comprar harina, levadura, leche para su negocio. En el futuro quiere tener un local propio para la panadería.
texts.en:
Forty-year-old José T. lives in an urban area of el Suburbio de Guayaquil. His house is made of concrete and the only utilities he has are electricity and running water. His wife sells cosmetics. They have 3 children ages 8, 10, and 12.

He started out selling bread on a bicycle throughout most of Guayaquil. After a while, he purchased ovens.

He now works from 6:00 am until 8:00 pm every day. He produces 600 loaves of bread daily in a business space that he rents out near his house. One of the problems he faces is that he works in a crime-ridden area.

With this loan, he would like to purchase flour, yeast, and milk for his business. In the future, he would like to have his own bakery.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase flour, yeast, and milk

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma P. is from the village of Palao, Iligan City. She is 61 years old. Norma is married and has 3 adult children. Norma owns & operates a  sari-sari (variety) shop where she sells food & daily-use products. Norma has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Norma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Norma is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Norma from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon V. is a 48-year-old woman living in the town of Brgy Canonoy, Hinigaran, Negros Occidental.  She is married and has 5 school-aged children.  To make a living, Corazon owns & operates a fishing business.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from harvesting & selling ocean-caught fish in the local community.  Corazon has been engaged in this business for over 20 years and earns approximately 10,000 Php a month from these activities.

In 2005, Corazon joined NWTF to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Corazon has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 Php from NWTF. Corazon is now requesting a new loan of 15,000 Php which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell.  This will be the 8th loan taken out by the borrower from NWTF.  Corazon plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to pay the tuition fees of her children.

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon."

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Raisa

texts.en:
Raisa is married with no children. She owns a retail business that sells construction materials. It is a family business where she works with her husband. They started this business six years ago. 

The demand for construction materials has been high. However,  there has been a number of challenging business situations: licensing, competition, clients buying and not paying for the materials. Raisa did not give up. Together with her husband, Raisa was able to overcome difficulties and continue in business. She is very creative and always happy.

Raisa would like to borrow 17,000 UAH to purchase more inventories. She hopes to satisfy the high demand and increase her sales.

loans.use: To purchase more stock

loans.name: Celsa

texts.en:
Celsa B. is from the village of Sagrada, Tambulig, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 55 years old. Celsa is married and has 2 adult children. She is pictured at her house. Celsa buys and sells vegetables like cabbage, eggplant, string beans, etc. in the local community. Celsa has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) a month from it.

In 2008, Celsa joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business. Celsa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Celsa is requesting her fifth loan, for 10,000 PHP, which will be used to expand the business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

location.town: Sagrada Familia, Tambulig, Zamboanga del sur

loans.name: Rafaela

texts.es:
Rafaela es productora lechera y tiene una Tienda, es su principal fuente de ingreso con  que cubre la manutención de su familia. La señora está separada de su esposo. Su domicilio esta ubicado en la comunidad de Jahuirlaca – Achacachi Prov. Omasuyos a 2 horas y media de la ciudad de El Alto.
 
El préstamo lo destinará para la compra de una vaca lechera para  incrementar su producción de leche.
 
Es primer crédito con Impro y el análisis socio-económico muestra que es sujeto de crédito.
texts.en:
Rafaela is a milk producer and manages a store as her main sources of income to support her family. She is separated from her spouse. Her home is located in the community of Jahuirlaca – Achacachi in Omasuyos Province, which is 2½ hours away from the city of El Alto.

This loan will be used to buy a dairy cow so that she can increase her milk production. Rafaela is requesting her first loan from IMPRO. The socio-economic analysis indicates she is eligible for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a dairy cow to increase her milk production

loans.name: Othelia

texts.en:
Othelia D. is from the town of Banga. She is 38 years old. Othelia is married and has 3 school-age children. To make a living, Othelia owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Othelia has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

Othelia joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Othelia is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure and other farming materials. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Othelia from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children and supplement her family's income. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and other farming materials

loans.name: Fulvia Beatríz

texts.es:
La Sra Fulvia Beatriz Benitez D. Leguizamon tiene 41 años D. edad, es casada, tiene 2 hijos, ambos mayores que cuentan con sus respectivos ingresos.
DesD. hace 5 años atrás empezó con el negocio D. venta D. artículos D. primera necesidad, luego fue ampliando el rubro comercializando también bebidas y por ultimo con la adquisición D. una fotocopiadora realiza fotocopias para los colegios D. sus alrededores. 
Con el crédito, la cliente aumentará su stock D. mercaderías esperando vender a mas clientes, ella invertra en la compra D. productos D. limpieza en general, panificados, embutidos, articulos D. libreria.
La Sra Fulvia agradece por el apoyo brindado y considera el préstamo como una oportunidad para el desarrollo D. su micro empresa.
texts.en:
Fulvia Beatriz Benitez D. Leguizamon is 41, married, and has 2 children, both of whom are grown and have their own income. Five years ago she started her business selling basic necessities, and later she expanded to sell drinks as well, and finally she acquired a photocopier and she now also makes photocopies for the surrounding schools. With this loan, she will expand her stock of merchandise in the hopes of selling to more customers. She will invest in the purchase of general cleaning products, baked goods, sausages and paper supplies. Fulvia is grateful for the support offered, and considers this loan to be an opportunity for the development of her micro enterprise.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: the purchase of general cleaning products, baked goods, sausages and paper supplies

loans.name: Roda

texts.en:
Roda B. is currently in the business of selling bread, groundnut products, and tomatoes. She is requesting a loan to stock onions and cooking oil to sell. Roda is 22 years old and is single. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up a house for rent.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock onions and cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Freddy

texts.es: Freddy C. G., tiene la edad de 51 años, está casado, y tiene un hijo de 17 años de edad, es su mayor prioridad. El crédito lo quiere para asistir su finca, específicamente para el cultivo de café, la idea es comprar el abono y el fertilizante. Desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al cultivo de café para lograr una mejor calidad y para obtener el mayor ingreso posible cuando sea tiempo de cosecha. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Don Freddy también trabaja desde hace varios años en la agricultura. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor.
texts.en:
Freddy C. G. is 51 years old; he is married and has a 17 year old son who is his main priority. The loan will be used to help his ranch, specifically his coffee crops by buying manure and fertilizer. He wishes to give his coffee crops the adequate care needed to have better quality products and in that way have better earnings when it is harvest time. This will be his first loan with FUDECOSUR and is very happy with their help. Don Freddy has worked in agriculture some years. In the future he hopes to give his family a better quality of life and more economic stability and to keep growing in his personal and professional life.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For  his coffee crops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For corn, cheese, firewood, sugar.

loans.name: Heang

texts.en: Heang S., 36, is married and lives with her husband and three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for Pre-Angkorean Temples. She sells sweet potatoes for an income of USD 2 per day. Her husband is a farmer and a traditional musician, earning an income of USD 2 per day.  S. is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase cows to help plough the rice field. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. S.'s husband appears in the photograph because S. was not available.

loans.use: To buy cows to help plough the field.

loans.name: Jovelene

texts.en:
Jovelene B. is from the village of Poblacion 3, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 23 years old and is married with one infant child. Jovelene owns and operates a business providing tricycle transport services. She has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month. In 2010, Jovelene joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Jovelene is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to repair her vehicle in order to provide better service. This loan will be her second from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small-business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair her vehicle in order to provide better service

loans.name: Kosar's Group

texts.en:
Kosar is a resident of a city called Vehari, in Pakistan, a city famous for its agriculture. She owns a two-room brick house and has been living in it with her family for over fifteen years.

Kosar is a very simple and kind-hearted lady. She prefers to stay at home handling household chores and taking care of her family. She not only takes care of her family’s needs but also supports her husband financially by handling sewing work at home. She sews clothes for her neighbors on a regular basis and charges them between 100 and 150 PKRs. She sews the clothes with perfect measurements and, due to her neatly sewed dresses, her customers come to her again and again to give her orders. She utilizes her earning in paying the utilities.

Kosar’s husband’s name is M. Y. and he is involved in a business selling seeds and fertilizer. His clientele base consists of farmers and, as he lives in an agricultural city, his work is considered best for earning good money. He usually receives good orders from his customers and, due to his timely fulfillment of orders, has obtained a good reputation with them.

Kosar has applied for a loan from Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, her husband will buy seeds and fertilizer in bulk which will enable him to maintain his reputation with his customers by fulfilling their orders on time.

In the photo, Kosar is the lady who is raising her hand.

loans.use: To enable her husband to buy seeds and fertilizer in bulk

loans.name: Gayane

texts.en: Gayane H. is a widow with two children. She opened a music disc and computer accessorie shop in 2007. Gayane purchases the goods from both local and international suppliers. Gayane’s son helps his mother run the business, her daughter is a student. Gayane is eager to be competitive on the market and meet her clients’ demand. She has applied for the loan to purchase new inventory.

loans.use: purchasing new inventory

loans.name: Akuvi

texts.fr: Akuvi est âgée de 31 ans,elle est célibataire. Elle a appris la coiffure.  Pour accroître son revenu elle s’est lancée dans la vente de produits cosmétiques. Elle a une expérience de 5 ans dans ce qu’elle fait. Elle veut mettre tous les atouts de son côté pour pouvoir satisfaire sa clientèle en fin d’année, elle sollicite donc de WAGES un crédit pour l’achat de shampoing, mèches, produits cosmétiques et autres accessoires.
texts.en: Akuvi is 31 years old. She is married is single. She is a learned hairdresser. In order to increase her income she started selling cosmetic products. She has five years of experience in this business. She wants to do her base in order to be able to meet her customers’ needs at the end of the year. Thus she is seeking a loan from WAGES in order to purchase shampoo, hair extension, cosmetic products and accessories.  .

loans.use: Purchasing cosmetic products

loans.name: Abu

texts.en:
Pictured here is Abu J.. The forty-two-year-old was born in Rogbureh village; he has nine children, seven of whom are attending primary and secondary schools. His wife is petty trader. 

Abu has been a businessman for twenty-two years now. He is seeking a loan of SLL 3,000,000 for the first time from SMT/Kiva lenders in order to further expand his business. He sells used clothes. With the help of this loan, he will be able to buy bales of used clothes to add to his business inventory.

loans.use: Buy bales of used clothes to add to his business inventory

loans.name: G.s. Baltodano Group

texts.es: La señora Ivana Jamileth tiene 23 años, es madre soltera con un hijo de 5 años de edad. Ella se dedica a la hojalatería, es decir la elaboración de pailas, peroles, cucharones todo de aluminio, luego esta mercadería la traslada al mercado de Masaya en donde ya tiene los compradores a los cuales les entrega el producto. Este negocio surgió desde hace 4 años, con recursos propios muy limitados y luego fue incrementándolo. Este negocio lo aprendió de su papa.  Ella está solicitando este crédito con el propósito invertirlo en la compra de materiales para así producir más y obtener de esta manera mayores ganancias. Otro integrante de este grupo es Don Luis Guillermo, el cual tiene 55 años, vive con su familia que es de 3 personas, es decir el, su esposa y un hijo. El señor también se dedica a la elaboración de utensilios de cocina de aluminio, los cuales los elabora en su casa de habitación y luego los vende en el mercado. Este negocio está ubicado en su casa de habitación, tiene 8 años de dedicarse a este negocio, cabe señalarse su familia fue quien le enseño este trabajo desde hace mas de 22 años. El señor solicito este crédito con el objetivo de invertir en materia prima para su negocio que sirva de fuente de ingresos para su familia en general.
texts.en: Señora Ivana Jamileth is 23 and is a single mother of a 5-year-old son.  She makes a living by making metal objects like pots, pans, and aluminum spoons.  She then takes her merchandise to the Masaya market where she has buyers to whom she sells her products.  She started this business 4 years ago with her own, very limited resources, and grew it from there.  She learned how to do this work from her father.  She is requesting this loan with the goal of investing in the purchase of materials to produce more and to obtain better profits.  Another member of this group is Don Luis Guillermo, who is 55.  He lives with his family, which is made up of 3 people:  himself, his wife, and his son.  He also makes aluminum kitchen materials, which he makes in his house and then sells at the market.  This business is located in his home.  He has had it for 8 years.  It's worth pointing out that his family taught him how to do this work more than 22 years ago.  He requested this loan with the objective of investing in raw materal for his business, which will serve as income for his family.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
M. Joseph is a client of Pearl Microfinance from Kyenjojo. He is 42 years old and married with 4 children. He is a businessman involved in tea growing. He grows the tea from his shamba (fields) and sells to Mabale Tea factory in Kisangi. He is helped by shamba boys whom he temporarily employs. He is able to make 300,000 UGX as weekly profits and he also sells produce and timber from the same area.

Joseph was born in a tea growing home and is very hardworking, which helps him be successful in this business. At the moment, Joseph has a new livestock farm and he needs a loan to be able to put structures on this farm and to buy fertilizers for it.

loans.use: to put structures on the farm and to buy fertilizers

loans.name: Noemi Luz

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN RAFAEL”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Noemí; ella tiene 51 años de edad, casada y tiene 4 hijos; La socia tiene su negocio de ferretería lleva años trabajando en este negocio, la ferretería está ubicado en su misma casa, la socia trabaja conjuntamente con su esposo.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de más mercadería para su negocio.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
Noemí is a member of the 'San Rafael' community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Noemí is 51 years old.  She is married and has four children.  She has a hardware business where she has been working for years.  It is located in her own home and she works together with her husband.

Noemí is requesting this loan to buy more merchandise for her business.  She is happy to be receiving a loan and she pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise for her business

loans.name: Los Alcatraces De Peña Group

texts.es: Este grupo decidió ponerse el nombre de Los Alcatraces de Peña ya que todas ellas coinciden en que los  alcatraces son muy bellos y se identifican con ellos, y de peña por que viven en Monte de Peña.  Maria S. G. es la tesorera del grupo tiene 42 años de edad,es casada y tiene dos hijos: uno de 9 y otro de 19 años de edad, desde hace 22 años se dedica ala fabricación de bolsas, mochilas y maletas. En su domicilio tiene un cuartito donde guarda sus máquinas de coser y material para la elaboración de las mochilas; ella solicita un crédito para acondicionar un espacio para su taller de costura, donde pueda colocar más maquinas y asi aumentar su producción.  Con la ganancia obtenida tiene pensado terminar de poner piso firme en su casa y comprar ropa para sus hijos.
texts.en:
This group decided to call themselves Los Alcatraces de Peña (The Lilies of Peña) because they all agree that calla lilies ("alcatraces") are beautiful and the women identify with them.  They added "de Peña" because they live in Monte de Peña.

Maria S. G. is the group's treasurer.  She is 42 years old, married, and has two children: one is 9 years old and the other is 19.  For 22 years she has made bags, backpacks and suitcases.  She has a little room in her house where she keeps her sewing machines and the material for making the backpacks.  Maria is asking for a loan to set up a space for her sewing workshop where she can put more machines and therefore increase her production.  She is thinking about using the extra earnings to finish putting flooring in her house and to buy clothes for her children.

loans.use: Construction materials for sewing workshop

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua D. sells provisions and kitchen utensils at Abura. Ekua has completed her education through junior high school. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a blacksmith. She assists her husband in order to educate her children. Her customers are asking for other types of utensils. She is requesting to use the loan to acquire other types of utensils to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest back into the business.

loans.use: To acquire kitchen utensils to sell

loans.name: Cyrus

texts.en:
Cyrus M. is a married man. His wife is a teacher and they have two children, aged eleven years old and eight years old. Cyrus owns a general store in which he sells different items including school bags, sweets, sodas and many other items. His business is located near the busy Jogoo Road where he finds customers easily.

 He has been in this business for nineteen years now and has managed to provide employment to two people. He says that this business is profitable and the major challenge he has is harassment from corrupt local authorities. However, he works very hard from early morning to late evening to keep his business doing well.

 He is using his loan of 50,000 KES to buy more bags and restock his general store to grow his business and meet the demand of his customers. In future, he hopes to acquire more space to expand his business, educate his children, and develop his plot of land by building on it. He describes himself as resilient.

loans.use: more school bags for resale
